Reviews.Title: “Premium Location”
Reviews.Author: shining d
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a premium location 3 blocks from Pier 39 for shopping and restaurants. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Even though we were not told the hotel lobby was under renovations, the hotel staff were very helpful with anything we required. Concierge desk was extremely helpful with tourist information and any questions we had. The free wine at 5pm each evening was a nice touch. We had an inside room so did not hear any street noise. Restaurant at the hotel I thought was bit overpriced for the amount of food, better value and selection of restaurants at pier 39. I would stay here again due to the comfortable rooms & great service.

Reviews.Title: “As always, very nice”
Reviews.Author: beckahmac
Reviews.Content: I would have given a 5 star rating, but the hotel failed to inform me in both telephone conversations we had prior to my visit that there would be renovation happening during my stay. Although a minor inconvenience, it was nonetheless an inconvenience to have what my son referred to as the "fake lobby." To be fair: the bed was comfy, the room was clean, and the staff was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “The more I travel, the more I appreciate Best Western Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Josephine580
Reviews.Content: And no, I'm not an employee or associate of the company! When my husband and I booked at short notice into the Tuscan Inn, we were resigned to the fact we'd be staying in a main San Francisco tourist area, and that the hotel might be noisy and busy. What a surprise to find that although the hotel was quite full, there was nevertheless a lovely laid-back air to the place. Our room was quiet, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the food in the adjacent restaurant very good indeed. The restaurant staff were delightful (particularly Nick) and the hotel is situated very conveniently for public transport - the best way to travel in San Fancisco. (It's a short walk to the cable car to downtown and a bus stop is directly across the road). The airport shuttle was also convenient to arrange. Having stayed in other Best Westerns on various trips, I can only say that our experiences with this chain have generally been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, but I think a lot of it has to do with noisy construction”
Reviews.Author: pagetravelers
Reviews.Content: Check in took over 30 minutes and is very awkwardly set up. The last thing you want to do is stand in line waiting to check in after you have been flying all day. The check in girls seemed to be answering questions on where to eat, what tour to take, what to go see. Isn't this what the area labeled CONCIERGE is for? The noise is very loud due to jack hammers. Plastic is hung up everywhere, so you must walk through stairwells and such to get to your car. Elevators were working fine, but they had to post signs as to where to get off to get to the "lobby." The wine hour was nice, but I was a little upset that I had to go back up to my room to get my ID. Don't you have to be 21 to get a hotel room anyway? They did put out some little pizzas, which was a nice addition to the wine. No breakfast in the am, which is disappointing, but they did offer different coffees, teas, water, and mimosas, so that was a nice added touch, but not good on an empty stomach. What really gets me is the $44 a day parking! YIKES!!! So even if you think you are getting a good price on the hotel, if you are bringing a car, make sure to add that in with it to really see how much you are paying. Also, the rooms are very tiny. We have had bigger rooms in NYC! We would look elsewhere if we went back to SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Holephilly
Reviews.Content: Even though the son had to sleep on the floor because there was no where for him to sleep, We enjoyed every bit of experience in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Under LOUD Renovation”
Reviews.Author: ashuppe
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in at the Best Western Tuscan Inn. As previously stated the hotel lobby was under renovation, but they had a temporary lobby set up in the ball room. We did have to carry our luggage up a flight of stairs, but there were many there who volunteered to help. We were given a room on the first floor which seemed to be fine, except that if street noise bother's you the outside rooms have windows that are against the sidewalk and street thus making it slightly noisy during the night. We were in Room 123 and although we did get over the street noise, the room was right next to the lobby that was under renovation. There was only a plastic cover in what I assume must have once been the door. This cause us 2 problems the following morning. First, they were working on tearing up the old flooring and by about 8:30 in the morning they were running loud machinery in order to do this. It was so loud in our room that we could not hear each other speak or hear the television. It is a good thing that we were on East coast time and that we didn't want to come back to the room mid-day to relax. Secondly, the dust that was produced from the work easily came in through the plastic cover over the hole where the lobby door use to be. The man working at the front desk that morning was more than willing to let us switch rooms, but with all of our stuff already strewn about in the room I felt this was an inconvenience. He did offer us breakfast for the two mornings of our stay in the hotel restaurant which was a very nice thing to do. I felt that the room was a nice size, nicely furnished, and overall the staff was wonderful. However, the fact is that I feel the rooms near the construction should not have been given to anyone unless it was at a reduced rate and that the customers are given prior warning as to what they may encounter. We had no warning that it would be that loud when we were given the room and we were paying the same amount as others staying on a higher floor, away from both the street and construction noise. If the construction noise and issues had not occurred I would rank the hotel as a nice one, but I felt we were taken advantage of by being given this room that even the desk clerk cringed at the next morning when I told him which room I was complaining about.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: sandy t
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent! Checked in March 24th for a 4 night stay. When we checked in we had just missed the free wine hour but the girl checking us in said she would have wine sent to our room. AND she did!! So nice of her. Hugo, the concierge was wonderful. Friendly and very helpful. The second day there they started remodeling the lobby which meant the check in desk and the lobby were temporarily moved to another area. They did such a nice job trying to make things as seamless as possible. I wish I could have seen the finished remodeled lobby. I am sure it will be beautiful. The rooms were nice and clean. The location is outstanding. Close to everything in the wharf. Their is a cable car line about a block away behind the hotel. There is also a Safeway just across the street and a Trader Joe's a block away. Even the hotel restaurant was excellent. I could not have been happier with this hotel. I would strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Economical choice in San Fran...”
Reviews.Author: Sazelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on March 31, and checked out Sunday, April 1. The entire lobby was closed and relocated to one of the ball rooms inside the hotel (prior reviewers thought the renovations may have been completed but as of this past Sunday, they are still going strong). It was inconvenient to heft the luggage up the fire stairs into the hall/ballroom area, but attendants were readily available to lend a hand. Despite the makeshift concierge and check-in desk, everything went smoothly, we were given a complimentary upgrade, and as Best Western members we received a certificate for 10% off our lunch or dinner at their Cafe Pescatore downstairs. The room was one of the best sizes we've encountered in San Francisco (this being our second trip, third hotel in the city) and it was very clean. We asked for a courtyard view room so it would be quieter, but I imagine once you get above the second floor, the view from the street-facing rooms would be very nice. It is a very convenient location to Fisherman's Wharf and restaurants, also. If you plan to stay there any time soon, be advised renovations will be going on. However, if you're using it for one night, or don't plan to be using the lobby a great deal, it suits just fine, especially for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “If you must stay at Fisherman's Wharf...”
Reviews.Author: bangsibear
Reviews.Content: Our traveling companions picked the location - I would not ordinarily stay at Fisherman's Wharf. The room was small and there are minimal amenities - no health club, one computer in the lobby. Our package included half price parking - otherwise, it's $45/night. Happy hour in the lobby was literally "2 buck chuck" from the trader joe's across the way.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip To San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: sarahhowell3
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 4pm off flight from London. Staff at check inn very helpful. Porter took our bags to our room. Our room was very big consiting of 2 double beds. As we were a family of 4 ( 2 Adults and 2 teens). Room could have had brighter colours but as we were only sleeping there we didn't mind. Hotel located in Fishermans Wharf a 5 minute walk from Pier 39. We were about a 20 minute walk from the Alcatraz Dock. Good central location. Restraunt down stairs. Free tea and coffee in lobby in the morning. At about 5pm there was a free wine reception down stairs where you could have wine and the kids could have soft drinks and some snacks. Nice reception area and manger was very friendly. Taxi service to airport cost 30 dollars a lot cheapeir than on the way their.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and experience!”
Reviews.Author: glassboro
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nites after our cruise. We found this hotel very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and customer-focused.They were very helpful in making shuttle arrangements for the airport. The concierge gave us great tips on how to best get to see the Golden Gate Bridge using public transportation. Location was excellent! All within walking distance- Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Pier 35 (cruise ship) and Pier 33 (Alcatraz tours), Lombard St, Cable car. We also enjoyed their nice complimentary wine "happy hour". We will definitely stay at this hotel should we return to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “great location, horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer F
Reviews.Content: My friend and i were coming in late and needed a place to stay, only rooms were single queens, perfect for 2 people. I work at a Best Western Plus and understand availability late into the evening. The front desk guy was not very friendly and talked to us like we were stupid or something. i gave him my visa for deposit (we paid cash) and they put a 30 day hold on it!!! RIDICULOUS! i am still waiting for my 60 bucks! the room was clean but very small, and they wanted 6 bucks for a 1liter bottle of water! there was no free breakfast or discount for staying there at the restaurant. it was literally 5 bucks for 1 egg and 1 piece of toast! also it was 40 bucks just to park our car. the night cost us 200 dollars! not including the 60 im still waiting to get back. i would never treat my customers the way i was treated there! And i will NEVER stay at that hotel again. the only good thing about the hotel was it is walking distance to pier 39

Reviews.Title: “Great location - clean room - great staff”
Reviews.Author: Softball_Mom67
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed one night on a layover and had a great experience. The staff were friendly and helpful -- they even made arrangements to get us back to the airport in the morning. The location was fantastic -- only two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and a block from the Cable Car. We were able to pack in a meal at the wharf, a boat ride to the Golden Gate Bridge, a ride on a cable car and a visit to China Town topped off with Dim Sum before walking back (downhill all the way - yay) to the hotel. Even squeezed in a 4.0 earthquake in the morning. The room was clean, quiet and reasonably priced. What else could one ask for? If I had to make a tiny complaint -- they could improve the signage in the halls as there was some construction going on in the lobby that made some exits unpassable and made it a bit of a challenge to find our way out the first time. Otherwise, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: The Fury
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 1 night before a business trip in San Jose. Reception and welcome very good. Free WI-FI (code given on check in) Room was clean (if a tiny bit dated) Flat screen TV and 2 very comfortable (smallish) double beds in room. Bathroom had everything you needed. Location of this hotel is fantastic. You are far enough away from the front not to be bothered by too much noise, yet only a 5 minute walk to Pier 39 - perfect!!! I would definatley reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Really Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: kjd1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night for a visit to San Francisco. The location was perfect as we wanted to be near the Fishermans Wharf area and also close to other attractions like the cable cars. We got there early, but they valet parked our car promptly and checked our luggage. When our room was ready we got a phone call from the very very welcoming, helpful and friendly front desk folks. Our room was clean and the mirrored wall made it appear a bit more spacious than it was. When we checked out our car was there before we knew it and everything was speedy and efficient. We were especially impressed by the staff and their obvious desire to please.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bernd K
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights with our two sons and our nanny occupying two adjacent rooms. The rooms were very clean and of sufficient size. The staff is very friendly, helpful and competent. The hotel was undergoing a renovation - without disturbing the guests, so no complaints here. Only negative was the very expensive parking but I guess this is Fisherman's Wharf standard. On our next trip to San Francisco, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladylilu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for 3 nights from 3-8-12 to 3-11-12 and had a great time... I almost had a heart attack when we got there and they were doing renovations in the lobby area, however everyone in the staff was great, we got an upgrade to a suite, and they finished the work the next day... the wine reception is fantastic and the hotel is two blocks walk to /fisherman's Wharf, and all the tour bus stops... I didn't need to rent a car and really enjoyed my stay in this small and very familiar hotel, Highly recommend it Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: Donna L
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the BW Tuscan for two nights. It was a GREAT value! Our room was updated and very clean. Beds were very comfortable. Wireless is free, but you do have to pay $12 to workout down the street. Parking was $50 per day, so keep that in mind. But the location was great! We were only in our room at night - I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction - but worth staying here!”
Reviews.Author: lwolfe1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western the first week in March 2012, both times this trip on a Friday night, a week apart (since we were traveling the central coast in between!) This is not the first time I've stayed there, and I would recommend it to anyone even though they are doing a majoy rennovation of all rooms presently. The first Friday we stayed, the lobby was blocked off by construction paper and heavy plastic, and they re-reouted us to the temporary "front desk" located in a repurposed conference room. While it presented a slight inconvenience, the staff was apologetic and accomodating to oru every need. By the time we returned the followinf Friday, the lobby was re-opened, and most fo the furnishings (otehr than wall pictures) were back in place in front of the beautiful fireplace. Again, the staff welcomed us, securely valet-parked our rental car (well worth the parking fee per day) and our new room was one that had been rennovated. High class, perfectly clean, complete with a wemcome note personalized for our stay and the room was nicely appointed and had a beautiful view of their internal courtyard. We felt safe, secure and properly pampered by the staff amidt their rennovation. The value for the room was better than most right on the wharf, especially when we applied our AAA discounts! The restaurant next doro is fab, and they provide discounts for those staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: TRTW
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Best Western Plus Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf because it was conveniently located near the wharf. I was there to visit Coit Tower, the Cable Car Museum, Chinatown, Pier 39, Ghiradelli, and Alcatraz. Upon arrival you drive up to the entrance where a valet person will park the car yourself. There's no self-parking as it's all valet. By the way, it's $44 a day. The reservation clerk greeted us with a smile and explained everything to me before checking in. She gave me the room I requested. I stayed on the top floor. Upon entering the room I noticed how nicely it was decorated. The room is contemporary looking. One side of the wall was mirrored, which made the room look bigger. What I didn't like about the hotel: 1) The Bed. It was pretty flimsy. Woke up with a neck ache. Good thing I bought Bengay with me. Plus, the location of the bed was so close to the entrance and right across from the bathroom. I think it would have been better if they moved the bed closer to the window. 2) Toilet. You had to hold on to the flush otherwise it doesn't flush. 3) Bathroom. I actually have no problem with the bathroom overall but the light switch controlled the light inside the bathroom and outside. So when you wake up in the middle of the night to use the toilet you turn the light on and it shines right to the room, waking up your partner. 4) Air Conditioner. It worked but in the middle of the night it was a bit muggy. It started working again in the wee morning hours. 5) Check Out. Took a long time. Had two other people ahead of me and only one clerk. I think I waited a good 7-10 minutes just to get my receipt and turn in my keys. 6) Parking. $44 a night was a bit steep I think. What I like? 1) Staff. They were all very friendly and cordial. 2) The Restaurant. It was conveniently located next to the hotel. They serve breakfast until 10 a.m. They also do room service. 3) Location. It was walking distance to Ghiradelli (a good 15 minute walk), Pier 39 and retail (Cost Plus and Ross). 4) Room Decor. It was contemporary and the room was clean. 5) Fireplace in the Lobby. Adds ambience to the place. 6) Wi-fi Connection. The computer wi-fi connection was actually fast. Overall, the hotel was very good. I will most likely stay here again when I decide to stay near the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “nice but a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DavidCamp
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, but I like a room with more window space, sunshine, and views, none of which I had, despite getting a top floor room with a view request. It was clean, the beds were nice, things were quiet, but I expected better. I also was surprised with the $40/night parking fee. And the room air never seemed very fresh except when I kept the bathroom fan on with the window open. Next time I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Places to Stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: friendontheroad
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers and have visited San Francisco on many occassions. We have stayed in different locations there. Tuscan Inn Fisherman's Wharf is one of the nicest and most pleasant places we have ever stayed when traveling-anywhere. We also felt this to be one of the safer areas for night walking when staying in Sn Francisco. We would gladly stay at Tuscan Inn again. The Tuscan Inn manager is Ed Sincoff. We met Ed for the first time when we stayed there recently. Ed is a very nice and capable businessman. I found Ed to be running a really nice hotel and learned he was respected by those who work for him. Jose is the gentleman at the front desk who I seemed to reach most often when I phoned the Inn. Jose and the numerous fellow staff people, I discovered, are very friendly and knowledgable. I noticed among everyone from clerks to cleaning people, to parking valets, all seemed to be enjoying their jobs at the Tuscan Inn and sharing San Francisco with visitors. Tuscan Inn is a larger, yet quaint, hotel centrally located in the Fisherman Wharf area of San Francisco. From the standpoint of the physical rooms, we choose upgraded rooms allowing us a bedroom seperated from the living room. This allowed privacy for office work, and privacy to enjoy the second LCD TV. The king bed was great- soft enough to be comfy and firm enough to allow wonderful sleep. While we were there I slept through the 4.0 earthquake. (Great bed!) The bath was a larger comfortable size, and had marble. The shower was wonderful with a lot of hot water and excellent pressure. The bath had an exhause fan. The room was clean and inviting. There were plenty of windows and they opened for ventilation. The heat/AC units were very efficent. The hotel itself is undergoing lobby renovation which may be done as of this writing. The new marble outside the building entry is very beautiful, as will be the new details being finished in the building lobby. There are two elevators, both with ample room. We seemingly never had to wait more than seconds for the elevator to arrive. The hotel does have a free coffee/tea bar in the mornings, and a managers free wine tasting each evening. The hotel has a nicer restaurant located in its building just feet from the entry. Plus the Fisherman Wharf area has all types of food, in all price ranges within walking distance any direction. (You must try the sour dough bread for breakfest Just two blocks onto the wharf. It is delicious!) If you need any supplies while at the Inn, there is a major drug store one-minute away on a neighboring block, and a Trader Joe grocery two-minutes walk on another street. I did see airport vans stopping at the Tuscan Inn. Plus Cable cars, retro trolley cars, regular large city buses and taxis are available within brief minutes of the Inn. For this reason your car is not necessary in the wharf area and can be cumbersome in most of San Francisco. But if you do have your car Tuscan Inn has a parking garage on premesis. Be aware, parking in San Francisco is not cheap-anywhere! If you are adventuresome and want to play ticket roulete with the meter people, you can park free overnight-until 7AM on many meters in the wharf area. But do read all parking signs carefully. There are more than 40 ways to get a parking ticket in SF. If you enjoy walking, Alcatraz tour boats are walkable from the Inn. If you want to sight see, why not walk to the Powell-Market street trolley and ride it across the city, and change cable cars to go yet another direction. Then on the way back, get off the cable car in China Town. Enjoy yourself shopping and sight seeing and then walk back down the hill to Tuscan Inn. By then you will understand why my family believed Tuscan Inn is one of the best places to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, dated property”
Reviews.Author: Shaunr52
Reviews.Content: Once lobby and room renovations are completed, this hotel will likely be a 4+ property. Hotel is located within walking distance to the tourist areas of San Fran and is only a $10 cab ride from Unoin Square restaurants. The staff is excellent, from the friendly people at the front desk, the bell staff and the manager at the wine reception it was clear that this hotel emphasizes and delivers high customer service. The only real downside to this hotel was a lack of amenties-no pool or hot tub (though this is not expected given the area), no complimentary breakfast and no fitness center. We were upgraded to a King Plus room which had an added pull out couch and slightly larger seating area. The rooms and furniture seemed to be very dated and are definitely in need of a makeover-which is scheduled for this year. That said, the room was comfortable and reasonably well appointed. The wine service was a nice touch and worth attending if you happen to be at the hotel when it is on but i wouldn't build it into my itinerary. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay near the Fisherman's Wharf area at a reasonable price and i would definitely look into staying here again if only to see the finished product once the renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, lovely people, easy access to Great public transportation.”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisMaude
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on a business trip. Very helpful friendly staff (both at the front desk and housekeeping folks on the floor). Clean, comfortable room with cheerful but not overpowering decor. Clean, roomy bathroom. It would have been nice to get a discount for the Lobby construction, though it did not get in my way much. I used only public transportation, and can't say enough about how GREAT the Muni system is in San Francisco! A call to local 511 gets you a live person who helps you figure out how to get anywhere. This a great location for using public transit, a bus stop across the street and the trolley line a block away. Also a great location for walking to a lot of sites, or renting a bike. There is Trader Joe's and a Safeway grocery store within a block, and the room has a mini fridge (no microwave) so it's easy to feed yourself cheaply for breakfast and lunch. My only complaint: Avoid rooms with connecting doors to another, unless you are there as a family. The connecting doors allow you to hear EVERYTHING from the adjoining room, so you'll share conversations and running water at the least, use your imagination for the rest! I stayed here last year as well in a room without an adjoining room and don't recall any noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great value”
Reviews.Author: 6Minny
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to San Francisco and stayed at this hotel after doing a lot of research on area hotels. I would not choose this hotel next time at all. Upon arriving, I was shocked to see that the entire lobby that was shown on the website was not there! It was cordoned off as it was undergoing renovations. Every day of our stay was a different detour from the one working elevator as the workmen changed their location. The "lobby" during our stay was a conference room. Not exactly the welcoming scene with the fireplace and coziness I expected to see. How about a mention about the renovations on the website that touts the "ambiance" of this lobby so the guest can decide if they want to stay on a construction site ? Or do what other hotels do and reduce your room rate a few percent for the guest who arrives expecting what they were shown on the website? And why "two buck chuck" for the wine reception when you are so close to Napa? There must be another inexpensive wine option? We stayed in a "renovated" room that was 300 sq. ft at best, tiny double beds, view of an alley, no screen on the window, and crappy mattresses and pillows. Hard to believe it's now a Kimpton property. I found I wasn't alone with my disappointment. I spoke with other guests who felt the same way. The plus was a reduced fee for hybrid parking, only 29.00/night compared to 45.00/night for other cars, and a great restaurant next door called Cafe Pescatore. The location to Fisherman's wharf was nice, but the other hotels I looked into like Radisson and Sheraton were closer.

Reviews.Title: “In transition?”
Reviews.Author: Nestless
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay here and we were a bit disappointed. The hotel was under renovation, which we were unaware of when the reservation was made, so the lovely lobby area we remembered was out of commission. Wine and munchies were still served in the evenings, which was nice, though minus ambiance. The room, while clean and comfortable, was much smaller than we remembered, and our window faced a wall--this with BW Gold status (it was really quiet, though). No breakfast is offered, though there is a nice little restaurant next door--be aware that they do not open until 9 am though, which was inconvenient as we had an early flight (there is a Denny's not too far away). All that said, the location is still great and internet is free

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: MBarnet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a special family weekend in March of 2012. One thing that was going on when we arrived was that their hotel lobby was undergoing a renovation. We stayed on the second floor and did not hear any of the construction noise, though. They had re-located their front lobby into the room they usually use as their afternoon wine hour - no problems on checking in and the valet took our car right away. The concierge offered some tips on how to get to the CA Academy of Sciences in Golden Gate Park and we had a great day there. We walked from the hotel to Boudin's on Fisherman's Wharf for dinner and had a fantastic meal (try the mussells and garlic fries and of course, the sourdough bread!). The rooms are on the small size but offer all the amenities one could want (safe and frig in the room - you can put your items in frig to keep cold - no sensors). Very helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with personality”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of January 2012 and found it a very enjoyable experience. The hotel is located a couple of blocks away from Pier 39 and the cable car terminal and so is ideally placed for sightseeing and getting to all parts of San Francisco. The reason I am writing this review is not the hotel location but the friendly and helpful attitude of the staff and the quality of the rooms and service. There is an excellent Italian restaurant and bar linked to the hotel reception area. However, the main attraction for me was that the hotel Manager holds a very friendly session every afternoon at 5 p.m. in the reception area with a selection of free local wines and pizza. It gives a unique opportunity to meet and talk with other guests from around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the area”
Reviews.Author: FlySwim
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn is a fine choice if you get a nice price (we paid $119/night over President's Day weekend, and asked for a king upgrade) or want to be near Fisherman's Wharf (but two blocks away, so you can also avoid that mess if you choose). The nautical theme is a nice touch, and the place is quiet even if you face the street. I would certainly come again. The room had a clean, cozy feel, and we were given a king facing Mason St. after being stuck in a queen room facing an airshaft. The staff was fine, if not super friendly -- the place is really busy, so they seem somewhat distracted. This place is run by Kimpton, but it truly feels more like a Best Western (you don't get Kimpton points, only BW). It is standard, not luxurious. Some things were not so good. The bathroom products sucked, and so did the bathroom itself. The bed was just ok, and the pillows weak. The TV was not the best, though supposedly new. But I found the room relaxing. The street (North Point) in front is busy, but still fairly quiet, especially at night. Parking is easy to find on the street, so no need to valet. You just need to put money in the meter from early in the morning (7am), and watch the no-parking hours (middle of the night) because the days change depending on the location. Within a few blocks are a Walgreens, a Chase bank, a Safeway and a Trader Joe's. Pat's Cafe is a good local brunch place on Taylor, and Hollywood Cafe down the block was busy for brunch though we didn't try it. Overall, there are not so many good restaurants close by, but the area is really convenient to North Beach, and you can catch a bus or cab to Chinatown, Polk St., Russian Hill, Nob Hill, and the Marina. Telegraph Hill is walkable -- we saw Coit Tower from our room. Taxis were easy to find, since Fisherman's Wharf is so close. Given the other options, and the cost of most places in the city, this worked out just fine. Don't expect top-notch, but the Tuscan Inn is charming enough with some convenient perks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: dc4Vermont
Reviews.Content: The Best WesternTuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf is a nice hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area. The rooms/bathrooms are clean and the beds comfortable. The staff are all friendly and seem to want to ensure you have a wonderful stay. There is a restaurant at the property that seemed to be busy (usually a good sign), but we never tried it. The hotel is not 5 Star quality - but neither are the prices in this typically expensive part of the city. The hotel is currently undergoing renovation, but work takes place during the hours of 9-5, and we never heard the work going on. This hotel is owned by Kimpton Hotels (one of our favorite hotel chains and how we found it) - but continues to be run as a Best Western property. They did offer a 5-6 PM wine hour as typically occurs at Kimpton properties. There are two grocery stores open late about a block away to pick up snacks/beverages to bring back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Timbernard
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, not smart, but well located and great atitude bt staff. The restaurant was great. Perfect food and no need to travel to the seedy part of Fishermans Wharf

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Brewcee
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, free Internet, new flat screen tv. Only downfall is the rooms are not that big, but we didn't spend a whole lot of time in it, so not an issue,

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: imissneworleans
Reviews.Content: Three friends enjoyed the King + sleeper sofa room. It was well appointed, clean, comfortable. There was plenty of room for suitcases and unpacking. It was a little loud from street noises so I slept well with ear plugs. We enjoyed the free coffee and tea in the morning and the free wine in the evening. The bed, sheets and pillows were comfortable. I liked the big drawer in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will return!”
Reviews.Author: SimadisFamily
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, a great location.Every staff member was personable, and just great, but Keith,the manager, stood out.He really made our stay wonderful, making certain that we had everything we needed.You can tell that Keith is a person who likes people.Beautiful lobby,well-decorated with plump sofas and chairs and fireplace.Very inviting.Rooms were modern,and clean, not even a dot of mildew in the spacious bathroom.Comfortable beds,quite rooms,each with coffeemaker and mini bar.Lovely courtyard view from our room.Concierge service to help you plan your sightseeing,and friendly and helpful porters.There is an airport shuttle service or a town car that you can take to the airport.Ask at the desk. Our only complaint was the toiletries... two people in a room, and there was only one small bar of soap at the sink in the bathroom,and one shampoo,one conditioner, in the shower.Another bar of soap should have been in the shower,and two bottles of shampoo and conditioner should have been given.I called the hotel prior to arrival,to ask if lotion was included in the amenities and was told it was, however,it was not in the room.We had to ask at the desk for it.The next day, I had to ask for a second bar of soap and the other things we needed.It would have been nice if the hotel was a bit more generous with these small things that make a difference. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definately book this hotel on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel at Fishermans Warf”
Reviews.Author: LeonKay
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival just before Christmas 2011 we were welcomed in a friendly way by Thanh at reception. A helpful and friendly porter assisted us with our luggage to the room that was found to be immaculate and clean. Although we were under the impression that we had reserved a two bedroom unit, we discovered that it contained two beds in a single room. Back at reception Thanh offered to upgrade us at a reduced rate to a room that had a separate sleeper couch in the lounge. The hotel does not have a complimentary breakfast although tea and coffee is offered in the lounge between 6:00 & 10:00. In the evenings a complimentary managers wine reception is offered where pizza slices and drinks are served in the lounge by the adjoining CafÃ© Pescatore. This hotel is very centrally situated near all the happenings at Fishermans Warf. We were able to walk to the departure point of our tour that took us to Alcatraz Island and the Golden Gate Bridge. Several fast food outlets as well as the Ghirardelli Square and the cable car departure points are within walking distance. A have already recommended this hotel to a colleague.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chris8011
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel because i wanted to stay near the Fisherman's Wharf, during our stay in San Francisco. I wanted easy access to the Wharf and all that was nearby. Overall,we had a great stay and I would stay here again. We had a King room,which was large,clean and comfortable. We did get a bit of truck noise at about 5am.Due to the nearby grocery shop. I was very pleased with the location. Easy walking to the Wharf and Alcatraz tour boats. We enjoyed the nightly wine tastings. As we were there during winter,we never got out to Napa Valley. So,it was good, trying local wines in the Hotel lobby. Yes,great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: catmar4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the BW Tuscan Inn last fall and loved our stay. I thought the hotel was perfectly situated. The weather was great so we basically walked everywhere...the Wharf, Ghiradelli Square all the way up to the Embacadero area(we love to walk!). There is a cable car stop right around the corner from the Inn so traveling to Union Square was easy. I know I'm in the minority here but I actually preferred the area in which the Tuscan was located to the Union Square area but that's just me. The hotel itself was very nice. Small but quiet and spotless! I'd contacted them before our visit and told them we'd be celebrating our anniversary. I also requested a coutyard room. Both were ready and waiting for us when we arrived. Enjoyed our stay and loved the city of SF!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a visit to Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: ThatTravelinJones
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place located about 2 blocks off of the "main drag" of Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel was clean and the front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Hotel rooms were nice but a bit on the small side. We were on a hallway that had windows that faced a 4' wide alley and the side of the next building Not the best view, but then again, we didn't stay in the room much as we were out exploring. Take heed of other reviewers when they say that the parking is expensive. We flew in and took the shuttle to the airport since we were going to just be wandering around, but if you have a car, call the hotel in advance to find out the current rate or if they have any "stay and park" kind of specials going on.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here many times and plan to go again in June.”
Reviews.Author: magnolia1e
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest Best Western hotels we have ever stayed in. Nice, clean rooms, excellent staff, perfect location, free "happy hour" even. You can walk to just about anywhere you'd want to go in the Warf area. There is a gym close by that we jog to, work out and jog back. There is complimentary coffee in the morning. We have only eaten breakfast in the hotel and it was fabulous! The concierge has been very helpful every time we have used the service. Can't wait to go back to San Francisco knowing that we have a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: nanciface
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while my husband was taking a course at a nearby hotel. The lobby is very welcoming with a fireplace, comfortable sitting area and complimentary coffee in morning and wine in evening. The room was very small, luckily situated over an inner courtyard, so very quiet. Bathroom seemed updated and was adequate. The bed was way too soft and not too comfortable for someone used to a firm bed. The room had a sofa, coffee table and desk with chair, also free wireless internet, so a good place for my husband to get some work done. Did not eat at their restaurant, even their breakfasts were very expensive. Instead, I highly recommend walking a block down the street to the Hollywood Cafe where the breakfast is great! I can't really figure out why this is a Kimpton and a Best Western. The only Kimpton perk was the free coffee and wine. The other perks associated with being an In-Touch member did not apply here.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: rackman0000
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to wharf, cable cars and etc. Small rooms but very nice. Excellent service. Loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Melboune, Australia”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Location was great with the wharf, tours and restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The atmosphere at the wine tasting each night was warm and friendly and open to all guests. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations and then some!”
Reviews.Author: Jdandik
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean room w/very comfy down blankets and a great shower.. literally just a few blocks from the wharf and our fav, fisherman's grotto :) quick valet and check in/out was a breeze.. If you don't plan on using your car for the trip, they'll honor a $35/night fee, which is about the lowest you'll find in the wharf (we booked a special through travelzoo and parking was only $15/night!!! much to our surprise).. We walked everywhere and accomplished all we set out for! Coit tower (.7), alcatraz (few blocks to peir 33), uss pompanito (few blocks to the wharf), cable cars (few blocks).. Each night returned, our room was clean and all fully stocked and we could just sit back and relax.. Def recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: peter_somerset_uk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and had no complaints. The hotel is in an excellent location for Fishermans Wharf and just a block away from the cable car stop. We found the staff to be very friendly and our room was clean and well equipped (not much of a view). If you are taking a car I would recommend pre-booking the hotel parking because this can be quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Suzy2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Tuscan Inn with our sons and loved the decor and size of our room. The Tuscan Inn is in an amazing location, just around the corner from the tram, 5 minutes to Fisherman's wharf and opposite a little shopping arcade where we found a nice little Chinese restaurant for lunch. The hotel is in a great location for families with older kids who can go off to Fisherman's wharf and do their own thing. There is something for everyone in the vicinity and Macy's was just a tram ride away. We especially loved the nightly wine tradition and mingled and met interesting people from all around the world. The staff were helpful with holding luggage and arranging airport transfers. Very happy!

Reviews.Title: “If only it was a real kimpton hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Ysnan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is now owned by kimpton. But the standards of the room, overall interior design and hotel restaurants... are way not meeting this standard yet. More Best Western (as it used to be). The room was small, the TV was huuge and old and the noise was terrible. The hotel has loads of potential and the location is good. SF hotels are priced really high in general. This hotel would be a 80 dollar a night one normally I guess.. If it wasn't in expensive SF. I would recommend a hotel in Tiburon or one of the other towns at the other end of the water. There are ferries going to and from SF center untill late. Kimpton please makeover this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple but dated”
Reviews.Author: EJK80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights for business. The staff were very helpful and the lobby had quite good ambience but in a "your grandma's lounge room" type of way. The room looked a bit dated but the fittings in the bathroom were fine, the bed was actually really comfortable, but the lighting options were poor and it was a really old TV. There aren't many facilities but the breakfast at the restaurant was good. I didn't have a chance to join the wine reception, but one is held every night from 5 or 6pm. The location to both the Trolley, Fisherman's wharf and Embarcadero is good, but this area of town is looking very washed out and faded. Overall, it was FINE - not great, just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Snoozeee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in an excellent location for Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39.Both are literally 5-10mins walking distance away.Restaurant at hotel very good. Only downside was the beds were too soft for our liking which resulted in backache for both of us that lasted our whole stay,so if you require a firm mattress this isn't the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate lodging but dated room”
Reviews.Author: Kirk K
Reviews.Content: My family spent a couple nights here during the Christmas holiday. The service was excellent but we were a bit disappointed by the room itself. While it was clean, the furnishings were dated and tired. The carpet could use refreshing, the paint on the bathroom ceiling had bubbles and faint stains, and most telling, the vintage Sony CRT television actually had an anti-theft alarm cable attached to it. Hard to imagine that the theft of hefty old TVs is a problem these days. The location at Fisherman's Wharf is excellent. We didn't take advantage of the internet access and no one mentioned the wine reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: cruisincoupleReno
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying here it was very clean and a nice location.It was 2 blocks from wharf and quite rooms a little onthe small side but it is an older place.The on sight restaurant. was very good for breakfast and the bar was great due to Seth the bartender(mean drink maker) . The only down side was 50$ to park but it is the wharf. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, slow valet.”
Reviews.Author: dhknhall
Reviews.Content: My wife and two daughters spent one night here Tuesday 12-27-2011. The rooms was very clean and comfortable. We had a room with two double beds. Two queen beds would probably fit in the room but it would be tight. Yes the overnight parking is $44.00. But parking at any hotel near the wharf is expensive so we expected this. The hotel is an easy walk to the wharf and Pier 39. Only had one problem when we left Wednesday morning. I attempted to call down to the valet to have our car brought around three times. No answer. We proceeded to the front desk to check out. The gentleman at the front desk radioed the valet to have our car brought around. We waited and waited. I saw many other people getting their cars who came well after us. I had to go to the valet again and give him our car number. We again waited and waited. I had to give our car number to another valet who finally brought our car around. We waited 40 minutes to get our car. The hotel needs to improve the efficiency of it's valet staff or hire more valets to be on site during the morning hours. Other than the valet issue, if you want to be close to the wharf and get a clean, comfortable room, the Tuscan Inn is the place. I rated the service as average only because of the valet. All other employees were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kareno38
Reviews.Content: A short walk to Fishermans Wharf, cable car terminus and Alcatraz tour. Rooms were on the small side but quite adeqate. Breakfast wasn't included but the adjoining cafe had a good choice. There was a (free) wine reception every evening in the cosy lounge and the FREE internet and printing was a real bonus. It was s little tired in places but overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: toastySquirrel
Reviews.Content: First off I read the reviews before booking this place. There were some negatives but it seemed for such a high rating and hotel price it would be good. I was so wrong. We stayed in several Best Westerns on on this trip and this was by far the most expensive; double and even triple the price. We paid $200 for the room and expected alot. We got nothing. First you can't park your own car, it's valet only so when you first come in you have hand over money for the valet and bellman. Second right away you pay parking. We paid over $100 for a the stay. So before we even got in our room you are up to $300. The staff was nice and prompt, I give them that. We get to our room and its TINY. The room has has cheap tacky decor. We had a window and we opened the shades we get a brick wall. Double tacky. On our nightstands were bottles of water they advertised for $6, I find this really really tacky. The room had flaws like wallpaper coming off in the bathroom and grout that needed to be fixed. Also there is no breakfast. But they sure did advertise for a restaurant next door in which they offered cold cereal, yogurt and juice for $12. Really are people that insane that they think that is acceptable price for that? The only thing good about the room was the comforter, linens and mattress were better than other hotels. The location is okay, there are hotels closer to the pier and we had to walk several blocks to reach hot spots. I see nothing good about this hotel. I stayed at another BW which had full hot breakfast, bigger rooms, great views and was much cheaper. BW should be ashamed for charging this much for a less than average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan Inn San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: meosnana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in November and had a lovely time. The staff were all cery friendly and helpful ,the room was very clean and the free wine hour was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Tuscan Inn Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: The hotel charge for anything that is supposed to be included as part of the stay in the hotel. Water to drink is charged - the hotel does not offer complimentary water, not even two bottles where most hotels do. No cable tv - movies for watch is above $15 + taxes or more. There were no blankets in the bed - only a small, light cover sheet. Parking is $55 per each night stay - if you want to park in their premises. Microwave is $25 per each night of use. A 4x4 pizza is close to $30. Room maintenance crew doesn't replace coffe and sugar packs if you open it. Also they don't replace your tiny shampoo and conditioner bottles and don't even offers a tiny lotion bottle, where in most hotels that is standard. There were other things that shocked me with this hotel but the most important thing for you is that you watch for your credit card once given to the hotel. They will automatically hold about 10% to 20% of your money in addition to what they will charge for the room, in case you decide to use any items inside the refrigerator, room service, watch movies, etc., even if you don't use anything from their premises they will take the money out of your credit card regardless. Accounting also makes too many mistakes in your charges. My sister said that they probably take more money from your credit card to use it temporarily in the stock market to make money for them using your money. Please, consider other hotels around and don't stay at the Best Western Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip with family”
Reviews.Author: akrizek
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here over a weekend in November to see the normal tourist sites in San Fransisco while passing through. The Tuscan Inn has a very good location to walk to all the sites or get to cable car access if not. Plus it has a grocery store just one block to the east for anything our kids needed and to stock up for driving. The room was comfy, and I share the pain some guest had with cold showers in the evening, but it was fine the next morning (timing I guess). The parking in this part of the city is a bit steep, but it's the same everywhere so it's not exactly avoidable by shopping around. If you're in the hotel in the evening, the wine tasting is great. On a personal note, the staff at this location were especially helpful when I left some personal property in the room after check out. They worked with me to get an address to send it to me very quickly afterward. Special thanks to Fannie of housekeeping for helping me out.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: ParisPeaprincess
Reviews.Content: Not a boutique hotel. We asked for a quiet room and we got one. The people at the desk were helpful and friendly. Near Fisherman's wharf but not with ocean view but a short walk away. Big and somewhat old-fashioned. The room was comfortable but the price was really high.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: DocLawDog
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed her going and coming back from Alaska. It is a great location to visit Fisherman's Wharf, access the cable cars, and shop at the tourista places if you want. There are stores all around if you need anything. The best part was the attached restaurant. The food was great and the service was fine. We shipped our suitcases ahead of us and the staff at this hotel took care of them until we got there. Our cruise ship was stricken by the Noro Virus, so by the time we got off the ship neither one of us was feeling very good. It was nice to check back into this hotel and have things close at hand. We were able to find a shipping outlet very close to the hotel to take our suitcases so we could send them home ahead of us. The staff at this hotel was friendly and helpful..provided us with maps so we could find Chinatown and so we could negotiate our way around Fisherman's Wharf. Don't be scared off by some of the reviews talking about street people. We didn't see anyone who looked out of place. This is a fine place at a great rate...give it a look...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location,....etc, etc!”
Reviews.Author: kmarple
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! I can not say enough good things! Free coffee every morning, free wine happy hour with small bites every night, great price for the location..... I could go on! I loved this place and will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - cold showers”
Reviews.Author: Slorben
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan inn is in many ways a perfect stay for an SF-holiday. You are at Fisherman's Wharf - a block from the excursion buses, walking distance to the piers etc. Plus the hotel restaurant is more than a hotel restaurant, it is a very good one - hotel or not. Rooms are good, cleaning was excellent .The hotel also has a special treat. At five every afternoon the let you taste local wines in the lobby. Which also means you get to chat with other guests, share experiences etc. You also get free coffee in the mornings. The downside was a very unsecured supply of hot water. More than one I had to take a cold shower - not very nice in November.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but lacking the spark”
Reviews.Author: RachLou88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. If fine is what youre looking for then this is ideal, good location, comfortable rooms, friendly (mostly) staff and a good price. I found the extra touches were missing which stopped me from thinking this place was great rather than just good. The room was small (I had a queen) and very noisy. This wasnt from outside noise, considering the location the noise level from the streets was very low - i did request a high, quiet room though. However, the fridge and air con sounded like jumbo jets!! It kept me awake every night, I couldnt use the air con as it was just too loud. The storage was minimal with 2 drawers and a small wardobe that the doors were falling off of.. The products available in the rooms are basic and cheap, bar of soap anyone? not as described on the website. The minbar was expensive but I think most places are, I bought wine and snacks at the Safeway which is located just across the street and kept that in my room - a bottle of wine here was 4 dollars!!!! In the minibar a small bottle was 16... The thing that started my slip into slight negativity was upon arrival I was asked for a card so he could charge 500 dollars to it as insurance. WHAT?? I was not made aware of this before, after paying for the holiday 500 dollars was not something I had readily available, apart from my spending money of course! I didnt even have a credit card with me to do this, just a debit and will have a hefty charge from my bank for the exchange, fab. I undertsand why they do this but every other hotel i have stayed in you pay for minibar etc when you leave... If this is how its done in America then fine but I didnt know and wasnt happy. This was not the start to what turned into be the most incredible trip I had hoped for.. Keith was very helpful though and pleasant. The concierge was very helpful with transport questions I had and the doormen always say hello. Jose checked me out at the end of my stay and he was abrupt and not as friendly as Keith. Housekeeping were brilliant, always happy and did a good job. Although one day I put my 'do not distrub' sign up.. They then phoned me to ask if i wanted my room serviced... Surely that is disturbing me?? There are lots of hotels to choose from and this one is nice - honestly - but I would suggest looking arund first and find what suits your needs best

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill carefully!”
Reviews.Author: cjupton
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is great, but there are better places to stay in Fisherman's Wharf. This hotel needs updating as the rooms show signs of wear. Also check your bill carefully as they tried to bill us $90 for parking, which was already included in our price and they were reluctant to remove the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Convienant location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LuanneSo
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Tuscan Inn. It is a great location to get to the Wharf as well as to the cable stop so it would be easy enough to get downtown for great shopping and resturants and walking distance to North Beach. The rooms were very nice and clean and the staff was very nice and friendly. They have a wine tasting for cocktail hour which worked out quite nicely so we could have a complimentry glass of wine while we decided where to go to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - warm and friendly staff - great location!”
Reviews.Author: scruffybuttons
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location! Complimentary tea and coffee in the morning and wine at night was great - especially as the lounge area as just lovely. Staff were fabulous and room was great. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A kimpton but not a kimpton really”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethRegina
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Kimpton's before and had really nice wine at the free winetasting sessions, but this place offered Trader Joe's special 2-buck Chuck - the Chardonnay was horrid. Good location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: gammaof3
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in San Fransisco. We are so glad we picked October as the weather was fantastic. The staff were very friendly and the hotel is so close to the cable car and street car lines. The hotel room was clean but small. Bathroom was a good size but the closet and drawer space was limited. The room was clean and I recommend you ask for garden view if you like it quiet. The wine reception was a great time to meet people from all over the world and It was a highlight every night. Great food but not cheap in San Fransisco. The best thing we did, was buy a muni pass at walgreens pharmacy for the week and could travel everywhere with that pass except Bart line. Used the super shuttle to get from airport and that takes about 1 hour to get to hotel from airport if staying at warf. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Near Pier 39, also Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: GatsbyO
Reviews.Content: This property is very near Pier 39 and the rest of Fisherman's Wharf. Its rooms and public spaces are a bit dated but certainly adequate [a 27" circa 1984 tv sat on top of the dresser in our room, not a flat screen]. Who really cares about the decor all that much when the real advantage of this hotel is its location, Pier 39 and boat tours, etc are just blocks from the front door - while 7 or 8 blocks (easy walk, but up hill) is the charming neighborhood of Little Italy. My only criticisms of the hotel while we were there was the front desk seemed frequently overwhelmed, I don't know if it was a particularly busy day or the like, but each time we approached the desk it felt very crowded. The only other thing we noticed was that there was a musty smell in some of our guest rooms, like a beach hotel would have. It wasn't overbearing, but certainly noticeable. My one word of caution that I would have preferred clarified prior to staying here. This hotel appears to be owned by Kimpton but operated by Best Western. Some of the charms of the Kimpton brand have made their way into the property (particularly the always appreciated evening wine hour and being pet friendly), but you will not earn Kimpton InTouch credits or be able to redeem them at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Atlrosey
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I found the people to be professional yet warm and friendly. So many places professionalism becomes stiff and cool. They had a more relaxed vibe about them. Would have preferred a bar/appetizers area to sit and meet others or just relax without going to room, apart from the restaurant.. However, know that space is a problem there. Our room was very clean and smelled good. Loved the roomey bathroom. No views here really but easy walk to anything you might need. It was great because if we had a hour to so to kill between tours or such, we'd walk to the wharf and look around. Got our barings real fast from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Return visitor”
Reviews.Author: aussiesmithfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 years ago and returned again for 4 nights in october. It is still a lovely hotel near fishermans wharf but far enough from the crowds. The room was nice but we had requested to be near our travelling friends and they could not accomodate us even though we had made a request in May when we booked online at expedia. We were told we should have contacted the hotel direct! Car parking at the hotel was expensive but so was the carparks in the area so no win! The resaurant Pescatore is still very nice and on a Mon or Tue night you can take one bottle of win if they do not have it on their wine list and there is no corkage. The happy hour wine selection could have been better. There were a few half full glasses left!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in wonderful location - recommend!”
Reviews.Author: snap802
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Tuscan Inn. I would recommend this hotel to friends who where traveling to San Francisco. The location was 2-3 blocks from just about everything. We had Muni passes while we were there, and there is a bus stop across the street, the F streetcar is 1 block, and both "turnarounds" for the cable cars are about 2 and 1/2 blocks. Because the Inn is not right on the waterfront, the crowds that swarm the waterfront are absent. There are 2 groceries (Safeway and Trader Joe's) within 1 block, plus a Walgreens. Great location! The staff was very helpful and always friendly. Every time I saw a staff member they greeted me happily. Perks: Coffee and tea service every morning in the lobby, Wine reception every evening (5-6pm) in the lobby. Free Wi-fi. They also have a conservation program where if you put a sign on your door by a certain time (declining room servicing the next day), then you can pick up a $5 voucher to the restaurant next door. Additionally, we got a promotion by booking online and got a $25 Shell gas card at check out. Mini-fridge in room (stocked with pay as you go items) but the staff invited us to remove those and use as we see fit, careful to instruct us to leave their items "in plain view" so we wouldn't accidentally be charged for things we didn't consume. The room: We had a standard room, King. The decor was nice, the room well cared for and clean. Small room, but plenty of space. Our room faced the inner courtyard (which we requested, as we had read complaints of noise in street facing rooms). The bed was obviously not new, but we slept well. Plenty of pillows. The hot water was fast and it was HOT! The only odd thing was the apparently ADA-compliant door between the shower/toilet and the sink/closet area. It was gigantic and got in the way if we were both trying to get ready at the same time. A wheelchair wouldn't have fit between the main door and the bed, so the gigantic bathroom door was a puzzle. All in all - glad we stayed here. If you compare prices, you will see that this hotel is one of the very best values in the area, and the location and staff made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: SussexAdventurers
Reviews.Content: Wy wife and I recently spent 3 nights at the Tuscan Inn at the start of a two week tour of California. We got off to a bad start as, despite having pre-booked a non-smoking king room weeks in advance, we arrived at around 4pm to hear that no non-smoking rooms were available. The smoking room we were allocated reeked. The only compensation we received was a cheap, complimentary continental breakfast. At least we were transferred to a non-smoking room for the rest of our stay, but the room was rather small with no view whatsoever. It was clean and quiet, though, and the bed was comfortable. The hotel restaurant was pleasantly bustling and the food was good, although pricey, as was the accommodation. I guess you pay for the location - the hotel is within a few minutes walk of all the Fisherman's Wharf attractions which is a boon.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: gafarmgirl623
Reviews.Content: When three friends and I visited San Francisco recently, we chose the Tuscan Inn after deciding to stay at Fisherman's Wharf as opposed to downtown. When we arrived, we were greeted by friendly, eager staff. We found our room to be very attractive and modern with comfortable beds. We only got to take advantage of the wine reception one night but thought it was a nice touch - would have liked for it to be a little later. The only bad experience was getting a taxi one evening. The person at the desk told us he would get us a taxi. The actual bellhop who was to take care of this first offered us a limousine sitting out front for which we would have paid $20 to go to the ferry building - not far at all. Then another car - not marked as a taxi - pulled up. We were not keen on getting in this car, wanting something that looked a bit more official. The bellhop seemed to get exasperated with us and walked off. He did come back later, but we were the ones who actually secured the taxi a bit later. (We hated the taxis in San Francisco, knowing we were ripped off on two occasions.) We only ate at the restaurant there one time - for breakfast - but it was very good. We were able to walk anywhere in the wharf area and always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our recent stay in San Francisco. The staff could not seem to do enough for us. Friendly, accommodating, helpful seem to be the qualifications needed for employment. The rooms are small, but adequate, and clean. Upon arrival,we were given cards for complimentary continental breakfast for each day of our stay, plus there is a daily complimentary wine reception in the evenings. I would certainly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,”
Reviews.Author: anujaustin
Reviews.Content: Great location, but noisy, A/C sounded like generators for room 156.( self had to swith it off to sleep well ) Reception staff was cold, self was awaken by maintenace staff while i was sleeping, he says self had requested for repair. I was in deep sleep, so did not bother to argue. Raised the complaint to front desk while i was leaving, but response was cold. They said they are not aware of that, that means any body can just barge in to your room with out front desk even knowing it. They said they can find it out, self told them i have no time to wait. Then the reply from front desk staff was that if you cant wait then i have nothing to do. I repeat, front desk staff need to behave with more manners. Especially if they sent somebody for maintenance when the room is occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: mm003007
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to everything. My wife and I stayed 4 night's during Fleet Week and could not ask for better service. It was our anniversary and they sent up a bottle of Champagne right after we got in our room. Room was small but clean and very nice. Wine reception was nice if your there at that time. IHOP around the corner was great for a cheap breakfast. We didn't pay near as much for our room as some of the reviewer's say so I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Ok rooms, great service.”
Reviews.Author: LovingTravel17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our California honeymoon. The hotel's location is convenient, but in a very touristy area. When we checked in, it was (unbeknownst to us) Fleet Week but the staff was quick and helpful. The Hollywood Cafe just down the street is great for breakfast. The daily wine tasting is good and they pour nice big glasses. The rooms were adequate (pretty small, as described in many reviews, but clean, which is important). We had an inner view which was a quieter room but we seemed to look onto someone's apartment so our shutters were closed the whole time. The interactions we had with various staff were very good. The concierge Jackie was excellent and gave a lot of helpful advice. We also had to ask for help with various issues (smoke detector, extra hangers, fridge, and thermostat), and the staff was quick to respond and helpful. The hotel wasn't cheap, but seems to be on par with San Francisco prices. Overall, great: staff/service, location, daily wine tasting, Jackie the concierge. Adequate: room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for minimal value.”
Reviews.Author: IndyNana
Reviews.Content: One plus -- GREAT LOCATION, but too many minuses for this property to be of value to us. We participated in the FLEET WEEK activities, my husband is a WWII veteran and had spent a considerable amount of time in SFO during the war, but this was my first visit and I was very excited, but quickly became disenchanted. Our room, the size of a broom closet was on the first floor and our view was a blank wall. It was almost like a garden apartment. We asked to be moved to a higher room but were told nothing else was availble. A $299/night view of a wall was very upsetting. Not at all what what I had expected In addition to the high room rate, we were also billed $44/night for parking. Which probably should have been $42, but the amount had been crossed out in been and $44 written in. I assumed they were penalizing FLEET WEEK guests. We couldn't get the thermostat in our room to function properly, it was very complicated, so the first night we were very cold and unable to get anything but cold air blowing. The first morning we woke up, we were in a hurry to get to the dock to cruise on the Jeremiah O'Brien. Didn't have much time but when I went to dry my hair, I could not locate a dryer. I called housekeeping and got voicemail, so I called the front desk and they told me they would get a hair dryer to me as quickly as possible. They did, it only took about 15 minutes, but I shouldn't have had to ask for one. Before we left we asked to have the heating system looked at in our room as we did not feel it was working properly and we had been very cold during the night. Upon our return, we had a message from engineering telling us to call them when we returned and they would show us how to operate the thermostat. After the engineer was in our room for over 20 minutes, he couldn't figure out why it wasn't working but if we had any more trouble, he would be there until 11 PM, it was already 10 PM. Needless to say, it was another cold night. Also, when we had checked in on Friday, we were informed that there was going to be a neighborhood festival on Sunday and that we would be stuck at the hotel for 12 hours unless we left first thing in the morning and came back later than night. They also advised we would not be able to get our car out of the garage during that time because all of the roads around the hotel would be blocked off or jammed up with traffic. We had enough. It felt more like punishment than pleasure having to stay at this Best Western. So, Sunday morning we packed up early, went down to the front desk and told them they were checking out. I was informed they were going to charge us $75 for leaving early. They were more worried about getting their $75 than why we were leaving. After explaing to the desk clerk why we were leaving, she did agree to waive the $75 fee. In addition to the $299 rate, the $44 parking fee and the misc. taxes and fees, our daily charge for this hotel was almost $380. We were able to relocate to the Holiday Inn Express at SFO Airport, and for $150/night we had a beautiful room overlooking the Bay, free parking and about half the misc. taxes than what we had paid downtown. Plus we got free breakfast and a clean WARM room with a working thermostat.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and noisey!”
Reviews.Author: Murano47
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in Room 419. Room was average but the noise was horrible. Trash truck at 5am under our window sounded like it was in the hallway. Windows so dirty you couldn"t see out of them. Bell and Valet staff were super nice but the front desk staff leave alot to be desired. When I complained about the noise, all I got was a" um sorry".

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: trav2learn
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for an entire week. The location was excellent - near wharf restaurants and activities and across the street from Trader Joe's, Safeway and Walgreen's. Rooms vary in layout and HVAC systems. The windows opened. The staff is friendly and helpful! They did their best to make sure we were comfortable and happy during our stay. I was impressed with the personal attention. This was a welcomed and very pleasant change from usual hotel stays. We also enjoyed the daily happy hour with complimentary wine and the opportunity to chat with other guests from around the world. The rooms, lobby and front desk staff made this a nice stay with a homey ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeClare
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Tuscan Inn was perfect from the word go. The staff were incrediblely friendly and couldn't do enough to help you, and were so happy to recommend places to eat or go. You even got a welcome cookie on arrival! The rooms looked recently refurbished and were a good size, and very quiet at night. The really nice thing about this hotel is that they do a free wine hour every day between 5-6 pm and you get to meet all of the other guests in the hotel and make friends. We got complimentary continental breakfast each day or you could receive 50% discount on other breakfast items. All of which were so tasty, especially the potatoes. As well as staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area, we spent some of our trip at a downtown hotel too, but would highly recommend the Fisherman's Wharf area over downtown as it was quieter and closer to the touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carol061
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Best Western. Staff were friendly and helpful. Lobby very cosy. Room was nice. Bathroom abit small but adequate. Bed comfy. Wine reception in evening was nice touch. Complimentary coffee & tea each morning. Great location ~ walking distance to Pier and other attractions. Would also recommend the "Hollywood Cafe" for breakfast just down the street. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the only downside was the noise from the street during the night but more so in the early hours of the morning from the trash lorries. It is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location near to Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Denbo24
Reviews.Content: First time to US and First City we stopped off at....Good Location, Lovely comfy bed , but just a bit noisy as it was near the road....Staff helpful and friendly..would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: HBC_7
Reviews.Content: Tuscan Inn is in an outstanding, central location. You can walk two blocks to Fisherman's Wharf. The cable cars are around the corner, and the bus we took to the Giants game was only five minutes away. You could also walk to North Beach if you really wanted to. Rooms are OK for two people, but would probably feel crowded for more. Beds are comfortable. We were on the 4th floor and there was a steady amount of road noise, but this is a city and it really didn't keep us awake. There is coffee in the lobby in the morning and a free wine bar from 4-5 pm when guests can mingle and share stories for an hour. Very well run with friendly staff. We ate breakfast in the attached restaurant - very expensive but lots of food. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to everything........”
Reviews.Author: ChefKFairfax_VA
