The room was very clean and appears freshly renovated, being set off by the wooden blinds and the clean lines. Beds were very comfy too. Staying in the front there was a little traffic noise but that was minimal. The free tea / coffee in the lobby was a suprise as was the evening wine tasting sessions. The lobby is a great place to relax on the homely furniture. Also has the internet on a PC that was fast and easy to use. All the staff were very friendly and approachable with good local knowledge. We had continental breakfast included, large bowl of cut fruit and choice of toast tea / coffee which was very filling. Also opposite is the local Safeway supermarket and Walgreens for any extras you want. Location is great for Fisherman's Wharf as is a couple of minutes away from the action and only one strret away from the F line streetcar to downtown. Would certainly go back as this hotel is great value and is welcoming. we had also spent a few nights in Las Vegas in a well known top hotel but the Tuscan beat them hands down. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fira2007
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location - Fisherman's Wharf. It's also close to North Beach. We had a car, so all the tourist spots like Lombard Street, Golden Gate bridge, Chinatown, etc. were very easy to get to from the hotel. Rooms were clean, the lobby was nice, and there's complimentary coffee/tea in the mornings and wine in the early evenings! There's a very decent Italian restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: HammerBigTiime
Reviews.Content: What can I say about our stay .... We were looking for a place that was close the wharf which this hotel was. 5 minute walk to the wharf and the Powell/hyde cable car route. The hotel lobby is well kept but the hotel rooms are in need of a make over. Our room was clean and quiet, we faced a court yard of sorts so there was no road traffic but no view. ust remember that if you are expecting the Ritz Carlton, you will be disappointed. If you want a clean room and a bed to sleep in, you will be happy with the hotel. BTW - The parking is expensive, it costs $45 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: jnomad68
Reviews.Content: I read most of the reviews after booking our reservation and became concerned about beds and service at this location. we are getting older and a good nights sleep is very important to us. When we arrived we were greeted with a friendly staff, Our room was somewhat small but very comfortable. Bed was very comfortable. surprisingly so. It seems you take your chances with Best-Western Hotels. We had an issue with the window in the room not locking closed. it was fixed within a few hours. The parking is spendy and I looked into another review and it is true that across the street you can pay $15.00 verses The $35.00 we ended up paying with a AAA rate. Again we are getting older and the Valet was nice to have. The location was about as good as you can get. about a two and a half block walk to the wharf, The restaurant on site was I thought fairly good. a bit pricey but I challenge you to find anywhere on the wharf that isnt. there is a grocery store as well as a walgreens within 1 block. If I were to go back to Fishermans Wharf in San Francisco I would not hesitate to stay at the Tuscan Inn

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lousy beds!!”
Reviews.Author: delmar60
Reviews.Content: We spent the Easter long weekend in San Francisco with friends and stayed at this hotel. The hotel is in a fantastic location, minutes from Fishermans Wharf, pier 39, Ghiradelli Square etc. The cleanliness of the hotel is what I noticed first, fantastic, helpful staff, check in a breeze. The rooms are a bit small, but not as small as a few of the prevoius posts have indicated. We had a courtyard room and found it to be very quiet at night. Now the only negitive part of this review, the beds are HORRIBLE!! They are worn out and when lying in it together you roll right in to the center! We asked our friends and they had the same problem! We asked the hotel manager about this and we were told that the hotel was replacing the beds one third of the hotel at a time!! If you stay at this hotel i hope you get a room with a NEW bed!! The hotel hosts a wine reception between 5 and 6 and after a long day of site seeing it was nice to have a glass of wine and chat about your day with other guests. The restaurant that is attached to the hotel is nice, but with hundreds of choices all around you it is a hard choice. The location will bring me back to this hotel but only after they get new beds!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be staying again”
Reviews.Author: pixiefirecracker
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with pretty much everything you'd want if you're visiting SF as a tourist. You're two blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf, with the Muni right across the street if you're so inclined to venture out. There's at least two Starbucks within a block, a 7/11, Walgreens and every restaurant you would need within walking distance. The room decor was adorable, beds were very comfy, and we had a pretty decent view out of our window. We got free continental breakfast in the cafe every morning - brought to your table and it was very fresh and tasty. My only real complaint was the street noise, and that the walls are relatively thin - but I'm a light sleeper, so your mileage may vary. Definitely a great value and I will be coming back to stay the next time I'm in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Mazneed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great as a base for exploring all of San Francisco and being so close to Fishermans Wharf there are plenty of good eating places that you can walk out to in the evening. We had been to San Franciso a number of times before and being there at a weekend, it was good to find that there were some new things to see like the Farmers Market and the restored building that it is housed in, just a short walk from Fishermans Wharf. The Tuscan Inn has a very welcoming drinks reception in the early evening and also provides coffee early morning, not sure what happened to the biscotti that was supposed to go with it, but there was none around when we visited. We have stayed at this hotel before and been completly satisfied, the only problem on this occasion was that we had a room on Mason St and there was a lot of noise late evening and early morning on the Friday and Saturday nights, so best to ask for a room on Mason St if that's possible.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Very Helpful Staff, nice decor, somewhat small room, very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: NervousNellieOR
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the staff were helpful and polite. It's in a spot convenient for hitting all the tourist attractions or catching the trolleys. The room decor was nicely decorated, modern. Overall I would stay there again. But I would really like queen size beds and a little more space to move around...the room was crowded for a family of 4 and their suitcases. We had to pay for daily parking and although they indicated the car would be in the basement, it was parked in an open lot, down the street. I'm sure some rooms are quieter, but ours was on the street. My family slept thru it but I heard every car, bus, garbage truck drive by.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: daw56
Reviews.Content: After spending 8 nights at this hotel, we can say we really like and enjoyed it. The staff was great and very helpful. The room was very clean, we stayed on the courtside, it was quiet, but you do have to remember to close your shutters, as you can see into other rooms when they are open. I had read reviews about the Tuscan and many said to stay in the inside, as it is noisy when staying on the side of the hotel that is along the street. We stay in a king room, it wasn't large, but it was very comfortable, a king bed, 2 bed side tables. A small table to sit at, with a chair, a dresser with a tv on it, plus a desk and a chair and a small closet. The bathroom was a decent size. Our maid was Amy and she did a great job, we were on the 4th floor. All the concierges were good, but we were help mostly by Bridjette, she was friendly, happy and very helpful. They had complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby and everyday from 5 to 6 they had a complimentary wine reception, everyone could have a couple glasses of wine plus there was a pizza bread to nibble on. This was something we have never had in any other hotel, it was very enjoyable, sitting by the fireplace with a glass of wine...visiting with other guests from other places and countries...it was a great time. We are from Canada, this was our 1st time to San Francisco and we love it, the Tuscan Inn is a great place to stay...it made our holiday better. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. We found that we didn't need to rent a car, which is good because parking is not free and some people complained about that. We took tours, you get pickup at your hotel for them. We can walk from hotel to the wharf. We got a San Francisco city pass, which included 7 days on the muni, streetcar, trolley or the F-line. the pass also included a few siteseeing attractions...this pass cost around $60.00 a person...very well worth it. I think the concierge has a small map with all the bus routes shown on it, take this map with you, so you can figure out what bus takes you where....once you get tired of walking...just find a bus. Another tip.... across the street from the Tuscan Inn there is a safeway store, etc. We picked up pop, junk food, water, muffins, fruit etc,...this is cheaper then using the items in the mini bar in the room. they also have small safes in the room, but it costs $1.70 a day to use. There was a hair blower, coffee maker and an ironboard etc. in our room. We were very happy staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Reception Staff Rude”
Reviews.Author: courtod
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in good location. On checking young lady at reception decided to take a phone call and leave us standing there with no instruction for 5 mins. Her colleague eventually took over and handed us our room keys.......okay ! what room where we what floor were we on, no communication, so first impressions not good. The room was very clean and modern abit on the small side, but overlooking the courtyard was better than overlooking a road. Wine tasting is served between 5pm-6pm which is great after a long day sight seeing. On check out again, we had a rude receptionist, as you can be charged to use your room safe or ask for it to be waivered. I asked for it to be waivered and the reply was 'that was not my question miss' oh dear someone got out of the wrong side of bed.....So yeah great hotel, but beware of the two grumpy staff,the others seemed fine when observing.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: nynana614
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn was a GREAT place for us to stop after a long flight from the East Coast and on our way to Hawaii. The room was spotless! The amenities were so much more than we'd expected! (although I DID read the reviews on TripAdvisor before booking!). The restaurant attached had a wonderful breakfast menu - everyone was very friendly and helpful. The location was ideal - walk to Pier 39, restaurants, shops, grocery, etc. The tour bus company picked us up right at the door. The only way to have made it better, would have been to stay a couple of days more. We've already decided to return to the Tuscan the next time we make our way back to Hawaii! Thanks for such a relaxing and comfortable couple of nights!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: IndiTravell
Reviews.Content: One of the best located hotels in Fishermans Wharf, which is in walkabale distance. The hotel has easy access to Fisherman's wharf and it was very clean, with friendly staff. Nearby to the hotel there are a lot of food joints and can get some of the best food joints in Fisherman's wharf in Pier 39. The bed was very neat and had a very good sleep. Recommended for other travellers

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Craazylulu
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice (pet friendly) trendy hotel. Rooms are a little on the small side but very clean and tidy. Great location for walking to the Wharf and cable cars, Ghiradelli Square etc. Also close to a Safeway, Trader Joe's and Walgreens should you need anything from there during your stay. Tasty free coffee served in the am that will save you from running to the Starbucks down the street. Didn't get to go to it, but they have a free wine reception at night as well that is offered. Would definitely stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: EagleCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed at the Tuscan Inn, our room was very nicely furnished and the bathroom was neat and shiny. The location was great for sight seeing and visiting the many restaurants close by. The social hour between 5 and 6 p.m. was a nice touch. We met a very nice couple from Vancouver (even though the U.S. Olympic Hockey team got beat by Canada the Sunday we were there). The restaurant serves a very nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Shame about the size”
Reviews.Author: spatan
Reviews.Content: Booked after checking out on Trip and looked okay. When Amercans say small rooms you normally imagine they will be bigger than european sizes but this is no bigger. Facilities in room average but could do with better cupboard space. Coffee in the lounge fair but would be better if you could brew up in your room. Wine party great novelty and nice drop off and change stop before going out for the evening. Only thing to remember is the bin men collect at ungodly oclock so road facing rooms get disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews paint an accurate picture of this hotel. The pluses are the good management (Kimpton knows how to run a hotel), with some nice perks like the free wine hour at 5 pm, and the good coffee available in the lobby in the morning. Sheets have high thread counts and the furnishings are tasteful. Free wi-fi, and nice toiletries. In general, this is a very pleasant but not luxurious motel/hotel. Downsides are noise (I'd ask for a quiet room, if such a thing exists -- otherwise, noisy pedestrians and garbage trucks are likely to at least momentarily interupt your sleep), and smallish rooms. Also, if you're travelling with family or as a group, note that the 2 bedded rooms are only doubles; queens are MUCH more comfortable for 2 people (including kids!) to share. Also consider the location. Most tourists will find Fisherman's Wharf pretty enjoyable, but you are a bit removed from the "real" San Francisco. It's a shame that the cable cars are a pricey 5 bucks to downtown -- it would be a great way to get downtown (it still is, if you come off season and don't mind overpaying a bit extra for "the experience"). Having a car is a bit problematic because hotel parking is insanely expensive (like $45/night). The meters in front of the hotel are also crazy expensive, but if you're willing to walk a few blocks, you can find free overnight or short term day parking on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great restaurant and convenient to many locations”
Reviews.Author: BigSal56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Franscisco for vacation and stayed at the Best Western Tuscan Inn Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel staff were very friendly, the concierge staff were all very helpful in helping us to find locations and to help with tours. The room was clean and very quiet and has a safe for rent. Each evening the hotel has a wine tasting and snack in the lobby. We met so many nice people each evening and the wine was excellent. There is coffee available in the lobby in the mornings. The hotel has a very nice restaurant located in the building. The food is excellent and the prices are too bad. There is a little shopping center right across the street where a Super Value Grocery strore and a Walgreens. We rented a car through the hotel concierge one day but booked it online the second day for half the price through Hotwire. The same rental agency located in the Sheraton just across the road. Save some money and book it yourself. The hotel has a computer for your use in the lobby. We rented bicycles and biked across the Golden Gate Bridge which was awesome and we are not bicyclist. We took the boat tour down to the Golden Gate and around Alcatraz but if we were to ever go back we would save our money and instead when you book your bicycles ride to Sausalito and take the ferry back. It is less expensive and you will go right by Alcatraz. I don't know if you get any narration about the prison though if you take the ferry so if you are a history buff that may not be the way to go. Pier 39 is full of funky people and there are a lot of very good restaurants there too. Be sure to take a cable car up to Union Plaza. Rent a car and drive to Muir Woods and up to Sonoma or Nappa. It makes for a couple of nice day trips. If we ever return I would go back to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and mainly friendly staff. Rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: WilliamPayer
Reviews.Content: Arrived early after a 12 hour flight and a 21 hour time switch (NZ to San Francisco) - feeling like zombies. The room was ready! Really needed a shower but there was a bit of a hot water shortage early afternoon. More tepid than hot. This isn't unusual in hotels. It was fine the next morning. The rooms are small by American standards and it wasn't helped by the presence of a fairly large and noisy fridge which we weren't given a key to. We ended up unplugging it, which was easier said than done. The hotel doesn't provide coffee and tea making facilities in the room but it is available to take away in the lobby from around 7 a.m. to 10 a.m. We actually found this more useful, especially as you could use the internet at the same time. There is also a wine hour from 5 to 6pm in the lobby. Free wine and free pizza. It was a great way to meet other guests. The hotel has a great location. A few minutes walk from Pier 39 and the wharf area, a short stroll from the F-line trolley cars and one block from the Powell and Mason St. cable car turnaround. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and we also tried the Cafe Pescatore at the hotel. The food was very good but the portions are more European than American. We also suffered from the work on the windows that was mentioned in an earlier post. It was a bit of a pain but we never had a major problem although we had to keep our shutters closed. Most of the staff were very friendly although there was one guy on reception who never seemed to crack his face. If you can't lighten up in San Francisco, you are in trouble. By the way, if you are down by the wharf and want to see some sharks, just pop into any camera shop. We would stay here again but would check about the window work. It is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dmac15209
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean, comfortable rooms. Great Location. Walking distance to everything from a grocery store, convince store, pharmacy, public transportation (all within one block) and most of all...Fisherman's Wharf. My only complaint is the room was a little small. But then really didn't spend much time there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: FangsDK
Reviews.Content: After reading all the "nice" comments posted here, I thought it should be a fairly good experience staying there given it's close proximity to the fisherman's wharf. Boy I was wrong! I had asked for a room facing the garden as suggested by other posters here due to the street noise, but in return we were awaken unpleasantly by loud work noise internally by workers who are doing the window work talking and singing early in the morning! I called the front desk who promised to ask the workers to lower their noise as it was still early but that didn't help. We asked for a room change and was told that our bags will be moved to the new room, but when we're back later in the afternoon, our new room wasn't ready, neither are our bags moved. after another 1-2hours of delay, our bags are finally moved to our new room after I had to personally speak to their supervisor Gregory twice! Gregory wasn't friendly and definitely did not seem happy to help me at all. Fortunately I didn't have to deal with him anymore and had a better second night. Besides my terrible experience, here are my impressions of the property - Pros 1. Great location (proximity to the wharf, pier 39, cable car station etc) 2. Free wireless Internet Cons 1. Absurd valet parking costs (There are cheaper alternatives nearby) 2. Extremely small rooms (They are REALLY small) 3. Bad customer service (Front desk supervisor not friendly and doesn't appear to be willing to help) 4. Bad property management (Works should be scheduled in the afternoons instead of mornings which causes disturbance and noise to guests) 5. Seems more like a 2 star than a 3 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: YuYoNeT
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Quiet area near Fisherman's Wharf and tourist attractions. We stayed there for 3 days and all we can do is praise the service. On the first night we were given an smoking room when we booked for a non-smoking. We complained at the front desk and we were switched to a non-smoking room for the next day. They were also very gentle providing us directions to get from SF to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: BWAirportExecutel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and was close to everything. Only had a couple minor complaints. First, there was noise from garbage trucks early in the am on the first night and loud people causing a ruckus outside the following night. Neither occurance is really the hotel's fault. But, as others have indicated in their ratings/reviews, get a room that faces the courtyard if you are a light sleeper. Second, the shower curtain did not work well and we had puddles of water on the bathroom floor after each shower. Beyond that the hotel was nice and clean and the staff took care of any needs we had. The lcoation was great for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: tenenbaum
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you like busy areas. It is very close to fisherman's wharf near all the action - restaurants, souvenir shops, pier 39, ferry departures and the cable car. As the hotel is located in the street parallel to fisherman's wharf you don't hear the noise from outside. The hotel is nice and the staff we met was friendly. The room was smaller than we're used to and there was no view. The room was clean and the bed were comfortable. The value for money is a bit low as you mainly pay for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neats1269
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn is in a fantastic location for all the attractions at Fishermans Wharf, Pier 33 to Alcatraz is less than a 10 min walk from the hotel. Reception staff were very polite and helpful, Rooms are slightly on the small size but very well equiped, modern and clean. The Italian restaurant that is attached to the hotel serves excellent food, our booking included a free continental breakfast which consists of either a Muffin or croissant (which we exchanged for toast), a large fruit salad, fruit juice and with tea or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel on Fisherman's Wharf...”
Reviews.Author: AliceMorales
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th trip to SF in the past 12 months but the first time I stayed in the Fisherman's Wharf area. I named my own price on Priceline & it was accepted by theTuscan Inn. It was wonderful! Based on other reviews I read online, I requested an "inside room" facing the courtyard. It was very quiet. This was one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. The bathroom was absolutely spotless. The beds were very comfortable. The location was fantastic. The cable car picked up 1/2 block away, it was a short 2 block walk to Pier 39, there is a shopping center right across the street with a Safeway and Walgreen's and a Cost Plus Market and Barnes & Noble right next door. It was quick & easy to take the cable car to the MUNI/BART station at Powell or the F street car to the MUNI/BART Embarcadero Station. The hotel staff were extremely nice and helpful. There was a concierge on duty most of the day and evening and was very willing to answer questions, recommend restaurants, tell us how to get places on public transit, etc. There is a computer in the lobby with free internet access and quick links to print boarding passes. The front dest staff also offered to print our boarding passes if we preferred. Check-in and check-out was fast and easy. We were allowed to check-in at 9:30 am, well in advance of the normal 3:00 pm check-in. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and my Dog Loved it Too!”
Reviews.Author: micksidbob
Reviews.Content: This is the first time in my life I have ever taken the time to do one of these online reviews, so you know that there is something very special about this hotel. Aside from the great location, beautifully appointed rooms, helpful friendly staff and affordable price, they welcomed my dog with open arms and doggie treats! My dog and I will stay at this hotel every time we visit San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, good location - ideal choice.”
Reviews.Author: WopWops
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation here after taking advice from other Travellers from this site. Arriving after a 11 hour flight at midday, our quiet room over looking the court yard was ready for us. The room was not overly big, but clean and very comfortable beds, a great shower and very clean bathrooms. Nice decor and good amenities. Thoroughly recommend the Cafe Pescatore adjacent to the hotel as the food is very good. Ideally located to Fishermans wharf, the cable car, plus a supermarket across the road. Staff are friendly and helpful (they even bought us some English Tea with hot water). The wine reception is a great idea as it is nice to meet other travellers and great having access to the free Internet access in our room.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to love it, but it was just okay”
Reviews.Author: Annp
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews here on TripAdvisor, I expected to love the Tuscan Inn, but I have to say I was underwhelmed. The location is good, and the overall decor is nice, but there was nothing that I can really rave about. This was our first trip to San Francisco (myself, my husband, and two teenage children) and we stayed at the Tuscan Inn for two nights -- a Saturday and Sunday. The first night we had a room on the outside perimeter of the building, facing Mason St., and the street noise was absolutely unbearable. It was not just cars and traffic (which I would understand) but screaming, yelling, honking, and all kinds of commotion -- especially at about 2am, which is when I'm assuming the local bars let out. The noise from inside the hotel was not much better. The walls were paper thin, and my son woke up in a panic at one point because he thought the voices he was hearing were INSIDE our room. We asked to be moved to a quieter room the next day, and the front desk was very accommodating (I got the feeling this happens all the time). The second room was smaller, with a very inconvenient bathroom layout, but at least it was quieter and we were able to sleep. We never tried the coffee/tea in the morning or the manager's reception in the afternoon (we were out sightseeing most of the time), though they are a nice touch. Our room rate included breakfast, which was a croissant and fruit at the on site restaurant. It was fine but, again, nothing I can rave about. Overall, it was a good location, but an average hotel with serious noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel, a perfect location, perfect staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jason205
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with my sister, stayed at the Best Western Tuscan Inn Fisherman's Wharf. We stayed from November 6 through November 10, 2009. This was our first ever visit to San Francisco, as we are from Tennessee and my sister is from North Carolina. We have been many places, in many states, and even out of the country a few times. I left San Francisco and the Tuscan Inn, very happy and highly impressed. I can not tell you a single bad thing about the hotel. Everything was perfect from the minute we arrived, until when we left to go home. I highly recommend and urge you to stay at this great hotel. The place is exceptionally clean in all areas, up to date and nice. The front desk staff is more than eager to help, smile, make you happy. We were always greeted with a big smile and happiness, even when very busy. The location is perfect to pier 39 and surrounding areas. I am proud of myself for picking this hotel, and I assure you that I would stay nowhere else in San Francisco, other than the Best Western Tuscan Inn. If we had any questions about getting to somewhere, the front desk people were knowledgeable and always printed us precise directions that got us where we were going fast and safe. The room was on the 2nd floor and was spotless and very cozy. The room was very nice and quiet. We had no complaints at all. We were right beside vending machines, which was great for me to get a drink, after all the walking! The elevators were fast and clean. The outside of the hotel was clean as well. I would like to say thank you to everyone at the Best Western Tuscan Inn, for making our first trip to San Francisco a perfect, memorable time in our lives. You ladies and gentlemen did a fantastic job, and my family will be back to San Francisco soon, and will be staying again at the Best Western Tuscan Inn. All who reads this review, I recommend you stay there as well, as it will exceed your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: st8208
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel that is convieniently located to cable cars, f line, wharf, etc. Very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Daphne2
Reviews.Content: We went to San Francisco in September and decided to stay close to Fisherman's Wharf because we stayed downtown when we were there 17 years ago and spent most of our time down at Fisherman's Wharf because we enjoyed it so much. My husband found this hotel on Trip Advisor and it ranked very high and we weren't disappointed at all as it is in a great location and a very nice hotel. The rooms are on the small side but they're still big enough to be comfortable and are decorated very nicely. The staff is friendly and we only went to one of the "Happy Hours" for a glass of wine as we were either at the baseball game (very much fun) or on the two tours we took in - busy time! They also have a computer available with free internet which is a nice bonus but I didn't find that out till the day before we left but was still able to get on there to check our flight to Vegas the next day. There are lots of restaurants close by plus a Safeway just across the street so that is very handy. We will definitely stay here again and will recommend this hotel to others if they're planning a trip to SF!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: SCGMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights at the Tuscan Inn and enjoyed it's great location to Fisherman Wharf and proximity to San Francisco's streetcars. We were able to get anywhere we wanted very easily. The rooms are clean and tidy. The staff is helpful and knowledgable. We enjoyed every minute of our visit and will definitely stay at the Tuscan Inn next time we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location if you are Cruising from San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: costafox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for one night pre cruise and found the hotel to be an excellent choice. We had reserved direct with hotel well in advance of our stay and got a very good rate. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for perusing the shops at Fishermans Wharf, we had dinner at Nicks's Lighthouse - the food was fine but the rest rooms were in a horrendous state, which completely put us off. There is a supermarket located opposite the hotel which was ideal for last minute purchases. We had a problem with the internet access, but as we didn't report it at the time, we were still charged however this was a minor inconvenience for us. If we return to San Francisco we would definately stay here again so that in itself is a good recomendation.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel, terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyRip
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the AAO conference, the Tuscan Inn was the 2nd half (the leisure half) of the trip. Considering the rate $165 nite, and the location, 2 blocks from Fisherman's Warf, this is a terrific value. We stayed on the "back', not a sound. Large comfortable room, wonderful bathroom. The complimentary wine from 5-6 in the lobby is a nice treat, sitting by the fire makes it even better! The staff was very helpful, got two great suggestions for dinner on the water, and booked the shuttle back to the Airport, way cheaper than a taxi! Heck, the adjacent Cafe Pescatore was just what we needed one night, and it was surprisingly good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sdludlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and were very pleased with this hotel. It is in an excellent location, which you need for such a short stay. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go or at least walk to the tram station to go downtown. The service was good, very friendly staff and we loved the free wine reception each night. The rooms were nice, very comfy bed and very clean bathroom. Parking was expensive but I think this is common for San Fran. Check in and check out were timely. We were greated with a welcome note and chocolates in our room on arrival which was a nice touch. I would highly recommend this hotel. We hired bikes and rode to the golden gate bridge, did the alcatraz tour and wandered around fisherman's Wharf. All excellent activities. We loved Fisherman's wharf. I recommend you go to Boudin Bakery for lunch and Lou's Blue's bar was great for dinner and entertainment. Would definitely stay here again but would hope to get it a bit cheaper priced next time. Overall a great hotel, awesome location, felt very safe everywhere we went.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LawsonsScotland
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay at the hotel,everything clean and modern,absolutely great location for all the tourist attractions.The staff at the desk very rarely welcomed you back from your day out sightseeing etc.Also heard people in elevator talking about getting discount vouchers for having an evening meal at the hotel but we weren,t offered anything,having said that ,still had a very good time in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: muzbaligi
Reviews.Content: 2 blocks from fishermans wharf, close to tourist attrractions. has free wireless and help you with transportation needs. definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tonilGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three days on our way to Hawaii and as I suspected it wasn't long enough. The hotel is ideally situated in Fishermans Wharf and literally only a 5 - 10 minute walk to Embarcadero and all the piers. We had bed and continental breakfast and it was excellent. The nightly free wine tasting from 5 - 6 pm is a brilliant idea and gets guests together to socialise witheach other. The restaurant is not cheap but is very well patronised and the service is very good as is the food. We could not fault the hotel and will most certainly stay there again when we return to this beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandert
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. we were not there a lot, but the location was great. two blocks from fisherman's wharf!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly like home”
Reviews.Author: Thymless
Reviews.Content: Tyler, the front desk manager made my weekend get away amazing. He answered all my questions before we even arrived then upgraded us to a suite at no extra cost. After a day of walking and sightseeing it was wonderful to be welcomed back to your hotel with glass of wine by the fireplace and chance to share the dayâ€™s stories with other travelers. Located near all the tourist attractions this hotel is perfect for catching tour buses, cabs, etc to do lots of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nannylas
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in perfect location. Within walking distance of shops, dining, cable cars and fishermans wharf. there is a fee for parking but well worth it seeing no where to park if you do have a car. free wi-fi and happy hour wine every afternoon! staff was helpful. rooms somewhat small but clean and comfortable. would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed Tuscan Inn location and large room”
Reviews.Author: NTX4
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 bdrm suite with fold out sofa for kids. Bedroom with King and nice sized living area. Can't beat the location. A bit pricey, but hey, it is San Francisco. Overall, we were pleased. Food at manager's reception was VERY skimpy, especially considering a full house. Service was spotty; Front desk was marginally helpful. Housekeeping was good. One concierge was great, the other was bad. Valet was great...but then they usually are! Business center was under construction (I guess). One computer in the lobby was either always busy or not working. What's up with that!?

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan Inn Made Our First Trip to San Francisco a Hit”
Reviews.Author: JDYinLV
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic! 3 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Boudin's for fresh sour dough, Pier 39 and easy walking access to everything else in the area including CVS Pharmacy and Cost Plus (where we purchased wine from one of the wineries we visited in Sonoma.) A short walk takes you to the cable car turnaround, and be sure to stop across the street at for a crab melt and a Ramus fizz! This tuscan-themed hotel was charming, clean & comfortable and the complimentary concierge service was so helpful. The daily wine tasting held in the lobby was also a welcome perk. Our room was very clean and newly furnished, but could've used some sheets that fit the bed a bit better. Overall, had a great experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: PaulGaines
Reviews.Content: I had a great time here! I would definetley come again!

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Coatser74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, the rooms are lovely, very clean, modern, and comfy! Our room looked out onto a pretty kinda courtyard area, we did feel a bit overlooked, so kept the blinds closed which was a shame. The parking was free, which was great, and the hotel was conveniently located for public transport, and local attractions. I had very, very itchy sore eyes whilst staying here, I think this may be because it is a pet friendly hotel, so if you suffer with allegies, you may wish to stay clear! However, I should reiterate that the room looked very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than 2007, and That Was Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: dubuquer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2007, and returned earlier this month. Of the four hotels I have used in San Francisco, this one is by far the best. My major complaint two years ago was the lack of a public access Internet computer for guests, and that has been corrected. My only complaint this time is the phone book in my room was 2 years old. Was the room small? Not as small as in London hotels, and It was primarily for sleeping; I was out and about most of the time. Did my room have a great view? No, but if you just want to see San Francisco by looking out the window, you might as well stay home and watch a travelogue on TV. As for in-and-out parking, I have seen a lot of San Francisco with no car at all. The city has outstanding public transportation, and it's a great place for walking, too. It's hard to sympathize with some of the whiners who have written derogatory reviews of this hotel. I found the concierge and front desk staff to be helpful and the housekeepers to be quite good. I have stayed in some pathetic hotels both in the US and abroad; this was not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: Zorro2426134
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and thought that we booked 2 queens, however they were in fact 2 double beds (there are no 2 queen bed options). The hotel was just ok. It was in a good position with a short walk to to Fishermans Wharf. Importantly the room we stayed in was clean and reasonably comfortable. It was a little noisy (outside) as we had a room that overlooked the main road. The hotel seemed to be very 'warm' inside which meant that you needed to run the air conditioner to get the room to a reasonable temperature. A small point that was frustrating was that the air conditioner was located on the floor which meant that when the air conditioner was on it blowed air straight into your face when lying down on the bed closest to the air conditioner. The check in & check out were very efficient, however my personal opinion was that the staff did not go out of their way to be friendly or welcoming. We dined in the restaurant in the hotel. The meal was very nice with a great atmosphere. Overall for the price we paid, it was a reasonable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of icing, little cake.”
Reviews.Author: Humboldtus
Reviews.Content: I am having a hard time understanding the positive reviews for this hotel. I guess some people go for image. I was looking forward to a nice stay based on what I had seen on BW website and the reviews here. I was disappointed. This is the type of hotel that has a fancy lobby and nice pictures and decorations throughout the building, but as for substance--lacking. My room was supposedly upgraded to a larger room, but if this was the case I'd hate to see the smaller rooms. The room had fancy colorful furniture, but was small and lacked certain things a higher-priced place like this ($170) should have. There was no hair dryer, no microwave, and I am still not sure if I was using shampoo or some type of lotion (the tube didn't really say clearly). Their windows were stylish, but who cares when the view is lousy and they are small and only open slightly? They have a parking garage, but they make you leave your vehicle for them to park (it costs extra to park) and then if you want to take a drive later, you have to wait for the staff to get it. I did this and it took them a long time to get my car. There is no real parking space, so I had to pull up in front of the hotel in a small space. If there were others wanting in at the same time, someone would have had to park on the street or drive around the block. Also, the location is dull; nothing of real interest withing a couple of blocks all around. There is a restaurant adjoining the hotel, but not owned by the hotel, where I ate dinner. The food was okay but not great. The only really good thing about the hotel was I didn't have to pay for it since it was a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: ForbesAustralia
Reviews.Content: Best location in Fisherman's Wharf. Within walking distance of shops, restaurants and tours. Free internet access and Happy Hour every afternoon. Concierge was extremely helpful and we were able to plane three great tours for three different days. Very clean and the house keeping was fantastic. Had to pay for use of safe but was great value for money. We booked one month in advance and received a great discount.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location...terrible staff...”
Reviews.Author: Toofullahope
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the Hotel, we were given a 'double' room instead of the King we had booked for our romantic weekend. When confronted about the 'mistake' on their part we were told that we were wrong, until we showed the girl at the front desk our print off from Hotels.com. Instead of apologizing and correcting the issue, we were told that nothing could be done until the next day. Not even a smile was sent our way. The Tuscan staff moved our packed luggage into the new room, and my husband and I discovered that both of our phone chargers were missing. When we approached the Manager about this, we were accused of not packing them to begin with. Finally, we were told that the Manager would run out and purchase our charges that day and overnight them to our home. None of this was done, and now we are forced to go and purchase them ourselves. Nothing has been done to correct our issues while staying at the Tuscan. This experience has left a very poor taste in our mouths, and we will definitely never stay there again. I will also make it a point to never recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family that travel to San Francisco in the future. Which is a pitty, because the location was wonderful, and two of the staff members were really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend was PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: denstar
Reviews.Content: First - Kudos to Lita in the office. Our planning for a girls weekend was wonderful working through Lita - she helped with EVERTHING and made sure we were taken care of. Upon arrival, check in was a breeze - wine was delivered to the room - all was great. The hotel was perfectly located down by the wharf - and we could get to everything very very easily. Check out a breeze also. We would go back in a heartbeat. Phenominal Service, great room, great location - couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “nice but cramped”
Reviews.Author: Kathy8992
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the elegant lobby we were greeted pleasantly by the staff. We did not have a reservation so our room selection was limited. While the room was clean and adequate it was very small with windows that across a miniscule courtyard to other windows. The shutters needed to be kept at a tilt or others could easily see in. Shears would have been nice enabling the light to come in but maintain some daytime privacy. My husband found it very claustrophobic. There was little room to put our bags. A big negative for us was that when ever we left our room the hallway reeked of cigarettes and cigars. There was valet parking at a cost of $42. They did cater to dogs. It was frustrating to wait to use the computer. In a hotel that size they really should have 2. There was an attached restaurant that was very pricy. The concierges was great with helping to find our way around. Location in proximity to the Fisherman's Wharf was only 2 easy blocks away. I would stay there again making sure to get an outside facing room away from a no smoking area. If all the rooms are as small I would not want to stay for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KayDances
Reviews.Content: Great comfortable beds and convenient to the fisherman's wharf area. Within walking distance of Pier 39, Alcatraz tours, and in the opposite direction Ghiradelli Sq, Historic Ships and Cable Car lines. Loved the wine reception, perfect to relax after a day of site seeing. Helpful staff and safe surrounds. Loved staying here and would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Stay At The Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: IslandsR4Me
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn for two nights. Check-in was quick and efficient. The room was clean and had a lot of natural light. We stayed in room 214, a junior suite, and the room was the perfect size for the three of us. A short hallway lead to the sitting area which had a sofa, chair, television, coffee table, mini refrigerator and nice work area. The hallway had a nice size, curtained closet. The bedroom had two double beds, a small closet, dresser, chair and coffee/tea set up. The room faced the street and the windows actually opened, which was a nice surprise. We heard very little street noise at night. The bathroom only had a single sink, but it was very large. The hotel is located two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and its many attractions and eateries. It is just a short, fun and windy ride to Union Square. We did not eat at the restaurant attached to the hotel, however, there are plenty of places to eat near the hotel. There is also a Trader Joe's, Cost Plus, Safeway grocery store, and Barnes & Noble Bookstore within one block of the hotel. Check-out was also quick and efficient. We called the valet before we left our room and when we finished checkout, the car was waiting in the drive for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay in San Francisco near the Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: carlysgran
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot for visiting the Fisherman's Wharf area. As suggested in other reviews, we requested a courtyard view room and it was quiet. When we arrived the receptionist said the room we requested was not ready, but we could get into another right away. When we said we would wait (to get the quieter room), Low And Behold, there was a room available right away. BE SURE to stand your ground if you have specified a particular room!. As said before, the free wine reception in the evening is Two Buck Chuck, drinkable, but certainly not anything to write home about. The Safeway across the street is convenient for snacks and sweet rolls. Got some rolls each night to have with our coffee in the morning. There is a great bookstore next door if you run out of reading material and also a Cost Plus store (didn't go in, but they usually have some great wines for reasonable prices if you want to pass on the two buck chuck). The room was very clean & adequate size. Bed a little soft. Parking is pricey. If you are a AAA member, be sure to get the discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Small Rooms Some charm”
Reviews.Author: CarlanneNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Although it is close to Fisherman's Wharf, it is far enough away to be comfortable. It has some charms in decor, and all staff gave very good service to us. Great morning coffee, but no bisquotti as claimed. Wine hour was welcome but it was Two Buck Chuck (not that I don't drink that) but it is really $2 a bottle at Trader Joes in California, $3 in NJ, so the admonishion on the sign that only two (meagerly poured) glasses per person was a bit unnecessary and kind of rude to guests. They also served some form of food with the wine. Free internet in the lobby but none of any sort in the rooms. Rooms are quite small if you need two beds but prettily decorated and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: t42
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a more convenient hotel for sight seeing in San Francisco. The bus stops outside the door; the F streetcar is a block away; the Powell-Hyde trolley car two blocks away; the wharf two blocks away. The staff are very friendly and helpful, particularly the concierges and the Manager's Reception is a nice touch. The hotel itself is very attractive. We loved the food at Cafe Pescatore - so nice when you are too tired to go far to eat. Having said all that, the room could have been better. There isn't much drawer space if you are staying long enough to unpack. I have a bad back and found the mattress soft and uncomfortable. Each day we had to leave a note asking for more towels, even though the request is on our profile. The toilet and sink are separated by a door but are operated by the same light switch so it is impossible to turn the light on in the toilet without also turning on the light in the room, an inconvenience to the partner trying to sleep! I no sooner commented on the sharp edge of the nighttables when my partner rolled over and cut his forehead - we moved them away from the bed after that. Although some reviewers have commented on noise, we found the room very quiet and never noticed noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jpulkrabek
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its great location. The rooms were nice and the staff was very friendly. We may have been slightly noisy, and we got no complaints. I would stay again, great value.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: jcoltrain
Reviews.Content: A perfect location, can get loud outside, but overall would recommend hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Grat hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildcattourist
Reviews.Content: I had never been to SF. Found this hotel and got a package deal. Really good location for me. Close to the wharf, trains/bus stops, grocery stores(trader joes,safeway)/shopping(barnes and noble, cost plus world market). They also had a complimentary wine tasting every afternoon. I liked being able to have a couple drinks before dinner and it was a great way to save a few bucks. Staff was very friendly/helpful. The only complaint I have is it was very loud in our room. We heard a lot of street traffic, and hall traffic. With that said, I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “San frans best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: carnivalqueen1
Reviews.Content: TWe actually stayed at this hotel as part of a road trip through west coast USA and it was a bit ao an accident that we even stayed here but wow was it a good accident! The location was amazing just a short walk from the cable car turn and all the main attractions at pier 39. There was a super market just across the street which was handy and the staff were sooo helpful! The wine evenings were a nice touch but we only managed to make it for one as we were always out sight seeing or sleeping!! A nice complimentary breakfast too which was good as the breakfast in the restaurant was a bit pricey. The room was quite small but perfectly formed with a super bathroom. Would definately recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: WoodyOk
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in San Fran lots of times -- Hilton, Sheraton, & Marriott always on the Wharf. We thought we would like to try someplace new. We checked in late on Thursday night and were greated by Gregory Hartzell and he could not have been nicer! When got to our room it looked just like the pictures, which was a surprise....really nice....the bed slept well...the towels were fluffy....clean, clean, clean....NO complaints. Had read some reviews about small rooms - but what do you need the extra space for? There was plenty. We will definately stay here next time...my new BEST place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DurhamPitLad
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for several nights in June 09 and loved the place. Checking in was quick and easy, the staff we're pleasant and I requested a low floor room which I got. Room was large enough, clean and contained what you'd expect. Got vouchers for a Continental breakfast in the connected cafe/bar on site, got a bowl of fruit, muffin, tea/coffee and fruit juice which was great, could also pay extra $5 and get a large breakfast (usual fare) and that was very tasty. The hotel lobby was lovely, real fire, large comfy chairs and free internet access in the corner. Every day at 5pm there would be complimentary wine with nibbles, this was a treat and we chatted to other guests each night, all guests seemed very happy about the hotel. The location was great, walk out the doors and forward 250 yards and you're on Pier39 and Fishermans Wharf right on the sea front. This is where you can eat, watch the sea lions, tickets to Alcatraz are further along the pier to the right. If you turned right out the hotel you'd get to other Piers (the one where you buy Alcatraz tickets, maybe Pier 41 ?). If you walked out the hotel and turned left, you could easily reach North Beach in 15 mins or so and even Union Square and China Town in 30 mins. I found it very safe at night but it's best being very aware so keep you eyes open, espeically at cross road lights. All in all a fab hotel in a great city, can't recommend the place enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Jazzfan
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at Best Western-Tuscan Inn was great, location to the wharf, cable cars and everything we wanted to see and do. It couldn't have got any better for the price, will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with all the amenities, European feel and reasonable pricing.”
Reviews.Author: UncleJoeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Tuscan Inn for the last ten years, always in June in connection with an annual event in San Francisco that I participate in. The location of Fisherman's Wharf area made me suspicious, as the area is very "touristy". However, the Tuscan Inn has the best of all worlds- great location, all the amenities, excellent staff, nice restaurant adjoining, and very reasonable prices. They have guests from all over the world, and the tradition of wine tasting each evening makes for some great new acquaintances and friendships.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: baseballjunkie6
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews was not disappointed. Was surprised upon check-in to get an upgrade without even asking. Nice, clean rooms. You could eat off the bathroom floor it was so clean. Across the street from Safeway which makes it nice to get drinks and snacks for a lengthly stay. One block from Trader Joes, Borders Book Store, a few other places. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Josie58
Reviews.Content: We decided to change our travel plans when we saw the great rates offered at this Best Western in the Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco. It is close to the special attractions of the waterfront, cable cars and stores. Rooms are very comfortable and we were charged $15 for parking our motorcycle in the garage. There is a concierge, also free wine and appetizers in the afternoon. It is one of the few opportunities to socialize with other travellers and we picked up some great tips from a couple from Denmark. On the downside, this is the only Best Western on our trip that did not offer a continental breakfast, just a beverage. So, be prepared to go out somewhere for breakfast or try the Safeway across the street. Would definitely return to this hotel and see more of the area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, Good room”
Reviews.Author: karmickreator
Reviews.Content: Located only two blocks away from Fishermans wharf is this hotels greatest asset. Our room was a bit small, but overall good for the value. I was disappointed they didnt have complimentary breakfast, but with all the good restaurants around I guess it didnt really matter. The rooms were clean and updated, the beds were comfortable, and the bellman service was fast and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great prices for the Wharf area”
Reviews.Author: b2simonsbus
Reviews.Content: We loved the location--easy walking distance to the wharf and cable cars. Reasonable prices, if San Francisco prices can be called reasonable! Rooms were clean and had typical amenities. Had to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rosielou2
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 6 nights in early May. Everything was outstanding. We had not one complaint. Food at restaurant great. Incredible location. Everyhting you want to do is within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: chellandmike
Reviews.Content: This hotel has tons to do within walking distance, and the price we paid for it made it a great deal on travelzoo for 85.00, however that being said if you are used to staying at true Kimpton hotels this will leave you wanting, but again location and price makes this a great hotel, the wine they serve is 2 buck chuck get there early if you want to partake, there were people everywhere waiting for the pourings, so we decided to skip out on this one

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and value!”
Reviews.Author: J4Lori22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Tuscan Inn. We stayed for 9 nights and couldn't be happier. The location was perfect (close enough to walk to most everything but just out of the way enough it was quiet). The rooms were clean and well-cared for. Everyone we encountered (except the valet guys at the front) were more than accomodating. The minibar was great (once we removed all the hotel items and filled it with drinks we bought from the supermarket one block up). Our ONLY complaint was one doorman/valet wasn't thrilled about us parking the car at the front *momentarily* while we removed our bags from the car we rented. Other than that-perfect trip. We would definately stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travel2time
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location to the Wharf and other sites in the city. Although the rooms are small it was very clean. Hugo the concierge was very knowledgeable, helpful and fun too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: LolaBaggins
Reviews.Content: My partner and I along with 2 friends stay at the Tuscan Inn for 1 night. Normally, I would not consider Best Western but as it is a Kimpton hotel along with great Trip Advisor reviews, I booked it. We arrive early and while they were not able to give us 2 rooms right away, they gave us one right away. Not only that, they upgrade us to suites which were very nice and spacious. Be sure to sign up for the Kimpton In-touch program. It give us lotsa perks. As a Kimpton hotel, they offer little things like coffee/tea in the morning in the lobby and wine hour from 5-6pm. Hotel staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable. They recommended a couple of local nearby breakfast places that we really enjoyed. Darren's offer great value western breakfast and vietnamese food of all things... If you want something more funky and local, Pat's offers another option.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: gsba_8
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Tuscan Inn San Francisco was sleepless! Our tiny room, was furnished nicely, however, right outside of window was not only a wall, but huge ducts that kept going off and on all night. Our room was not inexpensive. When we checked out I told the clerk about the noise and she replied that they had never heard that before. No apology. The staff at the desk didn't go out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joebaba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for four nights in mid May 2009. We were in town for the Bay to Breakers. What a wonderful spot. We had a car, so we started with the valet. He was very friendly, and explained just what we had to do to retrieve our car â€“ when they were available (24/7), how long to expect to wait to retrieve the car ( about 7 minutes), etc. He also helped us with our bags to the front desk. The front desk staff were very friendly and efficient. Our room rate was all in order â€“ weâ€™d booked a TravelZoo special, and the front desk had the right rate, and the right parking discount. We asked for a high room, and off the street. We got exactly that. We went down for the free wine reception, and had a great time. We met a number of other travellers, and the wine pour-ers and hostess were very friendly and efficient. The wine reception each night became an event we looked forward to (for more than just the wine!). The wine is Charles Shaw (two buck Chuck) so you wine afficianados should not get too excited, but it was fine for our standards. The room itself was a little small - pretty normal for the wharf area. But it was immaculate and nicely decorated. The bed was big and very comfortable. One interesting thing â€“ the room doors open out to the hallway, rather than in to the room. This makes the room seem slightly bigger, as the door does not swing into the room, taking up space. Iâ€™m surprised more hotels donâ€™t do this. The bathroom door does the same thing, making the bathroom seem slightly larger. The room was very quiet. We'd seen some reviews saying the rooms that face the street are noisy, so by asking for a room off the street, we got a very quiet room. The air conditioning worked perfectly. Yes â€“ we needed air conditioning in San Francisco. It was unseasonably warm when we were there. We ate in the hotel restaurant â€“ an Italian theme â€“ and it was very good. Good food and service. The concierge was very helpful and extremely friendly. We did find the concierge was very busy in the mornings, trying to arrange tours for people. We didnâ€™t use the workout facility. The hotel has one computer (with printer) available with free internet. And free wi-fi throughout the hotel which worked flawlessly. This is a Best Western, but it is operated by Kimpton - so it is pet friendly. They advertised that with a picture of the manager's dog on the check in desk. All in all it was a wonderful stay and Iâ€™d highly recommend it â€“ we did get an amazing rate, so that made it seem even better. The location is excellent if you want to be near the wharf. It was a two block walk to Pier 39. And the street it was on (North Point), was busy enough to always feel safe walking, but not so busy that you felt crowded. The only downside, is not a fault of the hotel â€“ rather, my personal preference. We usually stay in the Marina District, but we wanted a hotel near the wharf so we could walk to the Bay to Breakers (we didnâ€™t want to stay near Union Square, even though it would have been more convenient). I like visiting the Wharf, but personally, Iâ€™d rather stay in the Marina District, and visit the wharf. To be honest, I was pretty sick and tired of the wharf after four days. But again, that was my choice, not a hotel problem. All in all, if you want to stay near the wharf, Iâ€™d highly recommend the Tuscan Inn. Though Iâ€™d try to get a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Did we all stay in the same hotel??”
Reviews.Author: DEPCalifornia
Reviews.Content: They are getting three stars because the room was very clean and the hotel is close to the wharf. I live about an hour north of San Francisco and have stayed in many hotels in the city and always enjoyed them until this past week. I am surprised anyone would find this place a gem. The staff is very rude and doesn't seem to care at all about their guests. Didn't seem to matter who was at the front desk, they treated everyone bad, the same with the valet. The location is good and the rooms are very pretty and clean. But the beds are awful. You come in and the room looks so nice. Then you sit down on the bed and get the thrill of springs hitting you wherever you lay or sit. We were five people with two rooms...four beds and all the beds were awful. It was worse than sleeping in some $50.00 a night room. Of course you have the added thrill of paying over $40 a night for parking and whatever your chiropractor bill is when you are done with the beds. Someone said it was quiet. We had street side rooms and all night long there were busses and loud noises so no one got good sleep. Go to The Palace or Parc 55, get treated like gold and they have the most comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: garnet107
Reviews.Content: So clean, quiet, excellent location, delicious coffee bar every morning, staff helpful & friendly. Best thing: Sampling California wines in the very comfy, beautiful lobby, with a roaring fire; we looked forward to coming back each afternoon. Room a bit tiny, but so clean and comfy...bathroom spotless and nicely appointed. Loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Pearl”
Reviews.Author: Burgili
Reviews.Content: This is our second time in the Tuscan Inn and we are as satisfied with the hotel as we were last year. We had however a little irritation with the front desk concerning the security deposit and our request to talk to a responsible management person. Through the support of the concierge Hugo we finally got in contact with Pearl. She not only explained the need for a security deposit to our full satisfaction but also surprised us later with an unexpected and generous gift bag in our room. This action showed how high the hotel management values the well feeling of theÃ­r guests and that is what we want to appreciate through this comment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: warfield
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we have stayed at the Tuscan Inn and each time it has been excellent. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help you. We had a double room with 2 queen beds. Although the rooms are not huge, our room was still easily big enough for 2 adults and a child (plus 3 weeks of holiday gear). The hotel is close to Fisherman's Wharf (5 minutes walk max from the seafront) but not so close that it gets the noise. The base of the cable car line is one block away and there is a Safeways one block away as well. At 5 pm every day the hotel holds an informal reception where you can have a couple of glasses of wine and normally some food brought in from the Italian restaurant next door. After spending an exhausting day walking the hills of SF, this is a great way to unwind before heading off for a meal. In our case we used the adjacent Italian restaurant-if you are staying at the Tuscan Inn you get 10% off your bill. They've got an underground garage at the Tuscan Inn but we didn't use it, as we there is no need for a car in SF. The cable cars provide an easy way of getting around SF but the costs can soon mount up if you are using them continually. We walked much of the time and took in the views.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Value, Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: FRAMICH
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to SF and we were not sure of where to stay and what to do. This hotel location could not be any better. It is only a few blocks from the wharf and 1 block from the cable car turn around. The rooms were nice & clean. The wine reception was very nice but they could have used a few more seats. We found a nice place to eat breakfast just down the block called the Hollywood Cafe. It had a large selection at the cheapest prices around and the food was excellent. The staff & concierge were all very helpful and gave us a lot of tips of what to see and where to eat. I would stay here again without a second thought

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Tuscan”
Reviews.Author: slotsgal
Reviews.Content: I found a great mid week deal that included a discount on parking. The front desk staff was efficent and friendly. The lobby area is decorated nicely with nice chairs and sofas to mingle at before heading out to have fun. Tuscan offers complimentary glasses of wine at 5 which is a nice touch. The room I stayed in had two doubles and a slight view of the Coit tower. Nice flat screen tv. The room was very clean and the beds comfortable. The room also has free wireless which I've read other hotels nearby don't. It was nice visiting SF during the off season and really enjoyed the stay. This is the nicest BW I've ever stayed at. It should have a higher rating on TripAdvisor. Perfect location to Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: WexfordSusie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this hotel we were instantly upgraded for our 7 night stay and also received complimentary champagne on arrival we were delighted with this and were made feel very welcome! The rooms are exceptionally clean and also the bathrooms. I have to say I see everyone that reviews this hotel compliments the front desk staff I actually found from the second day on that they were most unhelpful and actually quite rude! when the internet connection was down in the hotel lobby I very politely asked the front desk to print off our tickets for alcatraz at which I was left waiting for 10 minutes before being very rudely told that if I really needed to have these printed off then the concierge could help me, but I also found him to be most put out by my request! Also on my third day I came back from a long day sightseeing and stopped at the front desk to ask for milk and sugar to be sent up to the room as we wanted to have a coffee after our long day at which I was told to go into the restaurant and ask the waiting staff myself and take it up to my room myself! as you can imagine I was not happy!!!! so at this point I realised I would just keep to myself and use the hotel to sleep in and nothing else which is exactly what I done. I was really dissapointed as we were on honeymoon and were hoping for somewhere that we would be looked after a little. So to sum up if your looking for somewhere to lay your head after a long day then this is the place for you if your looking for something a bit special with good customer service avoid this place like the plague

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trippin76
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Kimpton hotels and I have to say the Tuscan Inn was not one of their best. It was just a nice Best Western. Upon check-in they did not have my reservation (I booked through Hotels.com) and they woman working the counter was not very friendly about it and acted very annoyed. She eventually found a hard copy of my reservation and I got my room but she never apologized for the mix-up or anything. The room was nice and bigger than I thought it would be so that was good. The bathroom was clean and the bed was comfy. The location was really the best part. Right on the bus line and only 2 blocks from all the action of Fisherman's Wharf. I don't know that Tuscan Inn would be my first choice for a place to stay next time but it wouldn't be the last either. It's a maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: NateKinFL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Tuscan Inn. Upon arrival we were greeted immediately and got checked in within 3 minutes. I'm not sure why so many people say the rooms are small here, but our standard king size bed room was huge in my opinion. We were at the end of a hall with a small courtyard view. This room was a nite respite from all the noise of the city and a a great quiet getaway at night. We were extremely pleased with the cleanliness of the room. It doesn't get cleaner. The bed was extremely comfortable and the amenities were excellent. They provide you with great aveda products in the bathroom. Free Wifi in your room, and the free wine reception in the evenings was great. All the staff was friendly, though I found the maintanence and housekeeping staff to be the warmest in the building. I did not take advantage of the concierge service, but I saw many people were receiving great service from them. We would defenitely stay here again. Great value and service for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: robbomcdobbo
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and very comfortable. The staff and service were exceptional. I don't think you could do better for location, especuially if you're visiting the city for the first time.easy access to everything - there's even a safeway next door if you'd like to garb a muffin for breakfat. The free happy hour really made the visit extra special - we met so many wonderful people during our 7 day stay this way.

Reviews.Title: “Every hotel should have this staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Parliment
Reviews.Content: Im actually still in the hotel and couldnt wait to write my review, but from the moment we arrived the staff at this best western could not have done more for us. From the Manager, all the way down to the Car porters, i have never enjoyed my stay at a hotel like i have staying here. Every hotel should have the staff that is here at the Best western Tuscan inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfy convienent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovecje
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our 10 year anniversary and liked the convience of the hotel. I used the recommendations of others who have stayed there as well from trip advisor and requested a courtyard room. Didn't get it the first night but did the other nights, thankfully the room the first night was quiet. The hotel was supposed to deliver champagne as requested by my sister and they did not do that- so that was a little dissapointing! Concierge lady in the front lobby was very rude and felt like I was inconveiancing her by asking her a question. LOVED the Hollywood Cafe just down the street on Noth Point! Their crossaint with fruit was really good (my husband I shared it, as it was huge!)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, quiet room, easy access to all of SF”
Reviews.Author: CanadianDoll
Reviews.Content: The rooms were smallish and could get a little damp if you didn't keep the air conditioning unit on, but the beds were comfortable, and the courtyard-view room we had was very quiet. The wine tasting in the evenings was a fantastic feature, it was timed perfectly so that we could have a glass of wine before going out for dinner. Checkout early Wednesday morning took about 2 minutes to complete, no complaints with the staff. The concierge can give discounts for booking city tours and for some restaurants, although we tried Neptune's which was recommended to us and felt it was overpriced for the service and quality. Fisherman's Wharf was very touristy, but we appreciated the safety of the area at night, and stores close by like Safeway and Walgreens. The Tuscan Inn is close to the MUNI system cable cars, and is on 2 bus lines so we were able to travel all over the city without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Okay at sale prices”
Reviews.Author: Bailey03
Reviews.Content: Got a great reduced rate so no complaints on price. The mattresses were sub standard-creaked when sitting on them and turning over. Fisherman's Wharf is over rated.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about Amazing Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Red_Flag_V
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to San Francisco for her 30th birthday & we were treated like visiting royalty! Too many little extras to mention in this limited space, but here are a couple: I requested they prepare a cheese and fruit platter for us to take on our Napa outing and imagine my surprise when the boxes were opened - the gourmet assortment of cheeses encircling an orchid, the freshest of various fruits, including chocolate dipped strawberries! The hotel staff - as a whole - were more than happy to go above and beyond to satisfy your request. The room was a bit small - but all we did there was sleep - so no complaints!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: AB_traveller_55
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn has a great location to tourist sites within San Francisco. Walking distance to Pier 39, bay ferries and tours, Ghirardelli Square, etc. Streetcars and cable cars are close to take you to Market Street, the Ferry Terminal, etc. The Inn is clean, and welcoming.
