It has a good look, nice sitting area in the lobby, wine hour every night, friendly and helpful staff. The rooms we had were a good size and clean. It was basic, but that was OK for us. I had trouble with the hot water in my shower but it was fixed the same day I reported the problem. I personally appreciated the free internet service in the hotel. All-in-all, compared to other hotels in the area, we were both impressed and happy with the Tuscan Inn and would recommend it. I did have to search through the usual online websites to find the best deal for rooms, but if you take time to look, I think you will be happy with the rates you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but what's with the Check in / out staff?”
Reviews.Author: RamboSacto
Reviews.Content: Was a nice, clean and quiet room. A little cramped, especially around the sink area. Excellent location, close to the wharf and cable car lines. Complementary coffee in the morning however, they have stopped with the biscotti! In addition, they advertise Limousine service to the financial district but when I inquired they announce they had stopped the service and I would need to take mass transportation. So I figured times must be hard. As I checked out I expressed my disappointment there were no biscottis and transportation service and the check out clerk tells me they do have the service and I needed to make an appointment. That set me off since I did try to do that. So I had problems with the check in and check out staff . On the other hand, the valet parking attendant/bell people were very friendly. Do not know if I will stay there again, due to the problems with the staff at the check in/out counter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Friendly & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: starskyhutch1
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn is located near Fisherman's Wharf with cable cars nearby. The Hotel & rooms are very clean and great food at their resturant. Also, the staff & Chief Chief Concierge are very friendly & knowledgable. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We Really Loved Every Minute Of Our Trip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SFOFUN
Reviews.Content: We had a great adventure. It was a last minute trip, totally unplanned. It could not have turned out better if we planned it. I haven't been to San Fran in 20 years. It was my daughter's first trip to San Fran and it was her birthday. She asked her best friend to come so I really wanted them to have a good time. I have to say if it weren't for the employees at the Tuscan Inn it wouldn't have been as good. Hugo, Gregori, Tanishia, and Ernie all went above and beyond to assist us in having a great trip. Hugo is one of a kind. He is one of the best Concierge's I have had the pleasure to meet. 5 STARS!!!!! All employee's that I mentioned have shown customer service skills that are above and beyond. Whatever questions asked they always came through with the answers that best suited our needs. From suggestions about resturants, tours, or just directions to the nearest movie theater. When we called down from our room with a request for extra towel blankets whatever we need it was delivered promptly to our room. We had a discussion on the plane that it was such a shame that customer service was gone in so many companies these days. It was so refreshing to see it is alive and well at the Tuscan Inn!! Thank You so much for making our trip one we won't soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: kaul
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Tuscan Inn Fisherman's Wharf based on the reviews we read on the computer and were not disappointed. Everything went smoothly from the moment we checked in. I loved the decor of the room and found it to be modern, calm and restful. We had a room with a King sized bed and although the room was small it was bright and very clean. The Manager's wine tasting in the lobby at 5 every evening gave guests a chance to meet and mingle. A very nice touch. It was our wedding anniversary during our stay and the Manager sent a bottle of sparkling wine to our room. That was a nice touch. The location is perfect being so close to the Wharf and Pier 39 and the Powel St. Cable cars. I only regret not staying at the Tuscan Inn for a third night as there is so much to do in the area. We traveled down the coast to Los Angeles after our stay in San Francisco and I must say that the Tuscan Inn was my favourite place to stay in California.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rubberbandeffect
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great - close to Fisherman's Wharf, within walking distance of Ghiradelli Square, boats to Alcatraz and two cable car lines. The room was big enough, though there wasn't a lot of extra room. It was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the room was quiet. Free internet and a computer for use in the lobby was helpful. The manager's cocktail hour was a nice touch, and the free coffee in the morning was also nice though I had to ask both mornings for hot chocolate to be brought out for the kids, and the advertised biscotti was no where to be found. Jorge was extremely friendly and helpful, but the rest of the staff was less animated and warm. Do try Pat's cafe around the corner for breakfast. It was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kmw4121
Reviews.Content: I Just stayed at the Tuscan inn and i was very impressed, from the awesome check in to the great consierge "ken" they were the most welcoming hotel i have stayed at in many years. i work in the industry so i know what a good stay is all about, i was upgraded to a duluxe suite on arrival for my 7 nights stay ( wich was greatly appreciated) The Hotel Restraunt Cafe is very good food and resonably priced compaired to the rest of the wharf and San Francisco in general ( if you do eat have the tomato soup with parmesan & the Seafood Risotto and if you can squeeze it in after the fist 2 courses the Tiramassou. one final note is that the barman "Seth" is a huge credit and assest to the hotel and is a delight to chat to allways in motion and never seeming to stop for one second unless he is serving you of course :p the only negative thing's i will say is that the coffee maker in the room is a dreadfull waste of space and thee coffee pods and i stick of sugar and 2 pouches of milk a day is ridiculas there are no tea coffee making facilitys in the rooms to be honest as the coffee maker is just plain crazy. also even when i went to the lobby at 6 am on a few of the days of my stay the coffee and tea were there but i never did see a biscottie the whole stay and i was first down some days. not a great problem but not as i expected from the reviews! also the wine gathering with the manager the one day i did attempt to attend it was so badly orgonised that i couldnt get to the table to get my wine so i just went tot he bar and had a drink there, but on the whole it was a great hotel and certain members of staff lift it out of the good to the great hotel that i experianced !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Valentines Weekend”
Reviews.Author: angeltiff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for Valentines weekend and just got back last night. We thought the hotel was a great value. We booked online through the hotel website and used our AAA card to get a discounted price and it was well worth it. I researched a bit before choosing to book with the Best Western. It's diagonally across from the Sheraton which was one of our options. We decided on the Best Western after we figured we'd save more and still be as close to Fisherman's wharf. Not only was it due to price, but after reading reviews and looking at pictures, the Best Western Tuscan just seemed to be more comfy and less touristy, which it was. The rooms are decorated well, not too flashy and yet still modern. Yes, the rooms aren't that big, but after deciding that our main goal was to find a nice clean hotel close to Fisherman's wharf and near a lot of the public transportation, it was a perfect choice for us. Although our weekend was during a storm, the close proximity to the piers and public transportation still made our location idea. The staff was very helpful in giving us suggestions and directions when we asked. They also scheduled our shuttle back to the SFO airport. I didn't get to take advantage of the free coffee in the morning, but my husband and I did go to the 5pm-6pm cocktail hour, which we enjoyed. It was nice to have a drink or two and talk to fellow travelers. Only complaint that we had was when we found out that there was no in-house gym. Although they didn't have a in-house gym, they did say they had passes to the 24 Hour Fitness across the street in the shopping center. Too bad it was raining pretty hard and discouraged us from going. (If you plan to stay for 2 to 3 days and are planning to take advantage of the public transportation in Downtown SF, get the 3-day MUNI pass for $18... the front desk can tell you where to get them. The hotel only offers 1 day passes for $11, which is a good deal, but if you are staying for longer, the 3-day pass is worth it... you even still save a bit if you only use it for 2-days.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: OregonDetective
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco to testify at a legal proceeding, decided to stay at Fisherman's Wharf. This hotel was a perfect choice. It seemed more like a Hilton than a Best Western. Very nice room, the bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows were better than my pillows at home. Very close to Fisherman's Wharf, a grocery store located right across the street, and very helpful and friendly staff. It was all good. If I ever return to Frisco, I will definitely stay at the Tuscan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sjmml
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn in September as a base for exploring San Francisco. Location-wise, the hotel was perfect; it was within walking distance of the pier for Alcatraz and a two minute walk away from the tram as well as Lombard Street. The rooms were a decent size for a city hotel and were very clean and well serviced. Coffee and biscotti were available in reception every morning free of charge or if you preferred, there was a restaurant in the hotel that served breakfast or a Starbucks round the corner. Most impressive of all though, was the assistance of the concierge who was incredible particularly when it came to organising our check-in on various flights etc. I would definitley stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: ZIPPYNEON
Reviews.Content: i was trying to find hotels close to the wharf so my family and i would not have to worry about driving and came across tuscan inn at fishermams wharf. read the reviews over and over....i wanted everthing to be decent because my kids are between 17 and 22 so they have their own lives so we do not get to spend much time together...anyway...this was important to me. i was beyond impressed....seems service just isn't the way it used to be.....people aren't as nice...they don't really smile or it almost seems to be an inconvience for you to be there. not here, every person i came in contact with was nice, friendly, wanted to help, and extemely professional....they even wiped my windows when they brought our car up to us in the morning. i can't tell you how much i appreciate the little things like that and just how impressed i was with EVERYONE there. not just one person was nice but everyone we came in contact with. hotel is decorated cute...i know...a girl thing but guys will like it too....its romantic without being gody !! does that make sense?? they have wine and beer hour at 5:00 pm which my husband and i din't do because of course we had our kids but i do plan on taking advantage of that another time...i thought it was a very nice thing to have. i just felt good being there....i'am 40 years old and its very disheartening that people have lost their pride of service and doing a good job. i want to praise this hotel for bringing it back...please do not change !!! i will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Love Fisherman's Wharf Area”
Reviews.Author: HDTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: Love Fisherman's Wharf. Sights are wonderful, food is excellent. Tuscan Inn is within walking distance of all Wharf attractions. Many choices for eating, shopping and activities. Parking is expensive, Rooms are on the small side. Staff is very helpful. Happy Hour each day from 5 - 6 PM. Still......a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wee hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Denise-Mark
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Tuscan Inn on our last 3 trips to San Francisco, and I really can't fault the service. The rooms are probably smaller than at a major chain, but you're not here to sit in your room. The staff at this hotel make you feel so welcome and its service with a smile. It's almost like you're part of a large Italian family. The wine reception is a great way to relax, meet fellow guests and wind down if you've had a long day sightseeing. All the staff go the extra mile to assist in anyway they can and the staff of the ajoining Cafe Pescatore are just as welcoming, with great service and the food is excellent. We feel at home here which is why we will be back this year too. It's a truely wonderful little hotel, with great people in a great location (bus stop across the street, f car one block down and cable car one block up and west where you can buy a 7 day ticket for all 3 - who needs a car!) We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom a bit dirty.”
Reviews.Author: Flutegarden
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a lot - a great location, great staff, free wine tastings and morning coffee. The room was pretty nice and spacious. However, parking is $30/night and valet only, which becomes a pain. Also, the bathroom was a bit dirty - brown water came out of the bath tub faucet initially and the sink wall by the toilet was dirty. I did not address these concerns during my stay, but did leave feedback on the website, to which I received no reply.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: BarbCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I chose this Hotel for out New Year's Eve "gettaway" based on the great reviews from Trip Advisor and we were not dissapointed! I booked a standard king room and was up graded to a premier king free of charge upon our arrival. The staff were very nice. The wine hour in the cozy lobby was great. Enjoyed talking with fellow travelers by the warm and inviting fireplace. Our room was very nice. We expected the room to be small based on all the reviews but it was very nicely decorated and super clean. The bed was very comfortable and the room itself was very quiet. The hotel is walking distance to many attractions. We ate at the Italian restaraunt located in the hotel and the food and service was outstanding. Check out the following morning was fast and flawless as we enjoyed fresh coffee and biscotti served complimentary in the lobby. I will go back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Again, a nice quaint hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BrentD
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel awhile back, I sort of knew what to expect. Check in was flawless, and we were even early arrivals at approx 12 noon. Room was on 4th floor overlooking the interior garden area. Seems the hotel has been completely renovated since our last stay. Our room had a nice clean bath/shower, all tile, and sink that was marble. Plenty of toiletries. The bed was very plush, and king size that was very comfortable. There were 2 alarm clocks on either side of the bed. Nice mini bar, and plenty of tv stations to watch before going to bed. The rooms are done in an Italian hue, and recently new carpet through out the entire hotel and our floor. The refridge was a bit noisy, and the air conditioner seemed a bit loud and woke me several times during the night, but really was not bad at all. Never experienced the room service. Never did partake in the 5 pm wine tasting as we were usually out at the Buena Vista chugging down Irish coffee until the late night. The hotel is very well located as previously mentioned in other reviews. We ate dinner at the attached restaurant the night prior to our departure for convenience, and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. Well done. All in all, would and have stayed here again. Paid around 205 a night booked through a hotel vendor website. It is very "touristy" by the wharf. As other times we have stayed more in the financial district, and probably would the next time for a different feel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Emily's_Grandad
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 week vacation incorporating 6 days in California followed by a cruise. We chose the Best Western Tuscan Inn as our base whilst in San Francisco on the first three nights of our tour. We arrived at SFR approximately 1 hour late due to flight delays at London Heathrow and in the pouring rain and, of course, suffering from jet lag. Despite all this, we found the Tuscan Inn easily in a city strange to us. After reading other reviews on Trip Advisor we made sure that we had a "Garden View" room as we knew that the jet lag would see us awake at about 2:00am! I don't know about the street view rooms but we had no problems with noise whatsoever. The rooms were pleasant, clean and did not disappoint. The hotel is certainly well placed for access to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 etc. My wife suffers from arthritis and cannot walk far but we had no problems in walking to the departure point for Alcatraz tours, Mr. Toad's city tour, Cable Cars, etc. Staff were helpful and generally friendly. The daily wine reception was a great idea as it got guests together and talking about their experiences of the day. Was a little upset by waiter serving wine at the second of these we went to. On arriving we initially spoke to some other guests and I then went to request two glasses of wine on behalf of myself and my wife - reaction was, in broken English, - "Only two glasses each!" I explained we had just arrived and this was our first drink. "NO, only two glasses" "We haven't had one yet!" "I must see your room key" With annoyance I retrieved and displayed the key and finally got a glass of wine. I know they don't want clients getting drunk at their expense but at the end of the day it wasn't even quality wine just a very cheap plonk. Only other downer was $38 per night for valet parking. Being from UK this kind of thing is alien to me but I did know in advance and chose to accept it - apparently other guests with larger cars were paying over $50 ! Apart from the one incident above I would have no reservations about recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: fadedtan
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The hotel was clean and convenient. The staff was helpful and friendly. We never went to the evening wine party but it looked very popular. We were street side which was a bit noisy some mornings with truck deliveries.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dog-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LAKen2
Reviews.Content: This is a hassle-free place to stay with a dog. I travel with my small poodle and usually, even though hotels will say that they welcome pets, the front desk people give you a certain look when you walk in and out of the lobby with your dog.......NOT HERE!!! I've never stayed at a more dog-friendly place. I saw a couple checking in with 3 large dogs (retrievers) so apparently there isn't a weight limit, maybe a limit of 3 dogs??? I stayed in a suite.......a note to those considering staying in a suite....I thought that mine was rather small so I asked if the suites were the same size and was told, "they're about the same". Ended up staying in my suite as it was a busy weekend but I did get to view the suite directly across from mine and there was a huge difference ( I would guess about an extra 100 sf). So, make sure that you request one of the larger suites, they are all priced the same. If your dog tends to be a little disruptive or on the noisy side, there is a bathroom fan that you can keep on to make noise. Also, the room air conditioners/heaters make some sound which can also help to mask noise. My dog is very well-behaved so I'm lucky but I never once heard any other dog noise while I was there. Stay here, your dog (and you) will love it.

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: janneman10
Reviews.Content: room was quiet, clean with good beds but very very small not a cheap hotel valit parking was to much expencive but oke its the location

Reviews.Title: “Liked staying at Tuscon Inn”
Reviews.Author: Gidoctor
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via booking.com at KLM website. I went through a lot of reviews and the one from Frommers Guide was most helpful. I got a good rate and no prepayment from the KLM website( linked to booking.com). Tuscon Inn was near the pier 39, which is a great location, checking in and out was easy. The staff were very helpful. The room was nice, good size and quite clean. The bathroom was big and clean as well. Although I was alone, room was good enough for a couple. The hotel had free coffee and drinks everyday and free access to wireless internet. The adjacent served nice breakfast. Great location and hotel. Try and not book anything from the hotel though, just walk up pier 39 and you will have more choice. The hotel does arrange a shuttle to the airport without any extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, friendly place to stay on the wharf”
Reviews.Author: PandaExpress
Reviews.Content: We had a quick trip to SF and decided to stay here so we could easily walk to the wharf, pier 39 and Ghirardeli chocolate square. We choose this place primarily based on other user reviews on TripAdvisor. The room is nice, very cozy (i.e. fairly small) but well put together and comfortable. We took everyone's advice and requested an interior courtyard view (basically looking at the opposing wall of the hotel) and so we didn't hear any noise. We were incredibly lucky and came here when the weather was very good. Free coffee and biscotti in the morning helped get the GF out of bed. It was funny to run into a fellow husband in the elevator bringing back coffee for this wife as well. Parking is crazy expensive, we drove up from LA so we had a car - but otherwise, you really don't need it. Staff was friendly and helpful - we had no issues. Most of the other guests are foreigners.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catmachine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights mid October, in a suite to cater for 2 couples. The first room we had was kinda worn, no view, and you could hear noisy a/c units, and the beds felt worn, as you could feel the springs if you pressed firmly!! Not good! Unfortunately, I had come down with a rather nasty throat infection on this, the 2nd leg of our extensive trip, coming from 5 nights in Santa Monica, LA. Anyway, the next morning I requested another room with either a street or garden courtyard view. Big difference! The room we got was bigger, toward the rear of the building, so a long walk from lift, but well worth it. It also had a pleasant courtyard view. This room also felt as if it had been used maybe a third as much as the other one!! Perhaps they like to let out all the 'close to lift ' rooms to be kind to housekeeping?!? Biggest difference though - the beds - no uncomfortable springs!! Also, the bathrooms were quite well set up, with a seperate toilet/shower to basin, so whilst one guest is showering another can use the basin. Decor etc. was quite nice and fresh looking, and it is because of this that I would not hesitate to come back - provided I got a similar room! Internet provided via a pc in foyer was very handy!! Only thing I missed was a gym, for some reason I had an inclination to use the gyms while we were O/S!? Service was all good, albeit a bit stoic. I was dutifully helped at 130am when I wanted a hospital to nip my sickness in the bud, which was much appreciated. However, I felt a little weird, almost uncomfortable when on a couple of nights, whilst suffering coughing fits, I decided to go downstairs and use the internet, so as to not keep my fellow guests awake. Upon arriving downstairs, I found the duty manager/staff napping on the (guest?) lounges !!. It didn't bother me, but felt a little weird, like I was interrupting them!! Anyways, one night we came back just after they had turned off the coffee machine in the restaurant, but the wonderful waiter/maitre'd organised some hot drinks for us in the biggest mugs I've ever seen - LEGEND!!! We all loved San Fran - fantastic city with great selection of restaurants etc, Fishermans Wharf was great also - ate at Wipeout, where the waiters were very honest with what to order!! Ate at Caesars old style Italian - fantastic for price, and also Mona Lisa on Columbus in awesome Little Italy. Unfortunately we didn't get to dine in the hotel restaurant, but I'd say it would be good, if the after hours service is anything to go by! Can't wait to go back to SF and explore some more, i.e.Berkely Sausalito etc. If you like architectural history do the 'Ghost Tour' from Queen Anne Hotel...fantastic, intriguing history in most exclusive area of city.The hotel is nice and close to Fishermans Wharf and other attractions, which was really handy.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price...”
Reviews.Author: divecozumel
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms on Priceline for $139 each, just an overnight stay while flying home the next morning. Check in was good, rooms both ready, and we upgraded with no problems. Room was very small for 4, we apparently had an "outside" room, because trucks crashed around all night loading and unloading. Tried to tip the maids for 2 extra towels as there were 4 of us and it was a HUGE problem, apparently no more than 4 towels per room? Didn't want to pay for the mini-bar, but frig leaked all over floor. When maintenance guy came in, he blamed us for turning it down, it was in a locked cabinet! Asked for a wake up call and did not get it. One male working the desk the morning of 10/20 was rushed, rude, so checked out without talking to them. Hotel is clean, very convenient to the Wharf and shopping. Would not stay here again, due to noise and staff, but ok for the price, if I would have paid rack rate, I would have been more upset.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the tuscan inn”
Reviews.Author: soccerdeb
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights at the tuscan inn. easy walking distance to fishermans wharf , cable cars, and streetcar stop to ferry building. older hotel with smaller rooms but updated nicely. thin walled rooms. only coffee and bisquits for breakfast. overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the wine at 5pm”
Reviews.Author: Lytia
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in August following a flight from UK. We had a room on the ground floor that was very well decorated but a bit gloomy. As we had come to sleep that actually helped. It was large with enough space for our cases. Disappointed with coffee making faclities. Breakfast at the hotel was fine, and we had lunch and dinner there as well. Lunch time staff were miserable and in the evening we did not book so had ages to wait for a table, crowded and noisy.We would have gone elsewhere but around 21:00 found most other places closing so it was Hobsons choice The best part of the stay were the free wine and eats in the lounge arond 17:00, absolutely great and a warm fire as well! Very cosy and friendly. Staff were always helpful. Even when we were charged in error on our credit card after our return to UK it was sorted out with grace and effortlessly. We were only using it as a stopover and it met the bill on that front.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: bigjeannie1
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Francisco and we were unsure which area to stay in. Fishermans Wharf was just perfect. The Best Western was excellently located, about 3 blocks from the sea front and within 5 minutes walk to Pier 39. The room was abit on the small side, but OK for a 3 night stay. The front desk staff were very friendly with a dedicated concierge desk where guests could book excursions or just get information. The free wine and nibbles served between 5pm and 6pm were a lovely touch. At first we thought there must be a catch, but the reception area was packed every evening and it was a great place to talk to fellow travellers. The area felt safe to walk around at night as there were lots of people about with plenty of restaurants and bars to frequent. I would stay at this hotel again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beatons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 days. Our flight came in early so the room we requested wasn't ready yet. The concierge recommended a bus tour and called to see if there were seats available and booked us on the tour that was leaving in an hour. The tour was fabulous and the driver was wonderful and provided excellent information during the tour. The tour ended around 2:30 and we were dropped off back at the hotel. By this time our room was ready. We had asked for a courtyard room as I am a very light sleeper. I had no problem at all even though everything in San Francisco was booked and there were people everywhere due to it being the start of Fleet Week. The room was extremely clean and very spacious. The carpet was a bit worn and outdated but that isn't a complaint just an observation. We found the staff to be very helpful and courteous and we had no problems at all. We didn't participate in the wine social that occurred everyday at 5 but there were a lot of people that did as every time we went through the lobby it was packed. We did however take advantage of the free coffee and biscotti that was offered every morning in the lobby. The hotel is in a fantastic location just a 5 minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf and no more then 10 minutes from the cable cars and other attractions. There is an Ihop one block down which we ate at a couple of times. Our stay was a pleasant one with no complaints at all. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: SteelersFan27
Reviews.Content: We loved the Tuscan Inn! We booked a King room, but they upgraded us to a King Deluxe when we arrived. It was pretty small, so I'm sure the standard rooms are even smaller! But, for just the two of us it was perfect. The room was very nicely decorated and was obviously recently renovated. We loved it. It was very clean, had a beautiful bathroom, and was comfortable. The staff was very friendly (especially Jose!) and the wine hour is such a nice touch!! We were only able to go one day, but it was great! Held us over nicely until dinner with wine and appetizers. If you stay here- be prepared to walk uphill to get anywhere outside of Fisherman's Wharf!! We also used the "F-line" street car to get to the Ferry building and financial district...it seemed safe, easy, and close to the hotel. We spent alot of time walking too and were able to see so much in a few days, but be prepared for the hills. Some highlights in the San Francisco area: -Coit Tower, Alcatraz with audio tour, Chinatown, Lombard St, Hyde-Powell Cable Car Line (standing on the outside!), Golden Gate Park are all must dos! -Wine Country Shuttle Tour - went to Domaine Chandon, V. Sattui, Rutherford Ranch, and Andretti Wineries. It was a great day and worth the money not to have to worry about driving, plus we really enjoyed each of the wineries- all different experiences! -Saulsalito - only had a short time here, but looked like a great area to explore art galleries, boutiques, and good food. -Punchline Comedy Club -Muir Woods was ok- if you've never seen the Redwoods further north in CA, you'll be satisfied...it's close enough to SF for an easy visit and the trees are still huge!! Lots of tourists and not quite the size of further up the coast, but still very pretty and we enjoyed it. We thoroughly enjoyed the Tuscan Inn and would recommend staying there if you're looking to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area. It was pretty quiet and a little bit removed from all the action of the Wharf and Pier 39, which was nice. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Phototravelgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights and found the staff to be very friendly. The location is great, only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. The room was nice given this is not a 5 star property so our expectations were exceeded. Overall, it was a great value and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: AxeMcFookie
Reviews.Content: First off, we booked this hotel through Priceline. We got it from Sunday to Wednesday for $135 a night, which was a great deal and I think very good value. It's certainly worth the booking price via their own website but you can find a good deal out there for it too. The Tuscan Inn was a great place to stay. It's very close to Fisherman's Wharf, within walking distance to the Coit Tower and even Chinatown. The street cars are also only a block away. The rooms are very nice and seem recently upgraded. The beds and linens are quite nice too. The hotel staff are really friendly. We were very impressed with both of the concierges that were working and found them extremely useful. The people at the front desk were friendly save for one girl who we found consistently rude and abrasive. (ie, I brought a five dollar bill up to the front desk and before I could say anything she said "we don't give change" and walked away). With the exception of this one bad egg, everyone was very nice. The free wine/beer and coffee/hot chocolate/biscotti is a wonderful touch and we took full advantage of it. I would recommend making reservations at the restaurant as it quickly filled up every night and we were turned away frequently - I heard one traveller get into a heated discussion about never being able to get in for dinner. My only recommendation would be to ask for a room that's not on the first floor, or a room with a view of the garden. The street noise was pretty bad and we were woken up a few times because of this. There were a few homeless people who would sit on the street outside and make a ton of noise throughout the night. Also, the restaurant drags their tables and chairs inside at midnight or later and then outside at 7:00am. It makes a lot of noise too - just a tip. Anyway, we loved it at this hotel and were very happy. Last word of caution - if you're going to San Francisco, don't rent a car. Parking is expensive ($40 per night) and everything is very much within walking distance. We took a cab across town and it was $10... Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_Lesley
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel on the 23rd August for 3 nights and had an enjoyable stay. It is in a great location, 5 minute walk to Fisherman 's Wharf promenade and 5 minute walk to a tram stop. We were given a room over looking the street which proved to be noisey. The reception staff were very accommodating and said the hotel was fully booked but first thing in the morning they would move our luggage to a room over looking the courtyard. This room was alot quiter and you could also open the windows as apposed to the room on street level. The complimentry tea and biscuits in the morning were very good and the restaurant ajoined to the hotel was very pleasant. The hotel was clean, in a good location and we would reccommend it to other travelors.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: curlycat
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to get very mixed reviews, particularly about the reception desk staff. I can only think that some of the staff are very good and some equally bad, since our experience was a very positive one. We were greeted warmly and asked how we had enjoyed our stay on leaving. Both check in (when we were able to check in very early) and check out were fine and friendly. We have stayed at this hotel once before, a few years ago, so knew that the rooms were not particularly large. On this occasion our room was quite small, but extremely nice, although it did contain the smallest wardrobe I had ever seen! The hotel is very well situated, 5 minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf, shops, restaurants and cable cars etc. We were fortunate to get an inside (or courtyard) room, so were not disturbed by noise at all (except for 1 night when the fridge went mad!) We had a problem with the AC whilst we were there, but a very friendly and helpful maintenance man came within minutes of reporting it, and had it fixed at the touch of a button. Valet parking is, in my view, unreasonably high at $38 per night, but again we knew this before we arrived so can't really complain. The best point about this hotel is the wonderful restaurant attached to it - Cafe Pescatore. Both breakfast and evening meal were excellent - it is very well used, so bookings are advised for the evening. The late afternoon free wine reception was a really nice touch and we enjoyed this very much. So once again, we enjoyed a lovely stay at this hotel and will almost certainly go back when we next visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “DIsappointed in Front Desk Staff and Room Size”
Reviews.Author: kuke2
Reviews.Content: We were anticipating a special stay for our anniversary trip. The front desk staff couldnâ€™t even be bothered to greet us hello. She took our confirmation information and was annoyed that we didn't have an additional copy to give her. The room was clean and nicely decorated but very small. The view from our 4th floor window was of two outside building walls, but it was very quiet. My husband talked with the concierge, who he found very helpful. The daily coffee and newspaper in the lobby were nice to have in the early morning. The location is great, only a few blocks from the Wharf. When we checked-out, the front desk clerk didnâ€™t even bother to ask about our stay, which is very unusual. Fortunately, the hotel we stayed at in Monteray more than made up for our disappointing experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tuppenceWales
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Argonaut on a previous trip, we were interested to see how the Tuscan would compare. It did not disappoint and cost less for our 4 day stay. The location is fantastic - a 5 minute walk to the Wharf and close to bus and trolley stops. Having read previous reviews, we requested a courtyard room. We were given a room on the 4th floor with a view of a partially constructed building. We were not not concerned about the lack of view as we did not intend spending much time in our room but we did wonder whether there would be any early morning noise. Our concerns were unfounded as we did not hear a sound. The room was a nice size and beautifully furnished. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean with a nice selection of toiletries. There was a fully-stocked fridge with snacks and drinks. Although we didn't use it, there was free Internet access in the room. We did however make use of the PC/Internet access available in the lobby without cost. The staff at the front desk could not have been more helpful and whilst we did not avail his services, the concierge always seemed to be busy with guests giving info and advice. The wine reception is a good way to wind down at the end of a busy day sightseeing and also to meet and share experiences with other guests. There was also a gentleman offering massage at this time and we met a few people who had enjoyed his services. Upon checking-in, we were told that we would receive complementary continental breakfast for each morning of our stay. We do not usually rate these well but this was really nice - a large dish of fresh fruit, croissant or a muffin, juice and coffee. We also ate dinner at the hotel restaurant (Cafe Pescatore) one night. The food and service were both excellent. The only negative point was that when we booked our airport transfer through the hotel, we were charged $10 more than the going rate. All in all, we would recommend a stay at the Tuscan and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in heart of fishermans wharf”
Reviews.Author: Lampoon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. The rooms were nice. No complaints. Close to public transport and walking distance to restaraunt. This was probably not the best pick for us as we don't like tourist areas and Fishermans Wharf if one big tourist service. The food and drink prices in the area were outrageous. Summary: best place to stay in a tourist trap. Especially if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hard_working_girl
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful Hotel. After reading some of the bad reviews, we started to worry about staying here. Our worries washed away the moment we reached the hotel. The staff was amazing, and went out of their way to help us. The coffee and treats in the moring was amazing. The wine and treats at night were great also, nice touch. We took the advice from other reviewers and requested a court-yard side room. Glad we did, it was very quite. Some say the rooms are small, but ours wasn't that tiny. A normal size hotel room compared to other hotel rooms we have stayed in, besides we didn't spend much time in the room when there is so much to do around San Francisco. I will stay here again if I ever get the chance to go back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: pagirl11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location. It is within walking distance to the wharf, as well as the pier that sails boats to Alcatraz. There are many public transportation options including the cable cars, the trolley line and bus service. It is within easy walking distance to China town and sits within the City's Italian neighborhood. The hotel is across the street from a Dollar rental car drop off, so you can rent a car at the airport, tour the area and then drop the car off when you get into the city. The hotel does have parking, but it is expensive and hard to get around the city while driving. The hotel itself had attractive common areas. The rooms were small, very small. They were, however clean and well equipped. The staff at the hotel more than made up for the tiny rooms. They were extremely helpful and would go out of their way to meet your every demand. The Consigliore was extremely knowledgeable and very helpful. If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel to stay at where the staff will make your tour of their city a good experience, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MNandMN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights to kick off our honeymoon. The staff was very friendly and we really enjoyed their dinner recommendations. The hotel was clean, and the evening wine hour was a nice touch. The parking was steep (over $40/day after taxes), so if I had to do it again I would have parked 1/2 block north for about half of that. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel as it is two block from the warf, dining, etc. M&M

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: hsam
Reviews.Content: I am not a hotel snob - I don't mind a little noise, a little bit of dirt, etc. , but given the fairly strong review for this place, I was very disappointed. First, from day one our bathroom had a urine smell that never went away. Otherwise the bathroom was decent enough - decent temperature and decent water pressure. The room was loud loud loud. We were on the fourth floor and could literally hear conversations on the street, with our windows shut. The ac did not seem very accurate or effective and do not book a room with a sleeper sofa. Don't get me going on the noise the fridge made - it sounded like a jet plane every time the motor shifted. I finally had to buy sleeping pill across the street to try to sleep through all of this. Then my last morning, I got to hear a heated argument between the reception desk and the police. The police were investigating something that had happened and staff would not cooperate so the police got very annoyed...all this in front of guest. On a positive note, we did like having a Trader Joe's right behind the hotel and used the mini bar to store our goods.l also enjoyed the morning coffee in the lobby and the free wine. But not enough to every bring me back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gringa-1
Reviews.Content: A good location if you want to be walking distance to sights and transportation. The rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable. The 2-room suite was a little crowded, too much furniture, nicely done otherwise. It's walking distance to many sights,, as well as the cable car line,and the trolleys. Very convenient. Every day in the lobby: a very nice complimentary coffee and biscotti in the morning, and a wine tasting in the evening. Wifi was included if you have your own laptop, otherwise internet available in the lobby. The highlight of this hotel for us was the service offered by the staff, particularly the two concierges on duty while we were there. Their service was of the level and knowledge I would expect at at 5-star hotel. I had also called ahead for some information regarding bilingual tours (information I had a very hard time finding on the internet) , and everything was taken care of for us before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Experienced the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: These_are_my_travels
Reviews.Content: Similar to some other disgruntled reviewers here I was assigned a different room than I had booked. There were three of us and I had booked a two double bed room and had a confirmation to prove it. I had chosen this hotel for that particular reason as I was having difficulty getting a two bed room at nearby wharf hotels. I was given a king room with a cot on check-in. After a few trips by the clerk back to the manager who remained out of site I was told I had not booked a double bed room but a double occupancy room which wasn't true. They said they noticed we had three people so had automatically provided a cot to our room, I was told they were full and there were no other rooms available. When we got to our room the cot was already there but due to the small room I had to re-arrange furniture to get it to fit, in doing so having to re-assemble their cheap particle board table. The room faced a side street, the street directly below became very active at 5 am with motorcycles in particular in addition to trucks noisily heading up the street. I'm a sound sleeper normally and nothing wakes me so this was just a sign of how noisy it was. I managed to get switched to a two double bed room for our next couple of nights and experienced what all the good reviewers must have. The room was significantly larger, still small but liveable, and although still on the 3rd floor it faced the wharf and what I would have thought was the busier street but the traffic was much quieter and I didn't hear much at all the next two mornings. The valet's were a little slow and I hated the vulture baggage guy. I don't have a problem being helped up to the room although I;m fine doing it myself. This guy immediately put all my bags on the cart while I was pre-occupied with the valet but then while I was trying to correct the problems with the room at check-in he was impatiently trying to get us to hurry up in spite of me telling him just to leave the bags. The location is great, I opted for a Fisherman's wharf stay for vacation having stayed near Union square on business in the past and I'm glad I did as it was easy walking distance to Chinatown and the touristy area of the wharf. I'd be leaving a better rating if I were given the 2nd room on arrival but due to the mix-up and the fact others have experienced the same I'd avoid this hotel in the future opting not to take the chance of another mix-up.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant start to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: napolitoneath
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at the tuscan for 3 nights last month, this was our first stop off to a 3 week vacation in the USA and what great a start,....... a superb hotel with staff so helpful/efficient, the food at the pescadora restaurant is a must, and to be quite honest better than most of the other places we ate at on the wharf whilst there, one of which being quoted to being the best ,......... but to us a tourist trap and a big rip off. name given on request. Location of the hotel was ideal to explore the know attractions, with just a 2 min walk to the wharf / ferries and the famous cable cars, which transported you to union square /lombard st etc.. Afternoon wine tasting was a cool touch by the hotel staff, and proved very popular with most of the guest including us. had a problem with air-con in the room but within minutes of reporting it to front desk plans were in place to sort, we returned later ot find the room chilled to satisfaction and even a personal note left by the engineer. Would stay here everytime SF

Reviews.Title: “Check out the free wine”
Reviews.Author: Irene-Weston
Reviews.Content: Our room was small by American standards but really comfortable, well appointed, and quiet. The location is ideal but the car park is really expensive, so if you are ending a trip here, take your hire car back after you have unloaded your luggage and get a taxi to the airport. You can walk or ride the buses in SF, its fun. The lobby area was really pleasant and the free wine (or coffee) gets you talking to other guests. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Don't pay full price there are lots of cheap deals.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: dysan1
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn was in a great location a few minutes from Fisherman's Wharf. It was easy to walk to North Beach as well. We didnt' have a car, so we liked the fact it was a short walk to the cable car stop. The room was small, but clean, quiet, and suited our needs. The afternoon wine and cheese was a nice bonus as was the free Internet. The concierge at the hotel was extremely helpful and nice. He checked into baseball tickets, offered dinner reccomendations, and answered all of our san francisco questions. I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future. It was a great base to explore San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise.....”
Reviews.Author: Mainframer
Reviews.Content: What can you say about a place that does not dazzle but delivers solid consistent performance.. The price was reasonable based on others in the vicinity and it does a good job. The room was clean, the staff was great and it was CLOSE to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf (easy walk). I'd stay there again. The restaurant looks nice but I'm not a big Italian food fan so I bypassed the place. I went with average expectations and came away pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Fisherman's Wharf overrated”
Reviews.Author: aoshell
Reviews.Content: Although we enjoyed our stay at the Tuscan Inn it wasn't all I'd hoped it would be. Probably because I was so disappointed in the Fisherman's Wharf area itself. It was really dirty, crowded, crime-ridden and touristy. The food was bad and overpriced in general. The only place I really liked were some of the places on Pier 39, but I wouldn't eat at a sit-down restaurant here. I would stay in North Beach or Sausalito next trip. Food in North Beach was fabulous!. As far as the hotel, the room was clean but small. Beds very comfortable - we had a King with pull-out sofa for our 12-yr-old son. Nice big flat screen tv. They comped us an in-room movie when I reported that it was "jerky". Bathroom shower curtain reeked of mildew enough to smell up the room. I should have had them take it down and wash it, but probably got used to it. Staff was great. Concierge very helpful. Location was convenient. Grocery store and Trader Joe's just down the block. Pretty close to North Beach and cable car stops. One afternoon, a car window was broken right outside the hotel so they could steal the contents of the car. Lots of panhandlers. One lady reported cash was stolen out of her car by the valet parkers, but that was too stupid of her to leave it in the car. Parking at $45 a night was outrageous, but probably worth it to keep your car safe.

Reviews.Title: “A Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glasgow_Member06
Reviews.Content: San Francisco was our final stop on a drive up Highway 1. My wife and two friends stayed here for four nights in July 08. This was our third visit to the city but the first stay at the Tuscan Inn and we would strongly recommend it. We were surprised and delighted when, on arrival, we were given tokens for free continental breakasts. This was unexpected as we hadn't been informed about this by our travel agent. The hotel has a certain individual style that distinguishes it from the Sheratons, Holiday Inns, etc. The reception area is compact and during the free evening wine sampling gets quite busy. The free morning coffee is also well appreciated and attended. We had a rear room which at first disappointed me but the air-con was much quieter than that of our friends who also had a bit of bother with noise from the street. The rooms were a little bit tired and with the simple expedient of renewing the wallcovering would show a great improvement. The bed was comfortable and the rooms and bathrooms were kept clean and although the refrigerators are honour bars the hotel is happy for you to chill your own drinks in them. We found the reception staff, maids and porters friendly and helpful. We have now stayed in three hotels in Fisherman's Wharf but the Tuscan Inn represents a good comprise of location, cost and facilities. Oh and before I forget, the hotel restaurant El Pescatore serves excellent food at reasonable prices. I would recommend a stay at the Tuscan Inn when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan is Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNC
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I just returned from Tuscan Inn, Fisherman's Wharf, in San Francisco. We booked our reservation with Southwest Vacations. We had a great time and could have stayed longer. The room was very nice, and had a nice bathroom. We did have a wall view from the window, but since I was not in the room except to sleep I did not make a big fuss. It was nice having the Safeway store across the street to get snacks. I enjoyed the hot chocolate every morning in the lobby. The fireplace in the lobby was very pretty, and the courtyard flowers were beautiful. The location was perfect. Alot of other hotels were more expensive but we were very happy at the Tuscan. The desk clerks were nice and helpful. My friend celebrated his birthday there! We walked to a lot of places. It was very convenient. We did not have a car, hotel parking is expensive. We had a Tower Tour bus pick us up every morning at the hotel and they did an excellent job. Also plenty of busses and taxis. Everyone there was friendly to us. We had a great and exciting trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: myllek
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel back in August of 2007 at the beginning and end a trip from San Francisco to Monterey. We booked the standard two queen room and were very happy with our stay. The room was wonderful with great beds, a nice bathroom and we also had an excellent view of Coit Tower as well. The location only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf made it a perfect base for exploring the area, we were able to walk or take public transportation everywhere we went. If we hadn't been driving to Monterey the next day I wouldn't have rented a car. There's no need when staying in this hotel. The valet parking was very convenient and seemed secure as it is attached to the hotel. A lot of hotel parking garages/lots are not on the same premises as the hotel in the area. The restaurant located in the hotel was excellent and the morning coffee/biscotti was really nice as well. Would love to stay there again if we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: gbh001
Reviews.Content: Great location to Fishermans Wharf. Hotel was excellent. Staff great and helpful. Fishermans Wharf tacky.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not as good as our last stay”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and liked it very much. This time, I was not very impressed. The room was small, with a king bed, and a truly claustrophobic bathroom. Two bath towels for two adults is just skimpy, and when you close the door to the tub/toilet combination, there is no room to breathe. The bed was comfortable. We were awakened by a loud racket at 0730 - construction nearby. There is no place to conveniently charge phone/blackberry/laptop without crawling around on the floor. Why do hotels not install convenient plugs for guests to recharge the devices with which we are all travelling? Morning coffee quite delicious, but when we checked out at 0545, we were never offered any to drink. Would it have been so difficult to offer us a little coffee, as it was probably ready by then? Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling check in and lots of lies”
Reviews.Author: Neatandtidy
Reviews.Content: We booked two suites both with a king bed, pre-paid for both suites and received a reservation confirmation from Best Western. On arriving at the hotel we were told that one suite was ready and the other would be an hour or so. When we got to the suite that was ready we found that it was not a one king bed suite but a two bed suite. I rang reception and spoke to a person called Jamelia to ask to be allocated the right type of suite as per our reservation confirmation. Her attitude was appalling and this is where the lies started. She initially said that the reservation had come through incorrect from Best Western or that I had not booked correctly on the website. I offered to take the Best Western reservation confirmation to reception as evidence and she said that this was of absolutely no interest to her and that it made no difference. She then said that there were no king bed suites at the hotel at all and that all suites had two beds. I asked her why their website stated that this type of room was available if they did not exist as she had just stated. She said the website must be incorrect. Next we were offered a standard king bedroom, and I pointed out that this was a cheaper room than the suite we had booked. She said 'well you got a good rate by booking on line'. Like that matters. I had paid $1900 up front for the suites 2 monthsâ€™ prior when making the booking. I then asked if the next suite would also be two beds instead of the king bed as she had just stated that this type of suite did not exist. Unbelievably she said that this next suite would have a King bed contradicting the lie she had just told us. At this point I asked to be put through to Best Western Customer Services and amazingly our room was changed to a king bed suite as per our reservation within the hour. The funny thing was that when we got to the room, there were welcome cookies and a welcome note for a Mr and Mrs Bonfiglio. So, sorry to this couple as they probably got a load of lies and bull when they arrived to find that they did not get the room they had booked. The hotel is also very noisy but I guess this is inevitable considering the location. The free drinks are great if you and like the feeling of getting something for nothing. Please also beware of the restaurant at the hotel. They state that there is an obligatory service charge for tables of more than 6. We dined as a party of 4 and were still hit with this and then the waitress failed to hand over $10 of change taking this as an additional service charge. On the plus side some of the staff were nice and helpful especially the concierge who was most gracious. The suites are a decent size, clean and the dÃ©cor is not of a bad standard. If you want to be near Fishermans Wharf the location is great. I did contact Best Western on returning home to see what response I would get after the investigation. Apparently the hotel had told Best Western that we were contacted directly by the management during our stay and that the matter was resolved (we were not contacted). While they apologised for the inconvenience they said that there was nothing more to do as we were eventually given the room we had booked. No mention of the lies, arrogance and â€˜up you attitudeâ€™ of some of the staff then??

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: pjsltk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for $125 from Hotwire. The first night we were on the Street, and could here motorcycles racing all night. We complained, and were moved to a quiet room for the duration of our stay. On the morning of the second day my daughter had stomach cramps and we had to go to the emergency room. We left at 6:30 AM, and the front desk and valet had a cab ready with instructions on where to go by the time we came down the elevator. We were very impressed with the service we received. The location for tourists can not be beat. You are 2 blocks from the wharf, the Mason line cable car is right behind the hotel, the F line street car is a block away, and pier 39 and the alcatraz tour is with in walking distance. There is a Trader Joes, Safeway, and Walgreens close by too. The rooms were nice, comfortable, and clean. The shower was great. I am still missing the strong coffee and biscotti we had for breakfast every morning. The next time we are in SF, we will be staying at the Tuscan Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Bunch of criminals, be warned”
Reviews.Author: Olegy
Reviews.Content: Be aware - they do not honor their reservation guarantees. Booked a most expensive room there a suite - more then $350 per night. They have charged a credit card, send an email - "reservation guaranteed". Upon arrival, we've been told that they have no room for us. And a manager on duty - Gregory Abdon has started lying to us. His first sentence was - the room is under maintenance. Asked to show the room, which is under maintenance - refused. Asked to speak to his supervisor - refused. His next version was - we do not guarantee the reservations - first come- first served. But what about the 'reservation guarantee' letter, I've got from them? Next version was - well it is not the suite, which is under maintenance, but another room, but refused to show that room as well. Next, we been told, that they have a replacement suite for us in a different hotel, in the different part of city, Having no other choice, went there just to find out that was not a suite, but a regular room. Bunch of liars The most funny part is they have placed us in $125 room (have a print out of it), still trying to charge $350 as for initial charge. Had forced them to get all the charges reversed. By my opinion, that hotel is a bunch of criminals, trying to implement the following criminal scheme. 1. Overbook the most desirable hotel in the Kimpton chain. 2. Move overbooked people to a different hotel in a different part of the city, within the chain, which is virtually empty. 3. Collect the same rate as for Fisherman's Wharf location. 4. The child hotel in the different part of city returns Fisherman's Wharf's hotel part of the initial fee, and they simply collect a difference from the air. Anyone with the same experience - I'll be glad to file a law suite against them. Our well planned vacation has been ruined. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Find!”
Reviews.Author: NtrDm2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of a booking on Priceline. I got a GREAT price on the hotel and was extremely happy with the hotel. First, it is in a fantastic location - blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and within walking distance to so many things! Right from checking in, the staff was unbelievable! Every single staff member we came into contact with was extremely helpful and very nice! The room was on the smaller side but there was definitely enough room for two of us. The coffee, tea and biscotti in the morning is very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: canuck006
Reviews.Content: We have been planning this trip for a year. We used priceline to try to find us a 4 star hotel near the wharf. Well we got a Hotel . We arrived wondering what to expect and as soon as we arrived the staff made us feel welcomed .The 5 o'clock wine gathering in the lobby is terrific. rooms are clean,new, quiet, and relaxing.The concierge service is second to none. I highly recommend this hotel and even my call it a 5 star...

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here- they charge $75 if you depart a day early on mult- night stay”
Reviews.Author: sheeshm
Reviews.Content: I was told that they required 24 hours to change dates of stay or cancel. I checked in and had planned on staying three nights. After the first night, I found out that I would be leaving one day early and told them -- more than 24 hours in advance -- that I would be leaving one day early. I was charged a $75 early departure fee. I will never stay here again and recommend you do not either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in the City”
Reviews.Author: wammy1
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, reasonably priced right at Fisherman's Wharf. In the same area as the Radisson and the Sheraton. When I walked in I immediately thought "boutique hotel" not "Best Western". It reminded me of the Napa River Inn in Napa, CA. They take the "Tuscan" theme all the way. When you call the hotel they say "Buon Giorno" and play Italian music while you are on hold. The valets are dressed like Venetian gondoliers. The lobby is reminiscent of Italy. Lovely potted flowering plants and trees fill the view from the picture window in the lobby, while a welcoming fire is lit in the lobby fireplace.... even though the day we were there, it was sunny and a pleasant 78. The next day was windy and the fog was blowing in, so the fire was quite apropos. We arrived early - noonish, and check-in is not til 3 p.m. They were very accomodating and allowed us to park the car in their garage (added charge at all hotels in SFO) and leave our bags in a secure room until check-in, so we could go out and start our day in SFO. They upgraded us to a suite and told us they would call on our cell phone when the room was ready. They called within an hour! The room was spacious, very clean and tastefully decorated. They could have made the LR area smaller to accomodate the King size bed in the BR better - not much room between the bed and the TV stand to squeeze by. Be sure to ask not to be put in the rooms right above the driveway/entry. At 6 a.m. they roll out the dumpster and the garbage truck comes roaring up to empty it (clang, bang) and then backs up to leave (beep, beep, beep). A half hour later the neighboring business hauls their dumpster out for pick-up and another garbage truck comes along.... A minor disturbance in an otherwise great hotel. Overall I would rate this hotel as Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but.......”
Reviews.Author: 58HUSTLER
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite as impressed with the place as most seem to be. To begin, I'm more of what you'd call a budget traveler, and although I got this place at a good price via Priceline, there are some things to consider. First, the biggest "gotcha" is the mandatory valet parking. With taxes, it set me back over $43; and for me, that's rather stiff. The room was clean, but on the small side, especially in width. If someone was sitting at the desk (located at the center of the room in front of the bed), there is no room for another person to get by. Comfortable bed, but nothing special. No pool, spa or workout room that I could find. It is centrally located to the Wharf, within reasonable walking distance of Pier 39, etc. Not trying to bad mouth the Tuscan, it is a nice place to stay, and if you're not put off by the valet parking, you shouldn't be too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Austher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a weekend trip up to San Francisco and wanted to stay at a place that was cheap and close to Fisherman's Wharf. This place did not disappoint. Our room was only $99 per night through some promotion found on Travelzoo. I figure you get what you pay for... but the room was actually pretty nice. There wasn't much of a view (I think the window faced the adjacent building) but the room was fairly large, clean, and the room (as well as the whole floor) was nice and quiet. There was a very private feel to the hotel. They also had a staffmember serve soda and wine in the loungy lobby area in the early evening, which was a nice bonus. The surrounding area of the hotel, to our surprise, seemed safe and relatively clean. But the location was great... just a few blocks from the touristy parts of the Wharf. Would definitely recommend this hotel for your next brief stay in the bay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheilanj
Reviews.Content: we just stayed at the tuscan inn for about 5 nights. it was definetely worth it. we had a great room, clean and spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 small kids. and the price was fantastic. we first booked thru hotels.com and thought we got a great deal..our sf itinerary changed a bit, and we needed another 2 nights at the tuscan inn, and the hotel said they would match our hotels.com price, they actually gave us a lower price than that! wow! all the staff we encountered were super friendly and the hotel location is great..enjoy your stay there, i'm sure you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bookworm8
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the hotel. It was reasonable and close to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel offered coffee, tea, and biscotti in the morning and wine and an appetizer in the late afternoon. The staff were helpful and efficient. I had not stayed in a Best Western in a while, and I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: lorelie21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for 4 nights. The room was just the right size for 2 people and 2 suitcases (how big do you need it?), and the king size bed was spacious and comfortable. Our room was at the back of the hotel which meant we got no street noise. Cafe Pescatore next door was good for breakfast, and the wharf is only 5 mins walk with loads of places to eat. We got snacks from Safeway opposite the hotel opposite to the right, and the cable car stop was one street behind the hotel to the left. One thing you must do when at the wharf is have a clam chowder in a bread bowl, the best one we found was at the aptly named Chowders on pier 39 next to the wipeout cafe. It was delicious! Back to the hotel, we didn't go to the wine evenings but they were always busy so it must be good. As we probably won't be going back to San Francisco ( As much as we loved it, it's rather a long way) we won't be staying here again, but would definately recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuggster
Reviews.Content: Fantastic choice, 10 days at the Tuscan, location is wonderful only a couple of blocks from pier 39. The Coffee and Biscotti in the morning were a nice touch, and the wine tasting every evening became a must get back to the hotel for. Room spacious 2 double beds gave us plenty of room, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. there is a bar up the road if you are a sports fan at the grand hyatt which is worth a visit. Overall a fantastic time was had there and i look forward to returning A+++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Lovely Inn”
Reviews.Author: Lynn_StPaul
Reviews.Content: Our room was absolutely lovely, although dresser drawers and closet were small. The bed was very comfortable. Windows don't open - so no fresh air. Internet is free. I needed something printed two different times, and after following their directions I went to the front desk and was able to get it right away. There is a small refrigerator, but it was stocked so very little space for our own "goodies". The location is perfect - two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and only a block to the street car and trolley. The bathroom was large and included a mounted makeup mirror. Towels were large and soft. The shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion they provide is heavenly! Coffeemaker in the room and when "regular" coffee wasn't left one day, it was delivered immediately when I requested it. Lots and lots of restaurants nearby. We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tuscan Inn was incredible”
Reviews.Author: johnnyv1954
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I was on a strict budget for my trip to SF and was thrilled to get this hotel for $59 on Priceline (off season, and between conventions, I did my homework). The hotel is perfectly located in my opinion: close to Fisherman's Wharf, but away from the crowds; within a very short walk to North Beach (an absolute must see); literally around the corner from the cable cars (buy a multi day pass-much cheaper); stores and restaurants closeby; excellent transportation connections besides the cable car. The hotel itself is elegant, but not stuffy. One of the friendliest desk/concierge staffs I've encountered (they made a luggage tag, mapped out driving directions, gave bus/trolley directions, gracious with special requests, wine & cheese hour etc). The rooms are abit smallish (absolutely typical of SF), but immaculately maintained, and tastefully decorated, with excellent bathroom facilities. One stand out example: the painter who was touching up nicks on the hall mouldings, cheerfully greeted me in the morning on my way out. I am a budget traveller who has travelled all over the world, and this hotel is one of my top five picks for best value (just don't pay rack rate). This hotel is managed by the Kimpton folks and they do a great job for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay at the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: shona62
Reviews.Content: Tuscan Inn has it all, exellant location,very close to public transport, very clean, impeccable, friendly service and a supermarket opposite. Our king bed room was quite overlooking the courtyard and the decor lovely. The complimentary toiletries, coffee and biscotti and the happy hour drinks each eveing just go to prove they go the extra mile. We found a great breakfast place just around the corner in Taylor St, called Darren's Cafe, good prices with excellant food and service. I would not hesitate to stay here again and highly recommend it. Shona of Sydney/London

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: johnPerpignan
Reviews.Content: Hotels in SF are not cheap,and room sizes are not overly big,so a pretty tiny room for $180 was no big surprise. Valet parking for $40 per night seems a bit steep,but at least the service was efficient and quick. Overall the Tuscan Inn is a nice hotel. very clean,well maintained,with efficient,if not overly friendly service. the couple of faults with room features were fixed very quickly,which was a nice change from the interminable wait often suffered in European properties. The hotel makes a big thing of the coffee/bisc service in the morning,and this is quite nice. I'd say that,as far as the evening (5 to 6 ) wine service is concerned,if you happen to be in the hotel,it's fine. But not worth rushing back from a day out for. Breakfast was OK,but expensive. Much better option is Pats Cafe,just round the corner nr the cable car terminus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gemela01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to where you want to be. Great room! Everything was clean, good staff...The hotel is in very good condition. The prize for vallet parking is steep but I think you can expect that anywhere you go in San Francisco. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skm52
Reviews.Content: Wow it was absolutely beautiful. Easy walking distance to all the attractions at Fishermans Wharf. Really enjoyed the friendliness of the staff and the big rooms. Very Clean and a wonderful atmosphere. Complimentary drinks are provided each evening for an Hour. Trolley Car was just down the street and plenty of supermarkets in the area to pick up supplies. We had the most wonderful time and as Arnie says........ I will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JuanitaBrighton
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 day stay -we are a family of 4 with 2 daughters aged 15 and 20. We stayed in a family room which was not enormous but plenty big enough for us all. Shower/bathroom was good with good shower and plenty of space.We had a fridge and television and coffee making facilities. Beds were very comfortable and although we were at street level it was not noisy at all. The free coffee and biscotti in the morning kept us going until breakfast. We used the Hollywood Cafe-turn left out of hotel and it is a short distance up on the other side of the road opposite the Hilton. The breakfasts are brilliant and cheap. Evening wine hour from 5-6 was also good -free wine and nibbles and a chance to talk to other guests about places to visit , eat etc. Rooms were well cleaned and reception staff helpful. Take a jacket -it was sunny but windy on the wharf-we were also glad of a scarf.It meant we did not have to buy a SF fleece like a lot of other people! Our best bits were a visit to the Coit Tower, lunch at The Cheesecake factory at the top of Macey's, riding the cable cars, the bus tour and exploring the wharf area as well as the shops downtown. We walked a lot which meant we could eat the fantastic pancakes every day and plenty of cheesecake. We felt totally safe wherever we went. We all found plenty to do and had a great time -we flew to Las Vegas after that!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: claira2609
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice location for everything! Very clean, get a glass of wine free between 5&6pm in the lobby. Get an internal top floor room if you can, no noise from traffic or people upstairs. There's no view anyway so best to get some peace and quiet (no that it a noisy hotel anyway). Also book Alcatraze trip as soon as you get there (from Pier 31 I think it was) as it gets busy days in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms; great staff; great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malcontent
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a recent trip to San Francisco. Stayed at the Tuscan Inn near Fisherman's Wharf and it was excellent. Tuscan Inn has exceptionally helpful and friendly staff. There was never a time where I saw the concierge desk unstaffed. In fact, the concierges seemed to be the busiest people in the hotel; always assisting someone with a reservation, recommendation, a jogging route, etc. The hotel had nIce, well-decorated, fairly-modern rooms. Some of the common spaces are a little worn but our king guest room was very comfortable. OK... this is Fisherman's Wharf so there are some obnoxious, tourist-trap activities around.
