Reviews.Content: On one side of the hotel was Fisherman's Wharf just a few blocks away. On the other was a kind of seedy area with lots of bums. The neighborhood the hotel is in wasn't the best. We always kept it in our heads that we should get back to the room before it got too late. There were some problems with people at the front desk, one younger guy (can't recall his name) was uncooperative and unprofessional. Our airconditioner wasn't in the best working order. We had a nice size room with 2 double beds. My parents' room with only one king bed was really small they wanted to change, but the hotel was booked up. Breakfast isn't included in the room rate, although there is a restaurant adjoined to the hotel with decent, average-priced food. I think it was around $10.00 for an omelette. We expected a better hotel and even thought "This is it" but it was reasonably princed. There are so many SF hotels, we should have taken more time to find a nicer place. It wasn't necessarily bad, just not any thing great, either.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: TeacherMan
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn from August 1-8. I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor customer reviews. We were very pleased with our choice. The location is perfect. Five minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and a short walk to cable cars, busses, and many great restaurants. Staff and concierge were very helpful. We had a courtyard room and it was very quiet. Weather was very cool at night and we slept with the window slightly open. Very comfortable for sleeping and we never used the air conditioning, even though we are from Michigan and keep it on in our home for most of the summer (like today, when it is 90 and humid). The coffee and biscotti offered in the morning is a good way to start the day, and the free wine hour from 5 to 6 is very pleasant, although we were so busy we only attended twice. I would definately return to the Tuscan.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal with lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: Lins94
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Tuscan Inn. After going back and forth trying to decide whether to stay at the more expensive Argonaut, we chose the Tusan Inn and were very happy with the choice. It is set back just far enough from the wharf area that you feel you can get away from the tourist madhouse, but close enough that in five minutes you can be at pier 39 or the cannery. The location was great! We were able to hop on the cable car right around the coner, we walked to Lombard Street, Coit Tower, the square, the marina, and the wharf many times. The rooms were celan and well kept. The bathroom was just okay, but for the price we survived. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and the evening cocktail hour was a great touch with many choices. We enjoyed a meal at the ajoining Pescatore's and found it to be affordable and delicious. The hotel is just across the way from Safeway, Trader Joe's, and Branes and Nobles. We were able to grab danish or donuts in the morning at Safeway which was a great way to save on money. I felt the hotel had a lot of charm and would highly recommend it for anyone staying in the wharf area.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived before check in and was told that two courtyard rooms were reserved for my party and available at 3:00 check in time. I returned at 3:40 and my rooms were not even ready. After waiting in the lounge area for 10-15 minutes, we were given our room keys. Upon entering our rooms, we see that our view was not of the courtyard, but of a brick wall. I called the desk and explained the situation. Their response was that there were no courtyard rooms available. Why they promise two rooms with a courtyard view, when they don't even have one to offer is beyond me. Our next disappointment was that we didn't even have towels. Again, I called housekeeping and their response was, yea we know! Their cavalier attitude gave one the impression that towels might not necessarily be one of the hotel's priorities. When the towels were finally delivered, I never got the correct number I requested. On the second night I left a note for housekeeping to provide 3 full sets of towels, again, I was shorted. When you pay for the extra third person, it's a bit discouraging to have to beg for the necessary accomodations. Complimentary wine was good, however, the second morning there was no hot water or coffee available in their lobby. I will say that the beds were comfortable and select staff were friendly, but definitely not enough incentive to try my luck again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fisherman's Wharf has to be the best area for a tourist to stay in San Francisco and the Tuscan Inn is in easy walking distance of Pier 39, the Alcatraz Ferry, the main promenade of Fisherman's Wharf and the Cable Car line. Our room (2 x Double Beds) was clean and of reasonable size. The Foyer / Lounge was very attractive and filled with comfortable seating. The complimentary early evening (5 to 6pm) Wine reception was a nice feature - choose from 3 x wines, beer and soft drinks. Did not try the attached Cafe Pescatore or the 24-hour fitness centre (not complimentary) that was one block away. For those used to British Hotels: I stayed in four US Hotels three including the Tuscan had in-room Filter Coffee Makers and the forth had nothing. The Coffee Makers are just that (no Tea, Hot Chocolate or Biscuits). At the Tuscan these were available (complimentery) in the Foyer / Lounge during the Breakfast period. Think of an up-market Travel Inn with an attractive lobby

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Cannot imagine better in the Warf!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited San Francisco on a recent vacation and, under the advise of a trusted friend, decided to stay at the Best Western Tuscan Inn. I have stayed in many hotels, and could not imagine finding a better place. The room was inviting, the staff tremendously helpful and courteous, and the concierge was the best in the business. He led us to restaurants with views you couldn't find unless you were a local! I would highly recommend this hotel, and can't wait to visit it again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Bella! Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have travelled the world and stayed in hundreds of hotels in the US, Europe and Asia. This hotel ranks among the top. The service was excellent, the room was terrific, the bed was incredibly comfortable and the hotel is centrally located to all the major attractions of San Francisco. We particularly enjoyed the complimentary wine hour that the hotel features every day from five to six. We went on two day-long tours when in San Francisco including a day in the Napa/Sonoma valleys and the company we used is just down the block from the hotel so we didn't even have to wait for the pick-up bus. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dobre! dobre!-----great ! great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As the commercial for rice -a- roni states " A San Francico TREAT " ! The staff and faclilties were great !

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Stay on the Warf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would have to recommend the Tuscan Inn to anyone looking to stay in San Francisco. My Wife and I did not know what to expect after booking a last minute trip. The staff was friendly and very knowledgeable about everything we asked. The wine hour each day was a great way to relax after a busy day exploring the city. We look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay near the wharf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Tuscan Inn was a great place to stay when visiting Fisherman's Wharf and all that San Francisco has to offer. The entire staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. The concierge directed us to amazing restaurants and wonderful little establishments that we never would have found on our own. The accessibilty to the wharf was an attractive factor in where to stay without compromising on an elegant facility. The Tuscan Inn is a top-notch hotel and I will definitely return and also recommend highly to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Tuscan Inn made our trip to San Francisco, as well as our dogs. We enjoyed our comfortable, clean room, as well as the excellent location. We felt very welcomed by the freindly staff that was able to help us with all of our questions and needs. Plus, our dog was very loved and welcomed by everyone! Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A NO WORRY VACATION.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: JULY 16TH-JULY 23RD 2005. MY husbandand I stayed at this wonderful place called THE TUSCAN INN FISHERMAN'S WHARF SAN FRANCISCO CALIFORNIA. I must say the place was wonderful by that I mean, the desk people were so helpful. The cleaning people did a great job of always making sure the place felt like home. My self I have a thing about sanitary conditions and fresh linens so that was very nice for us.The location was a nice surprise as the cable cars are around the corner, buses available easily.The staff has a wine get-to-gether for the patrons in the lobby every evening at 5-6 p.m. so if one chooses they can sit and relax and visit with other's.The hotel gave us the feeling like we were the only people that mattered, so you know they must make everyone feel like that.If I could have my children and our friends stay any where in that city it would most certainly be THE TUSCAN INN FISHERMANS WHARF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at the Tuscan Inn recently. A wonderful property in a super convenient location. I highly recommend this property to anyone looking for a comfortable stay in a quality hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn on the recommendation of a friend who loved the place.We came to SF to celebrate Father's Day with our family. What great service. After flying from NYC we were very tired upon arrival. The front desk was quick and easy. once in our room we immediately showered. We phoned housekeeping for additional towels and they arrived before I hung up the telephone. Great free "coffee and" in the morning and a very pleasant afternoon complimentary wine. Extremely comfortable rooms, with minibar, TV, alarm clock, ironing board and iron, moring newspaper.We definitely appreciate the friends recommendation of this great hotel. We will be back next time we come to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: bche
Reviews.Content: What a great place. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The room was clean and comfortable. We loved the convenience of having a great restaurant right next door. Definitely a destination when in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Suprise for my wife”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, great location, wonderful service and dog friendly. My wife and I had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay was fantastic! Our rooms were so much nicer then we expected and the staff was friendly and helpful. We had wonderful recommendations for restaurants and bars. Alos, the food in the adjoining restaurant was very good! We were very pleasently surprised to find such great value in Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've had the opportunity to stay at the Tuscan Inn 3 times in the last year. Everytime we visit we enjoy it more and more. The personalized service always stands out and if we have a problem, it is immediately remedied. The last visit we arrived late and the front desk assisted my family in getting a late dinner from the attached restaurant, (which was very tasty). The location could not be any better. Just 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars and convenient restaurants. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “had a blast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Francisco and we had a great time. The location of the Tuscan Inn is the best-right on Fishermans Wharf (2 blocks from the water). The staff is wonderful, they had knowledge of the city and the area and helped us in so many ways. We plan on another stay next year.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: sdhaughey
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Tuscan Inn and absolutely loved it! Our room with 2 double beds was beautiful. (Contrary to the comments of a previous reviewer, I never saw the rooms advertised anywhere as having 2 queen beds!) The room was not large, but was average size for a room in San Francisco. The staff was friendly, courteous, professional and knowledgeable. You cannot beat the location! You are walking distance to all of the Fisherman's Wharf attractions, as well as a quick cable car or street car ride to most points in the city. The evening wine hour is a great idea, allowing guests to mingle with each other while enjoying complimentary beverages! All in all I would say this was one of finest hotel stays I have ever experienced. I highly recommend the Tuscan Inn to anyone looking for a great visit to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever anywhere”
Reviews.Author: zenma
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 4pm, and there were no towels in the room. I was told they would send some up. An hour later I was told they would send some up. I was told this until 8pm, when I was told they were out of towels in the hotel until 9pm. I had also reserved a room with 2 queen beds and got a room with 2 large twin beds, not even full sized where my wife and I could not sleep in one bed (we are not that large either). I had read a prior review complaning about the fact the hotel had run out of the "free" morning biscotti's as promised to quests. That did not happen to us. They sliced the biscotti's into 1/4 inch slices so all quests were assured to get a crumb, if they wanted (no one was taking them) I asked to speak to a manager the night we aRRIVED TO DISCUSS THE TOWELS. i WAS TOLD NONE WERE AVAILABLE. i asked again the next morning, and was once again told none were available that day. I called again the next day upon returning home (long distance at my expense) and kept getting looped to the 800 central reservations numver. When I asked one of those people if I could speak to a manager or supervisor I was told none were available to talk to customers. I left home at 5am the night of my stay and paid extra to get what we thought was going to be a nice room in the central warf area of the city the night before taking our son to Stanford for summer school and have a night on the town. After driving all day, and not only not being able to take a shower until after 9pm (arriving at 4pm) but being lied to every hour and forced to wait for towels based upon these lies, our "night on the town" was reduced to waiting in a very small, dingy hotel room with beds we could not all even sleep on. My wife and son rotated trying to sleep on a small chair. I have never in my life stayed at a hotel, especially one this expensive that did not even have towels for their guests, lied about that and the bed sizes, and were so un-helpful witrh anything we needed. There are plenty of other hotelsd in this area, any of them have to be better than this was.

Reviews.Title: “forget this place”
Reviews.Author: Cyn#1
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed here on July 9, 2005. Checked in at 4:00 p.m. and went to take showers (we'd been on the road since 4:15 a.m.) - there were not enough towels in the room for the three of us - though we paid for the three of us. We were told the towels would be sent right up - waited an hour, then called again, waited an hour, then called again and told not till after 9 p.m. because they ran out of towels. (They lied to us about it). What's up with that? We paid for a room with not enough towels? We had two double beds - and since I sleep with my husband at home on a double bed, I was amazed at how small these were - I measured to find them to be 5 inches shorter in width - so what you get is two large twins - with extra length, not width. Good luck sleeping with two people in one bed this small. False advertisement here...The heater/air conditioner unit is an arm's length from the bed, and it was so stuffy in the room, you had to have the unit on all the time - only it blew in your face when you tried to sleep...my nose burned. We didn't get much sleep with the paper thin walls. In the morning there was coffee and biscotti in the lobby - The biscotti is chopped into 1 inch pieces...whoopee. The location is good here, but that is all the good I can say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Batchyboo
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Arrived after a long journey and went to our room on the fourth floor. One of the smallest rooms in any Best Western I have stayed in. Decore was nice and clean, beds comfortable and we did have a fridge. However window was wide open and was broken. We asked at front desk and then said they would send someone up in 10 minutes, over 1 hour later no sign so we asked to move rooms. The concierge was useless - un-helpfull and a waste of time. Told us about a vegaterian restruant that had closed down years ago, a dry cleaners that was also shut. So we are in our new room, no double glazing and god could you here the traffic. Dumper trucks, buses etc all from 4am....not much sleep at all. Over rated and over priced. The only good hting was the location. It should be ashamed to call it's self a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Why the high ratings for this place?”
Reviews.Author: KelleyfromOhio
Reviews.Content: Best Western website for this hotel advertised refrigerators in every room. Because of some special food needs, we booked this hotel with this understanding, plus it had received highest rating - best hotel in Wharf area. Were here July6-9 (still here...unfortunately....) Got to hotel, disappointed in the incredibly small rooms, but location is great. Website also said rooms had been recently redecorated - guess they forgot our 2 rooms - kind of shabby. Cheap furniture. Outdated outlets - couldn't plug cell phone chargers in except one place under desk. Hair dryer in bathroom constantly fell in sink from it's holder when anyone used the door to our room. Finally unplugged it and left it down on the TINY sink are space. Worst part was no fridges in room as advertised. They had quasi mini-bars in dorm-size fridges but we were told by front desk that we could not empty them out without being charged for the contents. We asked to speak to a manager, but after an hour of waiting no one came to talk to us about this. Wanted to get on with being tourists so we decided not to wait. Asked next morning - still told we couldn't empty them - offered to pull up website on our laptop which still showed that fridges came with rooms but they didn't want to see it - they just wanted to say that there rooms never had fridges and didn't know why BW advertised that they did. They told me I would have to wait for maids to come to take stuff out of fridge later in the day - like i'm really going to waste tourist time for this. I BEGGED them to be able to just remove the things myself and leave them on the desk - they said they'd have to talk to a manager - i said great when would they be in - they said they had no idea!!!!! Totally unwilling to help us in any way. WORST BW we've ever stayed in as far as service goes.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: bbtodd
Reviews.Content: second time staying at the Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's wharf. Went on a 15 day Alaskan cruise from San Francisco. The Tuscan Inn was a short walk to the cruise ship terminal. Got a cab for the luggage. We stayed here about 15 years ago and they still have the wine and cheese from 5:00 - 6:00 p.m. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: smb0903
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the cosy reception with the open burning fireplace but that's where it stops. It was not worth the Â£115 ROOM ONLY per night that we paid for 4 nights - absolutely not ! ! ! ! If you want to stay in Fishermans Wharf stay at The Argonaut. Alcatraz is worth a visit but I would recommend booking as far in advance as you can and do the night tour which is fascinating. I wouldn't recommend this hotel - it really isn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lexi917
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn over Memorial Day weekend. It was great - very pretty, clean, nice staff, great wine hour every evening. The room was a little small but it was very nicely decorated and very clean. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: juxie
Reviews.Content: PROS The location is wonderful. Two short blocks to the cable cars, 1 block to the electrics trolleys and steps to the bus. We never used our car to explore the city. Pier 39, Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, the Cannery and Ghirardelli all an easy walk (with kids). Our room was very quiet as well. It was nice not having to listen to cars and buses throughout the night or other guest. CONS We were initially given a smoking room although I requested nonsmoking and then the desk clerk argued with me that it was not a smoking room, but just on a smoking floorâ€¦ there was an ashtray in the room. They did switch rooms eventually and even the bellhop thought it smelled horrid in the room. Small rooms, we could barely fit two adults and two children in the room. We also did not find them very kids friendly. There were only a couple of families with children there. The concierge was knowledgeable but it was like squeezing water out of a stone to get any information out of him. He also looked like you had interrupted him if you sat down to ask a question. Overall though, the location was great and the hotel was nice. I would consider staying there again if I returned without the children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KSutton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for 3 nights in April. It is in a great location, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the managers wine hour is a welcome bonus. There was a problem though that the hotel did not receive our request for a twin room and we ended up in a double for the first night. Despite 3 requests and 3 promises for a rollaway bed, it never arrived. The night front desk personnel were disinterested and could not be bothered, although the day personnel were lovely and sorted another room for us. If you plan to be out and about most of the time you are in SF, I'd definately recommend the hotel. But if you want to relax in the hotel, then you'd be better choosing somewhere else. By the way, the hotel's restaurant is great. The food is lovely and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: yellowpony
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. While this was an older hotel, it has been kept up well and the rooms were satisfactory. The morning Starbucks coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. I would not recommend the hotel resaurant. We ate breakfast there one day and were appalled at the slow service, rude waitstaff, and overpriced breakfast food. There are plenty of other places to eat within walking distance of the hotel. Overall, we would stay here again (just avoid the restaurant)!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mwano
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took two trips to San Fran in 2004 and stayed at the best western both times. The first was for a week in January. The hotel location was great. We flew in to San Fran airport, took the BART downtown, and then took a cable car to a stop 1 block from the hotel. We didnt have or need a car so we didnt have to deal with parking a car I believe it is $30 a day-- par for the city. The hotel is clean and neat, our room was clean and comfortable. If I had to be critical the room could use a little updateing, but not a big deal. The front desk was friendly, however not terribly knowledgeable--I would assume high turnover. The location is great, if your an active person you can walk everywhere from this hotel, in fact we took a long run up the shore --crissy field and accross the golden gate bridge. North Beach starts a block away and heads north, we skipped the touristy fishermans warf area. Restaurants are everywhere, however we did not eat at the Tuscan restaurant in the hotel. As far as convenience--the cable car stop is 1 block away and that along with the outstanding bus system will get you everywhere you need to go. We plan on visiting the city often, and we plan on staying at this location for the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms,location & service”
Reviews.Author: mrstuckey
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent the day in San Fran. We stopped there before our week long trip to Napa. It was wonderful. The rooms were great and the Service wonderful. They did have a Wine/Beer serving at 5pm which was nice. It is located 2 blocks from the wharf which was outstanding considering parking is hard to come by. The only complaint I have is the Valet service. Not that it was horribly but the pull in nook is not very big. We waited about 10 mins before being helped but we were on vacation, So what's the hurry, right??! Enjoy your stay. We did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - Appalling Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms and building are quite nice - location is excellent. The front desk is the worst service I have had in years. It took 45 minutes to check in and we didn't wait in line. While we were waiting, the desk clerk stopped helping us to talk to other guests, never apologized for the interruption, and never looked up once. He was also training serveral others in the same manner - it was the night manager!!!!! Dreadful service!!!! The rooms were clean and well appointed - the maid staff were excellent. I just recieved my credit card bill, there are two extra charges for a total of $20.00. When I called, the desk clerk mumbled into the phone and I had to ask if I had the right number.. Then in a snotty tone, he imformed me that "you know, accounting is only here during the day." I would only stay here again if they changed management.

Reviews.Title: “great location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: soccermom327
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Tuscan Inn April 20-25 in two connecting rooms. The reasonable price of the hotel allowed us to book 2 rooms, thus giving the 4 of us a bit more space and 2 bathrooms (with teenage girls, this is important). As others have said, the beds are wonderful. Plenty of room in the bathroom. The air conditioning unit in one room was noisy, but nothing terrible. The concierge was helpful, and the Happy Hour by the fireplace was a bonus. Now that this is a Kimpton Hotel, I expect that it will be upgraded a bit in the near future and will feel like less of a Best Western. The location is perfect for walking to most attractions. We visited Alcatraz, Coit Tower, Cable Car museum, Lombard Street, Muir Woods and Sausalito. We ate dinner in the hotel restaraunt 3 times, mainly because we were exhausted at night, and enjoyed the food. We discovered a fabulous restaurant in Chinatown - Hunans Home - 622 Jackson Street. I highly recommend it. And reasonable, compared to other restaurants we visited. Although we come from a big city ourselves, we had three negative observations of SF: expensive, dirty and far more homeless people than we've ever seen in Phila. That's not to say that we won't return - just be prepared, especially if you bring children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCLScituateMA
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Tuscan Inn and have nothing but rave reviews for this hotel! The location was perfect. Walking distance to Cable Cars,Wharf, Bus 47 and F Line. Great restaurant with a friendly staff. Everyone was pleasant and very helpful. Nice clean rooms and a spacious bathroom. We are anxious to return! Mary and Jack from Scituate MA

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DDMOttawa
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel. It is about a 5 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Good base for exploring local sights. Generally very quiet hotel. Wine at 5 pm was a nice treat. Room was slightly bigger than a typical room. While I have no substantive complaints about this hotel, areas for improvement include: $29/day to park a car seems like a lot to me. The plumbing was a bit noisy. Otherwise, a pleasant place to stay in a good part of SF.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my gosh, the Best beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights last week and were very pleased. I booked the hotel through Priceline at $85 per night and feel like we got a great deal. We were given a room with a king bed, and a peekaboo view of Coit Tower that was quiet and well kept. The lobby is intimate and charming, and always has a bit of activity. Very comfortable place to be. The staff was beyond kind and helpful. The best thing was the BED. It was heavenly. I have back and neck issues, and this is the first time in years I have woken up without pain. I could have slept all day if not for the fact that we had many things we wanted to see and do in our short stay. The room is small....I didn't realize how small it would be, especially with 2 adults and one teenage son (he slept on a rollaway). I wouldn't hesitate to stay again, but just my husband and myself, if our son came, I'd want to upgrade to one of their suites. Only 2 negatives. The air conditioning in our room was essentially non-existant, the room was a bit stuffy and warmer than we would have liked. And the hotel restaurant food and service was (in our opinion) awful. Thankfully we only ate one breakfast there! Our last visit (18 months ago) we stayed at the Hyatt at FW and while it was "fine," The Tuscan Inn has much more charm, and a terrific staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in June 2004 and were not disappointed After reading reviews decided to stay. Reviews were correct. We found the staff friendly and the drinks in the evening an added bonus. Central to everywhere and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Bergs
Reviews.Content: Big, clean comfortable room and a great location. Free wireless internet in the room - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “I Don't often give compliments”
Reviews.Author: caniscorpus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights in March 2005. We had a room facing into the Courtyard. Quiet and well designed. Best feature was the freebie drinks in reception from 5-6pm. We met couples from all parts of the world and had interesting chats over several glasses of wine. Don't bother with the Italian style cafe attached to the hotel. The best and nearest breakfast is at Wharf Inn on Beach St, a block away (Chinese run). Another English couple we know has stayed here since our departure and they too confirm our opinion that this is a lovely hotel, well situated for all the delights of Fishermans Wharf

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, fantastic location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 2 nights in march, I was concermed by the number of comments regarding the size of the rooms - yes they are a little on the small size but as there was only 2 of us plus my toddler daughter we found them to be more than adequate and very family friendly (particularly liked the lock on the mini bar/fridge door which housed a seemlessly endless supply of candy!) the beds were VERY comfortable and we had a great room which overlooked the street below with the bay in the distance (NOT overly noisy at all considering the location) the valet and the porters all very friendly and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for any of the staff! overall we had a fantastic stay and i would not hesitate to book here again, being a travel agent i am very picky by the nature of work i am in, and i would DEFINATELY reccomend this hotel as a first option to any of my clients who wanted to stay in San Fran. i would also urge other vistors to prebook Alacatraz with Blue and Gold Fleet direct on there website before they arrive in San Fran as you can pick up your tickets at the self service machine without the miles of queues!

Reviews.Title: “Everything appeared okay”
Reviews.Author: Tellte
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently. Everything went well. I really liked the place. The hotel had been pre booked so on check out I had nothing else to pay. However, when I returned home, I discovered the hotel had charged my credit card $1.63 without my knowledge the day after check out. It is only a small sum of money but I was very concerned as I had not stolen anything from the hotel or used any of the stuff in the bedroom bar! The hotel now claims however that "items were removed". The only others with access to this food and drink were the cleaning staff. I suggest to anyone staying here to make sure they know what is being taken out of their credit card before they leave this hotel. I am a very honest person who has stayed in many hotels over Europe and America and I have never before experienced an insult like this. My credit card company are supportive and refunded my money but be aware. There could have been a lot more money involved. All I have is my word that I removed no items!

Reviews.Title: “Just returned”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtoo
Reviews.Content: I will be back! I have been staying in San Fran for a while as i visit my college aged son. This hotel is the first i have felt totally comfortable in. The staff is friendly and the hotel itself is not what it appears from the outside. The Kimpton Group has taken it over and i believe, have given it a shakedown.....down comforters......gorgeous lobby and friendy restaurant and lounge. The food at the "Cafe" is quite "hotel-like" but the service makes up for it.....plus SF is a food town! So many other places to explore other than your hotel! This place geets major reccomendations from me. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and brilliant location near Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Valjf5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Fishermans Wharf Hotel in June 2005 and really loved everything about it. A warm welcome on arrival and a nice suite although the rooms were quite compact, however I understand this is common in Fishermans Wharf . Our suite was located on the inner courtyard of the Hotel and lovely and quiet away from any possible traffic noise. Can highly recommend the Restaurant attached to the Hotel for both breakfast and dinner. All in all a great Hotel to stay in at a reasonable cost close to all the action on Fishermans Wharf. Free internet use in the reception area was a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Tuscan Inn and had a great experience. The staff were helpful, it was in a great location, and was very charming. The complimentary evening wine reception was great, a nice chance to find out what's good or not good to do. Will probably stay when return in May.

Reviews.Title: “The good outweighed the bad”
Reviews.Author: Warneringyou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here in January 2005. I believe this is a pet friendly motel, which would account for the overwhelming smell of animal urine which nearly knocked us over every time we entered our room! The motel was full being over New Years, so we were not able to be moved to another room. Apart from that, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were nicely decorated, and the beds were very comfortable. There is also internet access for a fee in the main lobby. We would probably stay here again, as the location is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic San Fran !!”
Reviews.Author: rogerrab
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks (which I gather is quite a long time!!!) at the Tuscan Inn in Sept 04 & had a great time.The hotel was lovely - really clean with friendly helpful staff & fantastically situated in between North Beach & Fishermans Wharf. We had a room facing the inner courtyard on the first floor & found it both quiet & very comfortable.We really could not find any fault with either the hotel or San francisco at all, & would not hesitate to stay there again. ps....do not miss Alcatraz - book in advance !!!

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain Hotel With Class”
Reviews.Author: honu-lover
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Best Western Tuscan Inn, Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco the week before Christmas. I booked the room through Expedia, and because of this, the hotel wouldn't credit my Best Western Gold Card with either points or air miles. The price was great for a small but comfortable room. We did have a room on the 3rd floor over the sidewalk and street of North Point. The windows are crank operated, and thin, so there was some street noise from city buses from about 5:30 in the morning until about 10 at night. We are heavy sleepers and it didn't really bother us, as it seems to have bothered other reviewers. The hotel is an Italian mediterrean theme everywhere, entrance, lobby, garden courtyard, restaurant, and rooms. The staff are 100% present and attentive to your every need. Their friendliness reminded me very much of the Aloha spirit at Hawai`ian resorts and hotels. The lobby is small and cozy with a gas log fireplace, perfect for taking away the chill after those cool, foggy walks down to the waterfront. Guests actually talk to one another during morning coffee, and the free hour of wine at 5 pm. I highly recommend this hotel, for both quality and economy. We bought some of our food at one of the 3 grocery stores a block from the hotel. I'ts about 2 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, 2 blocks to the cable car turn-around, 1 block to the F-Line trolley car, and 3 blocks to Pier 39. I liked to start and end my day walking out to the sea lions on the K pier at Pier 39. I also took the Blue and Gold ferry out to Alcatraz, and suggest everyone visiting S.F. see this sight for both the ferry boat ride, and for the rich history lesson. Another of my day trips was to rent a car and drive down to Monterrey Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: glasgow1-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November '04, and loved it! Convenient for all wharfs, and trips to Alcatraz. VERY helpful staff allowed us to check in 4 hours early, and continued to impress! Complementary wine tasting in the evening was a bonus too!! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “top marks for the tuscan”
Reviews.Author: allancabbie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, great location not any problems what so ever. Keep up the good work!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: fortunakim
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location with a stick, but the "suite" was awfully small. The thermostat gave us a choice of baste or chill until frosty. At $80-100 this is a 4 star but at $150 a night I was looking for a little more.

Reviews.Title: “this is the place”
Reviews.Author: whatayanuts
Reviews.Content: the tuscan inn was a great place to spend a week since it is located away from the noise and action of the wharf but also close to the cable cars to travel around the city. our early flight arrival actually let us into the room before check in which was the first of many pluses of this hotel. the hotel has a wine hour each day which is a great way to relax after a day of touring and also meet others. friendly service was evident each day and the gentleman conceirge was patient and helpful. there is a grocery store right around the corner which was nice to grab some juice and pastry rather than a full scale breakfast. i could not recommend this place more and will return to the tuscan on my next vacation to california.

Reviews.Title: “tuscan inn was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jeanburkeHull
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights last week. the rooms are small but very nice. the staff was very friendly and the location is great. got the "best rate" and it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the Tuscan Inn. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Coffee in the morning was great. "Happy hour" from 5-6 was a great touch. We enjoyed drinking wine and meeting some of the other guests. Very close to Fishermans Wharf. Basically 2 blocks or so to the water. The only minor downside, as a few others have mentioned, is the bathroom/sink lighting. Room is a little small, but was totally fine for two people with two full sized suit cases. We will stay at this same hotel the next time we are in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: TheBaron
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in San Francisco at the Tuscan Inn and thought I would give my views on an excellent stay. Had picked this hotel on reviews on this site and a couple of others and I was pleased with my choice. The room itself was medium size - we were on the 4th floor which was nice and quiet , the chiller was useful and the bed most comfortable - surprising for a hotel. The location is 1st class , a few minutes from the Wharf and all its attractions , and close to a Safeways Supermarket ( open 7 to 12 pm ) and handily placed for buses , trams and cable cars. The staff seemed pleasant and efficient whenever I had dealings with them , indeed the only quibble I had was that the bell boys at the front were a little undermanned on occasions but I will not let this alter my view of the hotel overall. Don't miss the complimentary drinks and give the Prescatore a visit as it is good value. If you want some breakfast off site then I would recommend the IHOP nearby , although it gets busy at the weekends so you may have to wait. My final thought - 1 recurring image during this week ( 1 Nov - 7 Nov ) was the staff demonstarations outside a number of prominent hotels , many were day long vigils and many were noisy - the good news was that the Tuscan was not 1 of them !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tuscan Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tuscan Inn four nights, from October 16 through the 19th, 2004. The room was small but very clean and nicely decorated. There were sliding shutters and two windows which could be opened for fresh air. The location is perfect for the first-time visitor and Fisherman's Wharf has a lot of nice things to do and places to eat. Transportation is very close by and we rode cable cars, streetcars and buses anywhere we wanted to go, from Little Italy to the Golden Gate Bridge. The concierge even gave us a pair of City Passes someone had turned in with four more days still on them, so we rode everywhere for free. The staff was friendly and the coffee & biscotti snack in the morning and the wine in late afternoon were both very nice. The lobby is calm and looks out on potted flowers in a small courtyard. Soft Italian music played in the lobby and it was very pleasant. The concierge can arrange many different tours and provided maps to help us get around the city. We rented a car from Budget, which was just a block away and very convenient. I would definitely go back to the Tuscan Inn and can easily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Shattered our image of a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last week of September 2004. It was a lovely hotel and the front desk staff was so warm and welcoming to us as we arrived--tired and still on NY time. The room was pretty with plantation shutters and a view of a small courtyard. We were travelling with our 2 kids (4 & 6). Not the best place to be with kids--smallish rooms, overpriced restaurant (though good food) and no pool, but I would stay there again if it were only the 2 of us. It was a very crowded time at the hotel--several tour busses (much older people--we're in our 30s). The wine reception in the evening had potential to be nice, but crowded with older folks, walkers, etc., in a rather smallish lobby. The coffee and biscotti in the a.m. was nice, too. The best thing was the location, close walk to the wharf and other places. Good (and inexpensive) sushi place around the corner--don't be deterred by appearances, and helpful to have a Walgreens across the street. We were pleasantly suprised at this "Best Western" as we always thought of Best Westerns as motel-type places.

Reviews.Title: “Easily Accessible to Wharf”
Reviews.Author: patty0240
Reviews.Content: Close proximity to Fisherman's Wharf. Room on the small side but nicely decorated with extremely comfortable bed. Did not like the bathroom light shining into bedroom (no door in alcove). Staff accommodating and friendly. Enjoyed morning coffee and 5:00 p.m. cocktail hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Robbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and would definately recommend the hotel. Check-in can get busy although we got lucky and only queued for a couple of minutes. Check-in clerk wasn't particularly friendly as he was busy but he was polite. The room was a good size and the location, being just a couple of blocks from the Wharf was excellent. The afternoon wine/beer was a great idea, as was the free morning tea/cofee. Note to those with a car, overnight valet parking is $26 but right next door the car park is $15 and it takes about 30 seconds to get from your car back to the hotel - why pay $26? Very greedy by the hotel. We had a small problem that the hot water at about 5pm had often run out (because many guest get ready for the free drinks hour). A bit frustrating but not enough to spoil our stay. All in all, definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CrashD
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Tuscan Inn. It is very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf and you can easily get to any other locations in the city via the Muni system. The cable cars and buses are all within walking distance. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. We took alot of tours that picked us up right at the hotel. California Jeep Tours ( 2-5 people) for the city tour and The Great Pacific Tour Company ( 14 passenger van) for Carmel/Monterey and Muir woods/Sausilito. Both of these tours were much better than a big bus tour. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the bed! It was the most comfortable bed,almost hated to get out of it. The room was somewhat small but well appointed. Great location,close to everything. Wonderful coffee! Staff was very nice. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcj
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Tuscan Inn. Hotel is nice and clean, in a very convenient location, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Only negative is the bathroom area is a little small. I will stay again next time I am in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but small room”
Reviews.Author: curliegirl
Reviews.Content: My first impression when I walked into the room was - this is it?? It was extremely small. Also, if you are planning to sleep in, don't. They don't have those dark curtains in most hotels. They have large mini-blinds that don't keep out the light. Every morning we got up around 7:ooam and had to put pillows over our heads to sleep any later. Which was difficult because the garbage truck (?) could be heard almost every morning around 5 or 6 am. Ouch!! The location was good. Very close to the wharf. We walked down there almost every night. We stayed 5 nights. Wasn't really impressed with the staff. Nobody went out of their way to make us feel welcome. It wasn't a terrible or bad experience, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location for Fisherman's Wharf and a hotel with a homely, personal touch. The room was clean, warm and comfortable but don't expect a great view from any of the rooms. The use of the foyer for free drinks between 5-6pm was popular especially with fellow Brits! Found the staff helpful especially the lady concierge who supplied maps and bus routes for Lincoln Park. If walking to Ghiradelli Square I would highly recommend stopping off at the Buena Vista Cafe in the evening for an Irish coffee....or two!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend accommodation”
Reviews.Author: teresahild
Reviews.Content: Tuscan Inn, Fisherman's Wharf district, San Francisco. This hotel gets a 4 star recommendation from us. It had character and hospitality that belied a typical Best Western chain. The complimentary evening wine reception, in the lobby ended up being quite lovely, and gave the Inn more of a European style accommodation. For first timers this Best Western Inn should be considered as a great place to stay as you explore the beautiful City by the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Superb. Lovely hotel and excellent location. Rooms (although I suppose small by US standards) were cosy but had everything you wanted inc. heating (yes in August!) and a clean bathroom. We were fortunate enough to have a courtyard room which I gather is a better option. Free coffee and biscotti in the morning is a nice touch but we never made it back in time for free beer and wine from 5-6pm. The valet guy was extremely helpful and very friendly but the check in/guest services staff on the whole uninterested and unhelpful. The concierge said we stood no chance of getting tickets to Alcatraz (walked around the corner and found an agency selling them) - perhap I should've offered him a $20 tip?! Tip - book NOW for Alcatraz - www.bluegoldferries.com - for $16 pp rather than the inflated package costs of tour agencies. We got stuck with our car hire overnight and paid $25 to park - bit steep as there is a car park next door for less than that - doh! Overall though a top hotel in an excellent location. Make sure you make the 15-20 min walk up Stockton Ave to Little Italy and don't get totally distracted by Fishermans Wharf!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: newarkdelawaregin
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 8 nights here and loved it. The bed was outstanding; room and lobby were very attractive; and we enjoyed the Italian restaurant adjoining the hotel. We thought the location was excellent--attractions in San Francisco are not all in one spot, so no hotel will be adjacent to everything you want to see. We were able to take a bus or cable car to the few places that were too far to walk. Golden Gate Park on a Sunday was our favorite place--there's an entire universe of activities going on there

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to the action; however, I did not like the location - while it was close to the Wharf, the area of the hotel was seedy. If I were to return I would try downtown and take public transportation to Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: myrt17
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! The location could NOT be better - we were 2 blocks from the Wharf!!! The room was small, but very inviting! The decor was very nice, down comforter, honor bar, etc. Our view was a brick wall next door, but we were only in the room at night so it didn't matter. The garden view would be a nice option if you can get it. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: nola1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Tuscan Inn. Hotel could not have been in a better location -- can't be beat!! Check in was smooth. Room ready and very comfortable. Nicely appointed rooms. A few suggestions: the wooden blinds don't keep the rooms dark enough once the sun rises, street noise was a bit loud (I bought a set of ear plugs.) The remote to our tv wasn't working (a new one was set up promptly.) The bed was comfortable with a nice thick comforter. The courtyard was in full bloom with beautiful flowering plants. We didn't get a chance to sample the afternoon wine as we were gone most of the day. Valets quick to get the car out of the garage and very helpful with directions. The hotel restaurant was a bit over priced but good service and good quality. I would stay there again and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Tuscan Inn on August 6-8, 2004. If you are visiting San Francisco for the first time or love Fisherman's Wharf, this hotel might be the place to stay. Very central to Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square....walkable...but need to ride a cable car or drive to Golden Gate bridge, Golden Gate park, Union Square or Chinatown. Hotel overall is very clean...room is small...but nice and clean...bathroom a little on the older side....not the greatest....service was okay....Lots of restaurants and shops nearby....Cafe Pescotta next to hotel....food was good....so check it out....Not the best of hotels...but not the worst either...above average.....if you want convenience stay here....if you want luxury go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in San Fran for 4 nights in the Tuscan Inn. The hotel was good, room was a little small but very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The location was excellent- so close to all the touristy things. The manager was a little grumpy when we first checked in but the rest of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Bring your woolies though coz San Fran is sooo cold!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday stay!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine95030
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay for my birthday last February! The service was good, the wine service each evening was very nice (though somewhat crowded with not a lot of sitting space) next to the fireplace, and the location was awesome! The room was small, but big enough for 2 adults and 1 child, and the yoga supplies were a nice touch. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 9th - 12th July. Comfortable hotel in very good location for ferries and Pier 39. Check in was quick and efficient. We had booked one room with a King size bed and a sofa bed for our 2 teenagers, thinking that when the sofa bed was put back during the day we would have more space than having 2 Queens. The price prohibited booking 2 rooms, which we had done in Vegas and Anaheim. We regretted it, as once the sofa bed was pulled out there was very little space and the maid did not put it back during the day. The sofa bed only had one blanket and my daughter was cold, so we requested an extra blanket but she was still cold, so we requested a duvet (quilt) but despite asking for it twice it never appeared. We glimpsed rooms containing 2 Queen beds and they seemed to have more space. Other than that it was a pleasant stay, the room was clean, our bed was really comfortable and the reception staff were friendly. The free morning coffee and evening wine reception were both good opportunities to meet other guests. The adjoining restaurant was very good and I agree with a previous reviewer that the Tiramasu was the best I had ever tasted. It is a pity they don't serve a buffet breakfast, so we went across the road to the Sheraton to the the restaurant there and the breakfast was very good. We also used the I-Hop which was just round the corner. Another dissapointment was that we had requested a courtyard view but could only see 2 pot plants up a corner, we could also hear noise from the street late at night. I think I would only stay here again if there was just 2 of us sharing a room, when I am sure it would be really comfortable. I agree with previous reviewer that you need warm clothes in San Francisco, the evening trip on the ferry to Alcatraz was very cold and windy and the morning trip to Muir woods was cold and damp! However, when the sun burned off the mist it was pleasantly warm. We booked a coach tour of Muir Woods and Sausalito and a jeep tour of San Francisco on the internet www.alcatraz.us and they were both excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation and the first stop was the Tuscan Inn. We have 4 children and we booked two adjoining rooms. I agree with other reviews that the rooms were on the smaller side, but we thought the hotel was great overall. The service was friendly and helpful at the front desk, but the conciege that I dealt with was not very good. I needed directions and she did not offer to find them for me. Other than that, it was a great place to stay, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl33
Reviews.Content: We had some not so good experiences with Best Western lately but we were presently surprised with this spot. We were greated by a very friendly and very helpful valet. Gave us some great local places to eat and things to see. Yes, the rooms were small for the money paid but the location was wonderful. Who stays in there room when you are in San Francisco? The cable car was just down the street and it made it very easy to get around. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK hotel,very small and tight room, nice lobby and good location if you want to be by all the tourists that get drawn to the wharf, the best part of the hotel- the restaurant downstairs on the corner, a little pricey but good breakfeasts and dinners. if you want to be more center city, check out other locations in a different area. Oh yeah - bring a sweatshirt sweater and warm jacket, it was pretty cold, something I would never expect for California but Mark Twain was right and according to our bus driver the best time to visit is in Sept/ Oct, when all the fog burns off and you can see the beautiful sun

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay and very convenient. It's located very near the Fishermans Wharf but a few blocks away, so it's still quiet. The rooms are nice but small and ask for a room that faces the courtyard. Every afternoon at 5 wine is served and it is a nice way to relax after a day of sightseeing. The hotel has a wonderful concierge who was extremely knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: FoodNetworkJunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed there this past weekend and LOVED it! The front desk was friendly and prompt. The 24 hr. valet was fast as well. We had an ultra clean, large corner room with views of Coit Tower and the Wharf. The location was perfect for a walk to the wharf and North Beach. Morning coffee and biscotti was a nice touch as well as the all you can drink free wine hour in the evening. You will not go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “A great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for 2 nites in June 2004 and found it quite appealing. A superb location, reasonable price, easy access to all the main sights and transit lines to get around the city. Clean and well-appointed rooms were a bit smallish for a family of four, (we used a King, sofa bed and rollaway), but as one previous reviewer indicated, we spent most of our time out and about. Excellent staff and service and the adjoining Italian restaurant was superb. A very nice lobby. A very cheerful staff and prompt service. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights! Location is great, very close to the wharf, easy walk to pier 39, less than a block's walk to the Cable Cars. The friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff can do or help you with just about anything you want or need. Parking was $26/day - free valet with on and off priv. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2004 for 3 nights. We loved the friendly, relaxed atmosphere and the opportunity to meet fellow guests at the "happy hour" in the hotel lobby each evening. The location of the hotel provides easy walks to numerous area attractions. Our room was a little small but very clean and well appointed. We enjoyed our stay there so much we returned for another night before leaving the San Francisco area. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deedeesquackquack
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March 2004 for 4 nights en-route to Australia. This hotel is absolutely brilliant, conveniently situated within walking distance for all tourist activities, The Wharf, Pier 39, cable cars etc. The rooms are very clean, spacious and quiet (ask for a quiet room). The manager's wine reception every evening between 5 - 6pm is a must where you can meet your fellow travellers if you are so inclined. The Cafe Pescatore (adjoining) is a must if you like Italian food. The pizzas and pastas are superb, and the tirasamu is out of this world! All in all, a fantastic hotel and a great location. I would definitely recommed this place and look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It (But Beware The Incompetent Desk Clerk)”
Reviews.Author: fergieam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn in August 2003 for 9 days. We loved the location and were able to walk to take a trolley to all of our desired local destinations. The hotel staff was great and housekeeping went so far as to organize the toiletries I had brough from home and had left scattered on the vanity. Our room decor was cute and given the small size of the room (as is the case with most SF hotel rooms), they used the space well and provided a charming and relaxing atmosphere. I am originally from the Monterey Bay area and my fiance is from Alabama. This was his first trip to CA and he fell in love and had an awesome time. The hotel restaurant is overpriced and average--I would advise venturing out. The only real problem I had was at checkout. I received my bill and paid it and was walking out the door when I noticed it was incorrect. They had overcharged me by at least $600. I turned around and went back to the front desk clerk who informed me that he could not make a correction and give me a refund but handed me a card with accounting's number on it. He advised me to call them once I returned to DC (because they were currently at lunch). Given that he couldn't understand what the error was when I was standing in front of him pointing it out. I was not about to leave and hash it out long distance over the phone. After 15 minutes of refusing to help me and telling me it was beyond his control and out of practice to make corrections at the desk, another woman (a manager?) overheard and asked what the problem was. I explained and she fixed it in 3 minutes and gave me a refund. Perhaps he was still in training or was the kind of person who liked to pretend he knew what he was doing and didn't want to ask for help. Outside of this incident, everyone else was great. Review your bill very closely!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was charming and we enjoyed our stay there! The location is terrific- away from the city hassle but within walking distance to many attractions. The rooms are small but attractive. The bathrooms are quite small compared to other hotels but adequate. The staff is friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that the restaurant does not open to 7 AM and they do not offer a buffet that the other hotels offer. We wind up going to the Hyatt at the next block for a great breakfast buffet as we had to get an early start for our booked tours. The nighly wine reception is also a chance to meet others and chat!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Tuscan Inn. Very clean, decorated very nicely, nice amenities such as an umbrella available for use (which we needed!), pleasant staff, close to the Wharf, just a few blocks to the cable car turnaround, Pier 39 shopping, & ferry boat tours.Travel desk very helpful. The restaurant is very expensive but good food. We would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf
HotelInfo.Address: 425 North Point Street, San Francisco, CA 94133
